original: mi'am ci dang klu dang drang srong la sogs pa rnams la sgrol ma 'byung ba la sogs pa'i rgyud bstan pa gang yin pa de ni mi 'am ci'i 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: mi'am ci dang klu dang drang srong la sogs pa rnams la sgrol ma 'byung ba la sogs pa'i rgyud bstan pa gang yin pa de ni mi 'am ci'i 'brel pa'o //
translated: Appearance and so forth to the kinnaras, nagas, rishis, and so forth.üîΩThe connection with humans is that she taught the Dharma in the center of

original: rab gsal zla ba la sogs pa'i rgyal po rnams yul dbus su grong khyer bco brgyad la chos gsungs pa de ni mi'i 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: rab gsal zla ba la sogs pa'i rgyal po rnams yul dbus su grong khyer bco brgyad la chos gsungs pa de ni mi'i 'brel pa'o //
translated: the country in the eighteen cities to the kings Prasenajit and so forth.

original: de ltar 'brel pa drug po rgyas pa de mdor bsdus pas rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar 'brel pa drug po rgyas pa de mdor bsdus pas rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: These six extensive connections are summarized in two:üîΩthe connection of word and meaning and the connection of teacher and

original: sgra dang don gyi 'brel pa dang / ston pa dang 'khor gyi 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: sgra dang don gyi 'brel pa dang / ston pa dang 'khor gyi 'brel pa'o //
translated: audience.

original: ji skad du //üîΩbstan bcos gang zag dbye ba yis //
analyzed: ji skad du // bstan bcos gang zag dbye ba yis //
translated: As it is said:üîΩThe treatise is considered to have two connections

original: 'brel pa rnam pa gnyis su 'dod //
analyzed: 'brel pa rnam pa gnyis su 'dod //
translated: By way of the divisions of the person.

original: bstan bcos sgra dang don 'brel pa //
analyzed: bstan bcos sgra dang don 'brel pa //
translated: The treatise is the connection of word and meaning,

original: 'chad dang nyan pa'i cig shos yin //
analyzed: 'chad dang nyan pa'i cig shos yin //
translated: And the other is the connection of the teacher and the audience.

original: gnyis pa'i bye brag drug yin te //
analyzed: gnyis pa'i bye brag drug yin te //
translated: The second has six divisions,

original: gcig nas gcig tu brgyud rim 'ongs //
analyzed: gcig nas gcig tu brgyud rim 'ongs //
translated: Which come from one to the other.

original: de bzhin gshegs sogs dbye ba yis //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs sogs dbye ba yis //
translated: The connection with the Tathagata and so forth

original: blo ldan grags pa rnams kyis gsungs //
analyzed: blo ldan grags pa rnams kyis gsungs //
translated: The wise ones are renowned.üîΩ

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The wise ones have declared.

original: 'dir ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'brel pa gcig pu yin te //
analyzed: 'dir ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'brel pa gcig pu yin te //
translated: Here, the connection is only with the Tathagatas,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lngas dbus kyi gtso bo la gsol ba btab pas so zhes 'brel pa bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lngas dbus kyi gtso bo la gsol ba btab pas so zhes 'brel pa bstan to //
translated: because the five Tathagatas make a request to the central principal one.

original: dgos pa zhes bya ba ni thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i rim pas bsgrub byar gyur pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po'i gnas thob pa'o //
analyzed: dgos pa zhes bya ba ni thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i rim pas bsgrub byar gyur pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po'i gnas thob pa'o //
translated: The purpose is the attainment of the state of Great Vajradhara, which is to be accomplished by the stages of listening, reflection, and meditation.

original: de thob nas khams gsum pa thams cad kyang de'i gnas su dgod pa ni bya ba byas pa'i phyir dgos pa'i dgos pa'o //
analyzed: de thob nas khams gsum pa thams cad kyang de'i gnas su dgod pa ni bya ba byas pa'i phyir dgos pa'i dgos pa'o //
translated: Having attained that, the establishment of all the three realms in that state is the purpose of the purpose, because the task is done.

original: gzhan dag na re thos pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis rtogs pa ni dgos pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re thos pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis rtogs pa ni dgos pa'o //
translated: Others say that the realization through the stages of listening and so forth is the purpose,

original: de las kyang tha mal pa'i lus bzlog pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lha'i rnam pa bsgrub pa ni dgos pa'i dgos pa yin no zhes brjod pa de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de las kyang tha mal pa'i lus bzlog pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lha'i rnam pa bsgrub pa ni dgos pa'i dgos pa yin no zhes brjod pa de ni mi rigs te /
translated: and from that, the accomplishment of the supramundane divine form by reversing the ordinary body is the purpose of the purpose. That is not correct,üîΩbecause the purpose is not accomplished by that.

original: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rang gi don sgrub pa la 'bad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rang gi don sgrub pa la 'bad pa ma yin te /
translated: Because the Bodhisattvas do not strive to accomplish their own aim.

original: de rnams kyis ni gzhan gyi don gtso bo yin gyi rang gi don ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyis ni gzhan gyi don gtso bo yin gyi rang gi don ni ma yin no //
translated: For them, the aim of others is primary, not their own aim.

original: ji skad du /üîΩ'gro ba ma lus rang gzhan don mdzad pa'i //
analyzed: ji skad du / 'gro ba ma lus rang gzhan don mdzad pa'i //
translated: As it is said:

original: de bzhin gshegs nyid de yi zhar la 'byung //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs nyid de yi zhar la 'byung //
translated: The state of the Tathagata, which accomplishes the aims of self and others in all the world,

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: arises as a by-product of that.

original: de'i phyir gzhan gyi don kho na @46b dgos pa'i gtso bo yin gyi //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan gyi don kho na @46b dgos pa'i gtso bo yin gyi //
translated: Therefore, the aim of others alone is the primary aim.

original: gzhan du na rang gi don ni dgos pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na rang gi don ni dgos pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, one‚Äôs own aim would not be an aim at all.

original: sgrub par snang ba dang / don gyi bya bar snang ba'i shes pa gnyis bzhin no //
analyzed: sgrub par snang ba dang / don gyi bya bar snang ba'i shes pa gnyis bzhin no //
translated: It is like the cognition of the appearance of the accomplishment and the appearance of the activity of the object.

original: dper na dang po mig phye ba'i dus su sreg pa dang 'tshed pa la sogs pa'i don gyi bya ba byed nus pa yang me la sogs pa tsam du so sor snang ba yin te /
analyzed: dper na dang po mig phye ba'i dus su sreg pa dang 'tshed pa la sogs pa'i don gyi bya ba byed nus pa yang me la sogs pa tsam du so sor snang ba yin te /
translated: For example, at first, when one opens one‚Äôs eyes, the mere fire, etc., is individually perceived as capable of performing the activity of the object, such as burning and cooking,

original: don gyi bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gyi bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the activity of the object does not exist.

original: me la sogs pa thob nas sreg pa dang 'tshed pa la sogs pa'i bya ba dngos su byed pa'i shes pa ni don gyi bya ba snang bar bshad do //
analyzed: me la sogs pa thob nas sreg pa dang 'tshed pa la sogs pa'i bya ba dngos su byed pa'i shes pa ni don gyi bya ba snang bar bshad do //
translated: The consciousness that actually performs the action of burning, cooking, etc., after obtaining fire, etc., is said to be the appearance of the action of the object.

original: de nyid du bya ba byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid du bya ba byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has performed the action.

original: gang don gyi bya ba byed pa de nyid dam pa'i don du yod ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang don gyi bya ba byed pa de nyid dam pa'i don du yod ces 'byung ngo //
translated: That which performs the action of the object exists in the ultimate.

original: 'dir yang dgos pa ni sgrub par snang ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dgos pa ni sgrub par snang ba'o //
translated: Here also, the purpose is the appearance of the object.

original: dgos pa'i dgos pa ni don gyi bya bar snang ba yin zhes rgyas pas chog go //
analyzed: dgos pa'i dgos pa ni don gyi bya bar snang ba yin zhes rgyas pas chog go //
translated: The purpose of the purpose is the appearance of the action of the object.üîΩEnough of this extensive explanation.

original: dgos pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas gdul bya 'jug pa yin pas de dag bstan par bya ba'i phyir gang zag lnga brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: dgos pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas gdul bya 'jug pa yin pas de dag bstan par bya ba'i phyir gang zag lnga brtag par bya ste /
translated: Since the disciple is engaged through the purpose and so on, in order to teach those, the analysis of the five persons is to be done.

original: de yang tsandan la sogs pa'i gong du bshad pa ste /
analyzed: de yang tsandan la sogs pa'i gong du bshad pa ste /
translated: That was explained above in the section on sandalwood and so on.

original: de la tsandan zhes bya ba ni gti mug 'ba' zhig gi rigs can thos pa chung zhing nga rgyal gyi dbang gis gzhan rnams skyo bar byed pa de las gzhan dang rang gi don sgrub par mi nus te /
analyzed: de la tsandan zhes bya ba ni gti mug 'ba' zhig gi rigs can thos pa chung zhing nga rgyal gyi dbang gis gzhan rnams skyo bar byed pa de las gzhan dang rang gi don sgrub par mi nus te /
translated: The sandalwood type is one who is exclusively of the deluded type, has little learning, and through the power of pride, causes others to be disheartened. He is incapable of accomplishing his own or others' goals.

original: blun po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blun po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is a fool.

original: autpala zhes bya ba ni thos pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis 'jug pa yang brjed ngas pa'i ngang tshul can yin te /
analyzed: autpala zhes bya ba ni thos pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis 'jug pa yang brjed ngas pa'i ngang tshul can yin te /
translated: The blue lotus type is one who, through the stages of learning and so on, is also of a forgetful disposition.

original: dbang po dman pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po dman pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is of inferior faculties.

original: de'i rang gi don skye ba 'di la med de skye ba gzhan la 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang gi don skye ba 'di la med de skye ba gzhan la 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: His own goal does not exist in this life, but will arise in another life.

original: padma dkar po ni thos pa la sogs pa rang gi sems la 'dzin cing gzhan la ston par mi nus pas rang gi don tsam yod de /
analyzed: padma dkar po ni thos pa la sogs pa rang gi sems la 'dzin cing gzhan la ston par mi nus pas rang gi don tsam yod de /
translated: The white lotus type is one who retains learning and so on in his own mind and is incapable of teaching others. Thus, he has only his own goal.

original: dbang po bar ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po bar ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is of middling faculties.

original: padma zhes bya ba ni gzhan rnams la ston par byed nus te /
analyzed: padma zhes bya ba ni gzhan rnams la ston par byed nus te /
translated: The lotus type is one who is capable of teaching others.

original: dbang po rnon po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po rnon po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is of sharp faculties.

original: rin po che zhes bya ba ni rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa tshul khrims la sogs pa'i yon tan dang bcas pa byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can dbang po rab gyi rab yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rin po che zhes bya ba ni rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa tshul khrims la sogs pa'i yon tan dang bcas pa byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can dbang po rab gyi rab yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The jewel is the one who has the highest of the highest faculties, who is of the bodhisattva lineage, who is endowed with the perfection of his own and others' aims, and who is endowed with the qualities of morality, etc.

original: bzhi po ni kun rdzob kyi phyogs kyi bshad pa la snod du rung ba dang / gcig ni don dam pa'i mchog gi bshad pa'i snod du rung ba'o //üîΩde yang shin tu rgyas par @47a * //
analyzed: bzhi po ni kun rdzob kyi phyogs kyi bshad pa la snod du rung ba dang / gcig ni don dam pa'i mchog gi bshad pa'i snod du rung ba'o // de yang shin tu rgyas par @47a * //
translated: Four are suitable for the explanation of the conventional aspect, and one is suitable for the explanation of the ultimate aspect.

original: 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be explained in detail below.

original: gzhan dag na re gang zag bzhi yod de /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re gang zag bzhi yod de /
translated: Others say that there are four persons:

original: mi shes pa dang / the tshom za ba dang / phyin ci log pa'i blo dang / nges pa can gyi blo can no //
analyzed: mi shes pa dang / the tshom za ba dang / phyin ci log pa'i blo dang / nges pa can gyi blo can no //
translated: one with an ignorant mind, one with a doubting mind, one with a mistaken mind, and one with a definite mind.

original: de la mi shes pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la mi shes pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Among them, the ignorant one is of two types:

original: tshad ma'i rjes su 'brang ba dang / tshad ma ma yin pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'o //
analyzed: tshad ma'i rjes su 'brang ba dang / tshad ma ma yin pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'o //
translated: one who follows valid cognition and one who follows invalid cognition.

original: de la tshad ma'i rjes su 'brang ba ni gzhan gyi rigs pa len cing thos pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis lam la brten pa'o //
analyzed: de la tshad ma'i rjes su 'brang ba ni gzhan gyi rigs pa len cing thos pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis lam la brten pa'o //
translated: Following valid cognition means to rely on the path by stages such as listening to the reasoning of others.

original: tshad ma ma yin pa'i rjes su 'brang ba ni mkhas pa'i tshig la brten te lam la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin pa'i rjes su 'brang ba ni mkhas pa'i tshig la brten te lam la 'jug pa'o //
translated: Following invalid cognition means to enter the path by relying on the words of the wise.

original: de dag gnyis ka yang lam gyi snod du rung ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gnyis ka yang lam gyi snod du rung ba'o //
translated: Both of these are suitable vessels for the path.

original: the tshom za ba la yang rnam pa gnyis te snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: the tshom za ba la yang rnam pa gnyis te snga ma bzhin te /
translated: Doubt also has two types, as before.

original: the tshom za ba tshad ma'i rjes su 'brang ba ni yang dag par tshad ma brjod pas the tshom las log cing yang dag pa'i lam la gzhag par bya ba zhes rjes su gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: the tshom za ba tshad ma'i rjes su 'brang ba ni yang dag par tshad ma brjod pas the tshom las log cing yang dag pa'i lam la gzhag par bya ba zhes rjes su gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Doubt following valid cognition means that by expressing true valid cognition, one should be accepted as one who turns away from doubt and establishes the true path.

original: tshad ma'i rjes su mi 'brang ba'i the tshom za ba ni bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pas kyang rjes su gzung bar mi spyod do //
analyzed: tshad ma'i rjes su mi 'brang ba'i the tshom za ba ni bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pas kyang rjes su gzung bar mi spyod do //
translated: Doubt that does not follow valid cognition is not even accepted by the Blessed One, the TathƒÅgata.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: mi shes pa ni bde bar mgu gyur cing //
analyzed: mi shes pa ni bde bar mgu gyur cing //
translated: The ignorant are content with happiness,

original: khyad par shes pa de bas myur bar mgu //
analyzed: khyad par shes pa de bas myur bar mgu //
translated: and especially when the mind is even quicker to be satisfied.

original: dum gcig shes pas me yis phyed tshig pa //
analyzed: dum gcig shes pas me yis phyed tshig pa //
translated: If one knows only a part, and is half-burned by the fire,

original: me de sangs rgyas kyis kyang mgu bya min //
analyzed: me de sangs rgyas kyis kyang mgu bya min //
translated: that fire should not satisfy even the Buddha.

original: de bas na btang snyoms kyi gnas su bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na btang snyoms kyi gnas su bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is explained as the basis of equanimity.

original: phyin ci log pa'i blo can ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: phyin ci log pa'i blo can ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Those with distorted minds are of three kinds:

original: the tshom za ba la phyin ci log pa dang / mi shes pa la phyin ci log pa dang / shes pa la phyin ci log pa'o //
analyzed: the tshom za ba la phyin ci log pa dang / mi shes pa la phyin ci log pa dang / shes pa la phyin ci log pa'o //
translated: those with distorted doubt, those with distorted ignorance, and those with distorted knowledge.

original: de la the tshom za ba la phyin ci log pa ni nyan thos lta bu sngags ni yang dag pa ma yin no zhes zer ba thabs gang gis kyang rjes su gzung bar bya ba ma yin pas btang snyoms kyi gnas kho na'o //
analyzed: de la the tshom za ba la phyin ci log pa ni nyan thos lta bu sngags ni yang dag pa ma yin no zhes zer ba thabs gang gis kyang rjes su gzung bar bya ba ma yin pas btang snyoms kyi gnas kho na'o //
translated: Among them, those with distorted doubt, like the ≈õrƒÅvakas, say that mantra is not true, and should not be accepted by any means, so they are only the basis of equanimity.

original: mi shes pa la phyin ci log pa ni chos bstan pa tsam gyis phyin ci log pa las log cing lam du 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa la phyin ci log pa ni chos bstan pa tsam gyis phyin ci log pa las log cing lam du 'jug par bya'o //
translated: Those with distorted ignorance should be turned away from distortion and made to enter the path merely by teaching the Dharma.

original: shes pa la phyin ci log pa la yang gnyis te /
analyzed: shes pa la phyin ci log pa la yang gnyis te /
translated: Those with distorted knowledge are also of two kinds:

original: tshad ma'i rjes su 'brang ba dang / tshad ma'i rjes su 'brang ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: tshad ma'i rjes su 'brang ba dang / tshad ma'i rjes su 'brang ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: Those who follow valid cognition and those who do not follow valid cognition.

original: de la shes pa la tshad ma'i rjes su 'brang ba ma yin pa'i phyin ci log pa'i blo can ni gang gis kyang lam du 'jug par byed mi nus te /üîΩphyin ci log pa'i lta ba dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir @47b ro ;
analyzed: de la shes pa la tshad ma'i rjes su 'brang ba ma yin pa'i phyin ci log pa'i blo can ni gang gis kyang lam du 'jug par byed mi nus te / phyin ci log pa'i lta ba dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir @47b ro ;
translated: Those who do not follow valid cognition are those whose minds are mistaken about knowledge. No one can make them enter the path because they have mistaken views.

original: / shes pa la tshad ma'i rjes su 'brang ba phyin ci log pa'i blo can la rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: / shes pa la tshad ma'i rjes su 'brang ba phyin ci log pa'i blo can la rnam pa drug ste /
translated: Those who follow valid cognition are those whose minds are not mistaken about knowledge. They are of six types:

original: grangs can pa dang / rigs pa pa dang / 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dang / mchod 'os pa dang / zhi ba pa dang / dpyod pa pa'o //
analyzed: grangs can pa dang / rigs pa pa dang / 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dang / mchod 'os pa dang / zhi ba pa dang / dpyod pa pa'o //
translated: SƒÅ·πÉkhyas, Mƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsakas, LokƒÅyatas, ƒÄjƒ´vikas, ≈örama·πáas, and Mƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsakas.

original: g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba 'di dag thams cad de kho na nyid nyi shu rtsa lnga pa'o ;
analyzed: g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba 'di dag thams cad de kho na nyid nyi shu rtsa lnga pa'o ;
translated: All of these, moving and unmoving, are the twenty-five principles.

original: / blo'i dbang po lnga ni mig la sogs pa lnga'o //
analyzed: / blo'i dbang po lnga ni mig la sogs pa lnga'o //
translated: The five sense faculties of the mind are the five beginning with the eye.

original: las kyi dbang po lnga ni /
analyzed: las kyi dbang po lnga ni /
translated: The five faculties of action are the feet,

original: ngag dang / lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / bshang lam dang / gsang ba'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: ngag dang / lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / bshang lam dang / gsang ba'i dbang po'o //
translated: and the sexual organ.üîΩThe five objects such as form,üîΩthe five great elements such as earth,

original: gzugs la sogs pa yul lnga dang / sa la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po lnga dang / nang gi byed pa gsum ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yul lnga dang / sa la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po lnga dang / nang gi byed pa gsum ste /
translated: and the three internal agents:üîΩmind,üîΩintellect,

original: yid dang / blo dang / nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: yid dang / blo dang / nga rgyal lo //
translated: and ego.

original: gtso bo'i rnam grangs can rang bzhin dang skyes bu'o //
analyzed: gtso bo'i rnam grangs can rang bzhin dang skyes bu'o //
translated: The person is a synonym for the primal nature.

original: de la de kho na nyid nyi shu rtsa gsum ni 'bras bu yang yin la rgyu yang yin no //
analyzed: de la de kho na nyid nyi shu rtsa gsum ni 'bras bu yang yin la rgyu yang yin no //
translated: Among these, the twenty-three principles are both effects and causes.

original: rang bzhin ni rgyu kho na'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni rgyu kho na'o //
translated: The primal nature is a cause only.

original: skyes bu ni rgyu yang ma yin 'bras bu yang ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu ni rgyu yang ma yin 'bras bu yang ma yin no //
translated: The person is neither a cause nor an effect.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: rtsa ba'i rang bzhin bya ba ma yin te //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rang bzhin bya ba ma yin te //
translated: The primal nature is not an agent.

original: chen po la sogs bdun po rgyu 'bras yin //
analyzed: chen po la sogs bdun po rgyu 'bras yin //
translated: The seven, the great one, etc., are both causes and effects.

original: bcu drug po ni 'bras bu nyid yin te //
analyzed: bcu drug po ni 'bras bu nyid yin te //
translated: The sixteen are effects only.

original: rgyu min 'bras min skyes bu de yin no //
analyzed: rgyu min 'bras min skyes bu de yin no //
translated: The person is neither a cause nor an effect.

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid can lus can thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pa'i rang bzhin ni gtso bo'o //
analyzed: yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid can lus can thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pa'i rang bzhin ni gtso bo'o //
translated: The nature that is the cause of all embodied beings, which has the nature of the three qualities, is prakriti.

original: snying stobs dang / rdul dang mun pa gsum ni yon tan no //
analyzed: snying stobs dang / rdul dang mun pa gsum ni yon tan no //
translated: The three qualities are sattva, rajas, and tamas.

original: de la snying stobs ni yang zhing gsal bar byed pa dge ba'i bag chags gtsor gyur pa ste mtho ris kyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: de la snying stobs ni yang zhing gsal bar byed pa dge ba'i bag chags gtsor gyur pa ste mtho ris kyi rgyu'o //
translated: Among them, sattva is light and illuminating, the principal imprint of virtue, and the cause of heaven.

original: rdul ni g-yo ba ste g-yo zhing 'ching bar byed pa ste dmyal ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: rdul ni g-yo ba ste g-yo zhing 'ching bar byed pa ste dmyal ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: Rajas is movement, that which moves and binds, and the cause of hell.

original: mun pa ni lci zhing sgrib par byed pa mi dge ba'i bdag nyid dmyal ba nyid kyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: mun pa ni lci zhing sgrib par byed pa mi dge ba'i bdag nyid dmyal ba nyid kyi rgyu'o //
translated: Tamas is heavy and obscuring, the nature of nonvirtue, and the cause of hell.

original: ji skad du //
analyzed: ji skad du //
translated: As it is said:

original: snying stobs yang zhing gsal bar byed par 'dod //
analyzed: snying stobs yang zhing gsal bar byed par 'dod //
translated: Sattva is asserted to be light and illuminating.

original: rdul ni 'ching byed g-yo ba nyid du bshad //
analyzed: rdul ni 'ching byed g-yo ba nyid du bshad //
translated: Rajas is said to be binding and moving.

original: mun pa lci zhing sgrib par byed pa ste //
analyzed: mun pa lci zhing sgrib par byed pa ste //
translated: Tamas is heavy and obscuring.

original: don la mar me bzhin du gnas par 'gyur //üîΩzhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: don la mar me bzhin du gnas par 'gyur // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: It abides like a lamp for objects.

original: de ltar snying stobs la sogs pa'i yon tan gsum ro gcig par gyur pa /
analyzed: de ltar snying stobs la sogs pa'i yon tan gsum ro gcig par gyur pa /
translated: Thus, the three qualities of sattva and so on become of one taste.

original: dbang po la sogs pa rnams kyi rgyur gyur pa rtag pa'i rang bzhin ni bya ba'i sgo nas rjes su dpag par bya ba yin te me bzhin no //
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa rnams kyi rgyur gyur pa rtag pa'i rang bzhin ni bya ba'i sgo nas rjes su dpag par bya ba yin te me bzhin no //
translated: The cause of the sense faculties, etc., is permanent by nature, but is inferred through its effect, like fire.

original: de ni rang gi gzugs su dmigs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni rang gi gzugs su dmigs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: It is not perceived in its own form,

original: phra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is subtle.

original: mi dmigs pa de yang rnam pa bdun du 'gyur ro//
analyzed: mi dmigs pa de yang rnam pa bdun du 'gyur ro//
translated: Non-apprehension is of seven kinds:

original: @48a * // 'di lta ste shin tu ring bas nam mkhar 'phur ba'i bya dang / shin tu nye bas mig gi dbang po'i rdzi ma dang / dbang po nyams pas long ba la sogs pas gzugs mi mthong ba dang / yid mi brtan pas smyo ba la sogs pa rnams kyis dngos po mi mthong ba dang phra bas phra ba la sogs pa mi mthong ba dang /
analyzed: @48a * // 'di lta ste shin tu ring bas nam mkhar 'phur ba'i bya dang / shin tu nye bas mig gi dbang po'i rdzi ma dang / dbang po nyams pas long ba la sogs pas gzugs mi mthong ba dang / yid mi brtan pas smyo ba la sogs pa rnams kyis dngos po mi mthong ba dang phra bas phra ba la sogs pa mi mthong ba dang /
translated: 1. very distant, like a bird flying in the sky; 2. very close, like the eyelashes of the eye faculty; 3. due to impaired faculty, like a blind person not seeing form; 4. due to unstable mind, like a madman not seeing things; 5. due to subtlety, like not seeing subtle particles, etc.;

original: zil gyis gnon pas rlung dang mtshon cha la sogs pas smas pa dang / mtshungs pa dang phrad pas 'o ma dang / chu dang til dang 'bras chang la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zil gyis gnon pas rlung dang mtshon cha la sogs pas smas pa dang / mtshungs pa dang phrad pas 'o ma dang / chu dang til dang 'bras chang la sogs pa'o //
translated: 6. due to suppression, like not seeing what is injured by wind, weapons, etc.; 7. due to similarity, like not seeing milk, water, sesame seeds, rice beer, etc.

original: 'dir ni rang bzhin phra ba'i phyir mi dmigs pas 'bras bus dpag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni rang bzhin phra ba'i phyir mi dmigs pas 'bras bus dpag par bya ba yin no //
translated: Here, it is inferred from its effect because its nature is subtle.

original: ji skad du ;
analyzed: ji skad du ;
translated: As it is said:

original: shin tu ring ba dang ni shin tu nye ba yis //
analyzed: shin tu ring ba dang ni shin tu nye ba yis //
translated: By being too far away or too near,

original: dbang po nyams dang yid ni mi gnas pas //
analyzed: dbang po nyams dang yid ni mi gnas pas //
translated: by a fault of the sense faculty or by the mind not being focused,

original: phra ba nyid dang zil gyis non pas ni //
analyzed: phra ba nyid dang zil gyis non pas ni //
translated: by being too subtle or by being overwhelmed,

original: de bzhin mtshungs pa phan tshun rnams tshogs pas //
analyzed: de bzhin mtshungs pa phan tshun rnams tshogs pas //
translated: by being the same or by not being assembled,

original: phra phyir de ni mi dmigs pa nyid de //
analyzed: phra phyir de ni mi dmigs pa nyid de //
translated: it is not perceived because it is subtle.

original: de ni med min bya bas dmigs pa yin //
analyzed: de ni med min bya bas dmigs pa yin //
translated: But it is not nonexistent because it is perceived by its effect.

original: bya ba de yang chen po la sogs te //
analyzed: bya ba de yang chen po la sogs te //
translated: And that effect is great and so on,

original: rang bzhin dang ni 'dra dang mi 'dra yin //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang ni 'dra dang mi 'dra yin //
translated: having a nature that is similar or dissimilar.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: And so on.

original: de la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshul ni rang bzhin las blo dang / de las kyang nga rgyal dang // de nyid las kyang blo'i dbang po lnga dang las kyi dbang po lnga dang de tsam lnga dang yid kyang skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshul ni rang bzhin las blo dang / de las kyang nga rgyal dang // de nyid las kyang blo'i dbang po lnga dang las kyi dbang po lnga dang de tsam lnga dang yid kyang skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therein, the way of cause and effect is that from the nature, intellect arises, and from that, pride. And from that, the five sense faculties of the intellect and the five faculties of action and the five objects and the mind also arise.

original: de tsam rnam pa lnga las 'byung ba chen po yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de tsam rnam pa lnga las 'byung ba chen po yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: From the five elements alone, the great elements arise, which are the nature of the three qualities.

original: yang dang yang du 'jig cing slar yang skye bar 'gyur zhes rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshul du 'khor ba pa rnams yongs su 'khor bar gyur pa ste dbyer med par shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dang yang du 'jig cing slar yang skye bar 'gyur zhes rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshul du 'khor ba pa rnams yongs su 'khor bar gyur pa ste dbyer med par shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are destroyed again and again and arise again and again. Thus, the cycle of existence revolves in the manner of cause and effect.

original: dbyer yod par shes pas rang bzhin dang skyes bu dag las 'di ni rang bzhin dang 'di ni skyes bu'o zhes pas grol ba'o //
analyzed: dbyer yod par shes pas rang bzhin dang skyes bu dag las 'di ni rang bzhin dang 'di ni skyes bu'o zhes pas grol ba'o //
translated: One is liberated by knowing that the nature and the person are inseparable, because one knows that they are inseparable, thinking, ‚ÄúThis is the nature and this is the person.‚Äù

original: skyes bu ni dri ma med pa shel gyi rnam pa mthong ba po ste //
analyzed: skyes bu ni dri ma med pa shel gyi rnam pa mthong ba po ste //
translated: The person is the stainless one who sees the form of crystal.

original: btang snyoms pa nyid kyis rang bzhin gyi sgo nas thams cad mthong bar byed do //
analyzed: btang snyoms pa nyid kyis rang bzhin gyi sgo nas thams cad mthong bar byed do //
translated: By being indifferent, he sees everything by means of the nature.

original: mthong nas kyang rang bzhin kha drag yin pas mthong bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mthong nas kyang rang bzhin kha drag yin pas mthong bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Having seen, he does not see by means of the nature, because the nature is powerful.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rgyu gnyis las skye ba dang / tshe dang longs spyod kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rgyu gnyis las skye ba dang / tshe dang longs spyod kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the effect of the nature of life and resources is experienced.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: dge ba yis ni steng du 'gro 'gyur te //
analyzed: dge ba yis ni steng du 'gro 'gyur te //
translated: By virtue one goes upward,

original: mi dge ba yis 'og tu 'gro bar 'gyur //
analyzed: mi dge ba yis 'og tu 'gro bar 'gyur //
translated: by nonvirtue one goes downward.

original: ye shes kyis ni grol ba nyid 'gyur zhing//
analyzed: ye shes kyis ni grol ba nyid 'gyur zhing//
translated: By wisdom one is liberated,

original: @48b phyin ci log pas 'ching ba nyid du 'dod //üîΩces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: @48b phyin ci log pas 'ching ba nyid du 'dod // ces 'byung ngo //
translated: by error one is bound.

original: de bas na skyes bu du ma nyid de /
analyzed: de bas na skyes bu du ma nyid de /
translated: Therefore, the person is multiple.

original: gang gi phyir gcig yin na skyes bu gcig grol bas thams cad grol bar thal ba dang / gcig skye ba'am 'chi bas thams cad de bzhin du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gcig yin na skyes bu gcig grol bas thams cad grol bar thal ba dang / gcig skye ba'am 'chi bas thams cad de bzhin du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because if it were one, it would follow, absurdly, that when one person was liberated, all would be liberated, and when one was born or died, all would be born or die.

original: rang bzhin ni bems pos kyang legs pa dang // mi legs pa'i las dag tu skyes bu rab tu 'jug par byed de 'o ma bzhin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni bems pos kyang legs pa dang // mi legs pa'i las dag tu skyes bu rab tu 'jug par byed de 'o ma bzhin no //
translated: The nature, though inanimate, causes the person to engage in good and bad actions, like milk.

original: ji skad du //
analyzed: ji skad du //
translated: As it is said:

original: be'u skyed par byed pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis //
analyzed: be'u skyed par byed pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis //
translated: By the sign of the calf

original: bems po 'o ma ji bzhin 'byung gyur pa //üîΩde bzhin skyes bu grol ba'i ched du ni //
analyzed: bems po 'o ma ji bzhin 'byung gyur pa // de bzhin skyes bu grol ba'i ched du ni //
translated: like the inanimate milk.

original: rang bzhin gtso bos rab tu 'jug par byed //üîΩces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rang bzhin gtso bos rab tu 'jug par byed // ces 'byung ngo //
translated: In the same way, the Supreme Nature operates for the sake of the liberation of the soul.

original: de ltar de kho na nyid nyi shu rtsa gsum rang bzhin dang lhan cig tu bems po yin te /
analyzed: de ltar de kho na nyid nyi shu rtsa gsum rang bzhin dang lhan cig tu bems po yin te /
translated: Thus, the twenty-three principles, along with the Supreme Nature, are inanimate.

original: tha dad pa med pas 'byung po rnam pa bcu bzhi'i 'khor bar yongs su 'khor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa med pas 'byung po rnam pa bcu bzhi'i 'khor bar yongs su 'khor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since they are not differentiated, they revolve in the fourteenfold transmigration of beings.

original: tha dad par yongs su shes pa tsam gyis grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha dad par yongs su shes pa tsam gyis grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By merely knowing the differentiation, one is liberated.

original: rang bzhin bems po yin yang skyes bu dang 'brel ba'i dbang gis dngos po thams cad la 'jug pa dang ldog par byed de 'phye bo dang long ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin bems po yin yang skyes bu dang 'brel ba'i dbang gis dngos po thams cad la 'jug pa dang ldog par byed de 'phye bo dang long ba bzhin no //
translated: Although the Supreme Nature is inanimate, it engages and disengages from all things by the power of its connection with the soul, like a lame person and a blind person.

original: 'phye bo dang long ba'i 'brel ba bzhin //
analyzed: 'phye bo dang long ba'i 'brel ba bzhin //
translated: Like the connection of a lame person and a blind person,

original: de yis byas pa 'di dag 'gro ba yin //
analyzed: de yis byas pa 'di dag 'gro ba yin //
translated: these are the activities of that.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: bye brag de yang tshig gi don drug cu yongs su shes pas skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bye brag de yang tshig gi don drug cu yongs su shes pas skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: That differentiation arises from the knowledge of the sixty topics.

original: gtso bo yod dang gcig pa nyid //üîΩdon ldan nyid dang de las gzhan //
analyzed: gtso bo yod dang gcig pa nyid // don ldan nyid dang de las gzhan //
translated: The principal one, existence, and identity,üîΩMeaningful, and other than that,üîΩOther-purposefulness, and manifold,

original: gzhan don nyid dang du ma dang / bral ba dang ni ma bral nyid //
analyzed: gzhan don nyid dang du ma dang / bral ba dang ni ma bral nyid //
translated: Free and not free,

original: lhag ma'i skabs dang byed min nyid //
analyzed: lhag ma'i skabs dang byed min nyid //
translated: The rest, the occasion, and not doing.

original: don ni gtso bo bcu ru bshad //
analyzed: don ni gtso bo bcu ru bshad //
translated: The meaning is explained as ten principal ones.

original: phyin ci log pa'i bye brag lnga yin te //
analyzed: phyin ci log pa'i bye brag lnga yin te //
translated: There are five types of error:

original: byed pa ma tshang bas ni mi nus pa //
analyzed: byed pa ma tshang bas ni mi nus pa //
translated: By incompleteness of action, one is unable,

original: dbye ba nyi shu rtsa brgyad can zhes bya //
analyzed: dbye ba nyi shu rtsa brgyad can zhes bya //
translated: Having twenty-eight divisions,

original: dga' ba dgu dang dngos grub rnam brgyad do //
analyzed: dga' ba dgu dang dngos grub rnam brgyad do //
translated: Nine joys and eight accomplishments.

original: zhes mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus it is briefly explained.

original: rgyas par bstan pa yang mun pa dang gti mug dang gti mug chen po dang / mun pa thibs po dang / shin tu mun nag thibs po zhes phyin ci log pa lnga'o //
analyzed: rgyas par bstan pa yang mun pa dang gti mug dang gti mug chen po dang / mun pa thibs po dang / shin tu mun nag thibs po zhes phyin ci log pa lnga'o //
translated: The extensive explanation is as follows: Darkness, delusion, great delusion, thick darkness, and very thick darkness are the five errors.

original: mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus ma tshang ba dang / ngag dang lag pa dang rkang pa dang bshang sgo dang / gsang ba'i dbang po mtshang ba dang / yid ma tshang ba ste bcu gcig go //
analyzed: mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus ma tshang ba dang / ngag dang lag pa dang rkang pa dang bshang sgo dang / gsang ba'i dbang po mtshang ba dang / yid ma tshang ba ste bcu gcig go //
translated: speech, hand, foot, anus, and sexual organ, and incomplete mind.

original: dga' ba dang dngos grub ma tshang bas blo drug pa ni bcu bdun no //üîΩrtog pa sgra dang @49a * //
analyzed: dga' ba dang dngos grub ma tshang bas blo drug pa ni bcu bdun no // rtog pa sgra dang @49a * //
translated: The sixth is the mind of the one who is incomplete in joy and power, making seventeen.üîΩThe three are: the conception of sound and color,

original: kha dog 'dzin pa dang // sdug bsngal sel ba gsum ste bshes gnyen phrad //
analyzed: kha dog 'dzin pa dang // sdug bsngal sel ba gsum ste bshes gnyen phrad //
translated: and the removal of suffering, meeting with a spiritual friend.

original: sbyin pa dad dang dngos grub rnam brgyad do //üîΩzhes 'byung bas so //
analyzed: sbyin pa dad dang dngos grub rnam brgyad do // zhes 'byung bas so //
translated: Giving, faith, and the eight powers.

original: lhag pa'i lha las 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba lhag pa las 'byung ba dang lhag pa'i nang gi bdag nyid las 'byung ba de sel bas dngos grub gsum ni dga' ba dag go //
analyzed: lhag pa'i lha las 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba lhag pa las 'byung ba dang lhag pa'i nang gi bdag nyid las 'byung ba de sel bas dngos grub gsum ni dga' ba dag go //
translated: The three joys are the three powers: arising from the special deity, arising from the special elements, and arising from the special inner self.

original: phra ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dngos grub brgyad dang ni dga' ba dgu'o //
analyzed: phra ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dngos grub brgyad dang ni dga' ba dgu'o //
translated: The nine joys are the eight powers characterized by subtlety, and so on, and the ninth joy.

original: tshig gi don drug cu gang gi tshe skyes bus bye brag tu mthong na de'i tshe grol ba'o //
analyzed: tshig gi don drug cu gang gi tshe skyes bus bye brag tu mthong na de'i tshe grol ba'o //
translated: When a person sees the six topics of words, then he is liberated.

original: de yang tshad mas nges par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de yang tshad mas nges par bya ba yin te /
translated: And that is to be ascertained by means of the three authorities:

original: mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / yid ches pa'i tshig ste tshad ma gsum mo //
analyzed: mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / yid ches pa'i tshig ste tshad ma gsum mo //
translated: direct perception, inference, and trustworthy scripture.

original: de la mngon sum gyis de kho na nyid nyi shu rtsa gsum nges par bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la mngon sum gyis de kho na nyid nyi shu rtsa gsum nges par bya ba ste /
translated: Among them, the twenty-three realities are to be ascertained by direct perception,

original: so so'i yul rnams la rtog pa ni mngon sum yin zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so so'i yul rnams la rtog pa ni mngon sum yin zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said that direct perception is the conception of each object.

original: rang bzhin ni yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid de rjes su dpag pas nges par bya ba ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin ni yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid de rjes su dpag pas nges par bya ba ste /
translated: The nature, which is the essence of the three qualities, is to be ascertained by inference,

original: lkog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is hidden.

original: skye ba dang tshe dang longs spyod ni spyir mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pas so //
analyzed: skye ba dang tshe dang longs spyod ni spyir mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pas so //
translated: Birth, life, and enjoyment are to be ascertained by inference from what is seen in general.

original: thar pa la sogs pa shin tu lkog tu gyur pa rnams la yid ches pa'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: thar pa la sogs pa shin tu lkog tu gyur pa rnams la yid ches pa'i tshig gis so //
translated: Liberation, etc., which are very hidden, are to be ascertained by trustworthy scripture.

original: de ltar tshad ma dang bcas pa 'ching ba dang grol ba'i tha snyad kyi rgyur gyur pa grangs can gyi gzhung la 'dod do //
analyzed: de ltar tshad ma dang bcas pa 'ching ba dang grol ba'i tha snyad kyi rgyur gyur pa grangs can gyi gzhung la 'dod do //
translated: Thus, the SƒÅ·πÉkhya accept that the twenty-five principles are the cause of the conventions of bondage and liberation, and they are established by valid knowledge.

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: re zhig dang po de kho na nyid nyi shu rtsa lnga med de /
analyzed: re zhig dang po de kho na nyid nyi shu rtsa lnga med de /
translated: First, the twenty-five principles do not exist.

original: yid dang blo dang rgyal gcig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid dang blo dang rgyal gcig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the same as the mind, intellect, and self.

original: 'dir ni phyi'i don bdag gis rtogs so zhes nges par byas pa tsam gyis blo dang nga rgyal dag yid las tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni phyi'i don bdag gis rtogs so zhes nges par byas pa tsam gyis blo dang nga rgyal dag yid las tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: Here, the mind and the self are not different from the intellect, because it is merely ascertained that ‚ÄúI understand external objects.‚Äù

original: yid kho na bdag gis rtogs so zhes nges pa dang bdag nyid du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid kho na bdag gis rtogs so zhes nges pa dang bdag nyid du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The mind itself arises as the ascertainment ‚ÄúI understand.‚Äù

original: la la smra ba ni rtog par byed pa yid yin no zhes mi rigs te /
analyzed: la la smra ba ni rtog par byed pa yid yin no zhes mi rigs te /
translated: Some say that it is not correct to say that the mind is the thinker,

original: khyad par gyi bdag nyid rnam par rtog pa ni spyi'i bdag nyid nges pa la 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par gyi bdag nyid rnam par rtog pa ni spyi'i bdag nyid nges pa la 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the ascertainment of the nature of a particular is included in the understanding of the nature of a general object.

original: dngos po'i bye brag ma nges pas rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dngos po'i bye brag ma nges pas rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ngo //
translated: A conceptual thought does not arise without ascertaining the particulars of an object.

original: bdag gis rtogs pa dang bdag rtogs pa po zhes khyad par ni nges pa las tha dad ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag gis rtogs pa dang bdag rtogs pa po zhes khyad par ni nges pa las tha dad ma yin te /
translated: The self is not different from the ascertainment, which is the realization and the realizer.

original: yid ni thams cad nges par byed pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid ni thams cad nges par byed pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mind has the nature of ascertaining everything.

original: gang gi phyir shes pa ni ldog pa du ma dang ldan pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir shes pa ni ldog pa du ma dang ldan pa /
translated: Because cognition has many exclusions,

original: ldog pa gang gis brtags pa de'i bdag @49b nyid de yin no //
analyzed: ldog pa gang gis brtags pa de'i bdag @49b nyid de yin no //
translated: by which exclusion it is imagined to be that nature.

original: nga rgyal ma yin pa las log pa de nyid nga rgyal du bstan pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa ldog pa las de nyid rnam par rtog pa yin zhes yid gcig pu kho na yin gyi blo dang nga rgyal med do //
analyzed: nga rgyal ma yin pa las log pa de nyid nga rgyal du bstan pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa ldog pa las de nyid rnam par rtog pa yin zhes yid gcig pu kho na yin gyi blo dang nga rgyal med do //
translated: It is taught that what is not pride is just the opposite of pride, and that what is non-conceptual is just the opposite of conceptualization. Thus, there is only one mind, and there is no intellect or pride.

original: las kyi dbang po rnams kyang gud na med de /
analyzed: las kyi dbang po rnams kyang gud na med de /
translated: The faculties of action also do not exist separately.

original: de rnams lus kyi dbang po la 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams lus kyi dbang po la 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are included in the body faculty.

original: gang 'di ltar smra ba'i tshig dang / len pa dang / 'gro ba dang / 'dor ba dang / dga' ba lnga po'i dbye bas ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: gang 'di ltar smra ba'i tshig dang / len pa dang / 'gro ba dang / 'dor ba dang / dga' ba lnga po'i dbye bas ni mi rigs te /
translated: The five actions of speaking, taking, going, putting down, and enjoying are not reasonable.

original: ma khyab pa dang thal ches par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma khyab pa dang thal ches par 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be too broad and it would follow that there would be no legs.

original: gang gi phyir rkang pa med pa sbrul la sogs pa rnams kyi 'gro ba med par thal bar 'gyur ro //üîΩso dang mig gi rdzi ma dag ldang pa dang / btsum pa dang / phye ba las yod pas las kyi dbang por thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rkang pa med pa sbrul la sogs pa rnams kyi 'gro ba med par thal bar 'gyur ro // so dang mig gi rdzi ma dag ldang pa dang / btsum pa dang / phye ba las yod pas las kyi dbang por thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it would follow that the going of legless things such as snakes would not exist.üîΩBecause the opening and closing of the eyes and the opening and closing of the eyelids exist, it would follow that they would be faculties of action.

original: gzhan yang dur ba'i mchi mas dur mo mngal len pa'i phyir mchi ma yang las kyi dbang por thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang dur ba'i mchi mas dur mo mngal len pa'i phyir mchi ma yang las kyi dbang por thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, because tears from the eyes cause the eyes to be moist, it would follow that tears would be faculties of action.

original: de bas las kyi dbang po rnams ni med do //
analyzed: de bas las kyi dbang po rnams ni med do //
translated: Therefore the faculties of action do not exist.

original: rang bzhin yang ni de kho na nyid gud pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin yang ni de kho na nyid gud pa ma yin te /
translated: The nature of things is not different from that.

original: de tsam las kyang thams cad skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de tsam las kyang thams cad skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because everything arises from that alone.

original: skyes bu yang tshad mas ma grub pas ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: skyes bu yang tshad mas ma grub pas ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: Since a person is not established by valid knowledge, it has no intrinsic reality.

original: de'i mthong ba la sogs pa'i bya ba'i 'brel ba ji ltar 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i mthong ba la sogs pa'i bya ba'i 'brel ba ji ltar 'thad do //
translated: How could the connection of the activity of seeing and so on be tenable?

original: de ltar grangs phyogs gcig pa ma grub pas nges pa med do //
analyzed: de ltar grangs phyogs gcig pa ma grub pas nges pa med do //
translated: Thus, since the position of enumeration is not established, there is no certainty.

original: de'i phyir na phung po lnga las dngos po gang yang med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir na phung po lnga las dngos po gang yang med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no entity whatsoever that is not included in the five aggregates.

original: rang bzhin bems po yin pas bya ba ji ltar byed //
analyzed: rang bzhin bems po yin pas bya ba ji ltar byed //
translated: How can an entity that is essentially inert perform an action?

original: be'u 'o mas skyed pa yin zhes mi rigs te /
analyzed: be'u 'o mas skyed pa yin zhes mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable to say that a calf is nourished by milk.

original: de la gang gi phyir ba'i sems kyis 'o ma sbyin pa la 'jug pa yin gyi 'o ma ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la gang gi phyir ba'i sems kyis 'o ma sbyin pa la 'jug pa yin gyi 'o ma ni ma yin no //
translated: Because the mind of the cow is engaged in giving milk, not the milk.

original: dper na ba mi 'dod na rang gi be'u la yang mi ster ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na ba mi 'dod na rang gi be'u la yang mi ster ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, if a cow does not want to give milk, she will not give milk even to her own calf.

original: de'i phyir sems dang ldan pa kho na la 'jug pa dang ldog pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems dang ldan pa kho na la 'jug pa dang ldog pa'o //
translated: Therefore, engagement and disengagement occur only in relation to that which has a mind.

original: gang gi phyir skyes bus mi byed do zhes khyed cag 'dod pas bya ba thams cad gang las 'byung /
analyzed: gang gi phyir skyes bus mi byed do zhes khyed cag 'dod pas bya ba thams cad gang las 'byung /
translated: Since you assert that a person does not perform an action, from what do all actions arise?

original: de ltar skyes bu med de dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar skyes bu med de dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In that case, a person does not exist because it is not perceived, since it has the characteristic of being perceived.

original: dper na bum pas dben pa'i sa phyogs bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pas dben pa'i sa phyogs bzhin no //
translated: For example, like a place that is devoid of a pot.

original: med pa skyes bu gang yin pa de la 'ching ba 'am thar pa ga las srid ri bong rva la spong ba dang len pa bzhin no //
analyzed: med pa skyes bu gang yin pa de la 'ching ba 'am thar pa ga las srid ri bong rva la spong ba dang len pa bzhin no //
translated: How could there be bondage or liberation for that non-existent person, just like abandoning and adopting in regard to the horn of a rabbit?

original: rang bzhin yod pas skyes bu dang lhan cig tu bye brag yongs su shes par rigs so //üîΩde yul @50a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin yod pas skyes bu dang lhan cig tu bye brag yongs su shes par rigs so // de yul @50a * //
translated: It is reasonable that the person would be known to be distinct from that which exists by intrinsic nature.

original: med pas skyes bu du ma dang de thar pa'i phyir rang bzhin du 'jug pa dang thams cad ces bya ba ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: med pas skyes bu du ma dang de thar pa'i phyir rang bzhin du 'jug pa dang thams cad ces bya ba ni mi rigs so //
translated: Since that does not exist as an object, it is unreasonable that the person is many, and that it is liberated, and that it engages in intrinsic nature, and that it is all.

original: de ltar grangs can pa rnams bkag go //
analyzed: de ltar grangs can pa rnams bkag go //
translated: Thus the SƒÅ·πÉkhya are refuted.

original: rigs pa pa dang khyad par pa rnams ni rtag pa dang bems po dag tu smra ba bdag gi yon tan dgu log pa na tshig gi don bcu drug yongs su shes pa ni /
analyzed: rigs pa pa dang khyad par pa rnams ni rtag pa dang bems po dag tu smra ba bdag gi yon tan dgu log pa na tshig gi don bcu drug yongs su shes pa ni /
translated: The NaiyƒÅyika and Vai≈õe·π£ika assert that the self is permanent and inanimate, and when the nine qualities of the self are reversed, the sixteen categories are fully understood.

original: tshad ma bzhis grub pa'i bdag shes pas grol ba'o //
analyzed: tshad ma bzhis grub pa'i bdag shes pas grol ba'o //
translated: One is liberated by the knowledge that the self is established by the four valid means of knowledge.

original: de ltar yongs su mi shes pas 'ching ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar yongs su mi shes pas 'ching ba'o //
translated: Since one does not fully understand that, one is bound.

original: de rnams la lan 'di yin te /
analyzed: de rnams la lan 'di yin te /
translated: The response to them is this:

original: bdag med de dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bdag med de dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because that selflessness is not observed to have the character of being observed.üîΩ

original: bum pas dben pa'i sa phyogs bzhin no //
analyzed: bum pas dben pa'i sa phyogs bzhin no //
translated: Because the self does not have the characteristic of being perceived, like the place devoid of a pot.

original: gang yongs su shes pas grol ba yon tan dgu po de gang yin /
analyzed: gang yongs su shes pas grol ba yon tan dgu po de gang yin /
translated: What are the nine qualities that are known through which one is liberated?

original: gal te 'di ltar 'dod na khyed cag phung po lnga kho na bdag yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'di ltar 'dod na khyed cag phung po lnga kho na bdag yin na /
translated: If you assert that the self is just the five aggregates,

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: that is not reasonable.

original: phung po mi rtag pas bdag kyang mi rtag par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phung po mi rtag pas bdag kyang mi rtag par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the aggregates are impermanent, it follows that the self would be impermanent.üîΩOr, if the self is not impermanent, then it would not be a common locus with the aggregates.

original: yang na mi rtag pa ma yin te de dang gzhi mthun pa med pas 'on kyang phung po la bdag yod do zhes gzhi dang gzhi can gyi tha snyad du gnas zhes 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: yang na mi rtag pa ma yin te de dang gzhi mthun pa med pas 'on kyang phung po la bdag yod do zhes gzhi dang gzhi can gyi tha snyad du gnas zhes 'dod do zhe na /
translated: But if you assert that the self exists in the aggregates, then the basis and the based would be conventionally established.

original: de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te /
translated: That is also unreasonable.

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag gi gzhi dang gzhi can mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag gi gzhi dang gzhi can mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is untenable that the permanent and the impermanent are a basis and that which is based on it.

original: yang na gzhi dang gzhi can gyi 'brel pa yod mod kyi 'on kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa kho na gzhi dang gzhi can gyi 'brel pa yin gyi gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na gzhi dang gzhi can gyi 'brel pa yod mod kyi 'on kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa kho na gzhi dang gzhi can gyi 'brel pa yin gyi gzhan ma yin no //
translated: Or, although there is a relation of substratum and superstratum, the relation of cause and effect alone is the relation of substratum and superstratum, and not any other.

original: 'di ltar rten gyis brten pa'i ltung ba 'gog par byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas skabs skyed par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rten gyis brten pa'i ltung ba 'gog par byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas skabs skyed par byed pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the cause is the producer of the state characterized by the prevention of the fall of the superstratum due to the substratum.

original: ltung ba'i chos dang mi ltung ba'i chos can tha dad pa yin phyir ro//
analyzed: ltung ba'i chos dang mi ltung ba'i chos can tha dad pa yin phyir ro//
translated: Because the fallen dharma and the non-fallen dharma are different.

original: dngos po'i gnas skabs gzhan skyed par byed pa ni bya ba yin te /
analyzed: dngos po'i gnas skabs gzhan skyed par byed pa ni bya ba yin te /
translated: The production of another state of an entity is an action,

original: skad cig ma'i rang bzhin yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma'i rang bzhin yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has the nature of a moment.

original: dper na snod la 'bras bu bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na snod la 'bras bu bzhin no //
translated: For example, like a fruit on a tree.

original: gzhi gang yin pa de nyid rgyu yin zhes bya ba'i gzhi can yang mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhi gang yin pa de nyid rgyu yin zhes bya ba'i gzhi can yang mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: And the substratum itself is the cause, so the substratum would be impermanent.

original: de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te /
translated: And that is not reasonable,

original: bdag rtag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag rtag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the self is permanent.

original: bdag la phung po yod ces phyogs ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: bdag la phung po yod ces phyogs ni mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable to take the position that the aggregates exist in the self,üîΩbecause the aggregates are impermanent.

original: snga ma bzhin du skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The same faults would apply as before.

original: bya ba'i rab tu skyed pas rgyu nyams par mthong ba'i shin tu yang bdag mi rtag par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bya ba'i rab tu skyed pas rgyu nyams par mthong ba'i shin tu yang bdag mi rtag par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And if the self were the cause of the arising of action, it would be impermanent, because you see that the cause of something is subject to destruction.

original: rgyu de rnams ni nges par 'bras bu dang ldan @50b par mi 'gyur te zhes khyod kyi bdag gi phung po rnams mi skyed par yang yang srid pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu de rnams ni nges par 'bras bu dang ldan @50b par mi 'gyur te zhes khyod kyi bdag gi phung po rnams mi skyed par yang yang srid pa'o //
translated: And those causes would not necessarily have an effect, because it is possible that the self would not produce the aggregates.

original: phung po kho na bdag yin zhes gzhi mthun pa'i phyogs su sngar bshad pa'i skyon kho nar thal bar 'gyur te tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po kho na bdag yin zhes gzhi mthun pa'i phyogs su sngar bshad pa'i skyon kho nar thal bar 'gyur te tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the self were the aggregates, the same faults would apply as were explained above, because the self and the aggregates would not be different.

original: phung po dang bdag ni me dang bud shing bzhin du tha mi dad ce na de yang med do //
analyzed: phung po dang bdag ni me dang bud shing bzhin du tha mi dad ce na de yang med do //
translated: If the self and the aggregates were not different, like fire and fuel, that also is not so.

original: gal te de ltar yin na bud shing nyams pa las mi skye ba ni me yin gyi gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin na bud shing nyams pa las mi skye ba ni me yin gyi gzhan ma yin no //
translated: If that were so, fire would not arise from the destruction of fuel, but from something else.

original: de bzhin du bdag nyams pa las phung po skye bar 'gyur bas bdag yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag nyams pa las phung po skye bar 'gyur bas bdag yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, since the aggregates would arise from the destruction of the self, the self would not exist.

original: yang na bdag yongs su gyur zhing phung po skye ba ma yin gyi //
analyzed: yang na bdag yongs su gyur zhing phung po skye ba ma yin gyi //
translated: Or, the self does not arise from the transformation of the aggregates,

original: 'on kyang phung po yongs su gyur pa las bdag tu 'gyur ro zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: 'on kyang phung po yongs su gyur pa las bdag tu 'gyur ro zhe na smras pa /
translated: but the self arises from the transformation of the aggregates.

original: phung po ma gtogs pa'i bdag mi dmigs pas med do zhes rtag pa nyid kyang med do //
analyzed: phung po ma gtogs pa'i bdag mi dmigs pas med do zhes rtag pa nyid kyang med do //
translated: Since a self not included in the aggregates is not perceived, it does not exist.

original: bems po nyid kyang mi rigs te brag dang 'dra ba'i bems po la 'ching ba dang grol ba'i tha snyad mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bems po nyid kyang mi rigs te brag dang 'dra ba'i bems po la 'ching ba dang grol ba'i tha snyad mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is also not reasonable that the self is inanimate, because the convention of bondage and liberation is not tenable for an inanimate self that is like a rock.

original: de'i phyir yon tan dgu po mtho ris dang dmyal ba sgrub par byed pa ji ltar rigs //
analyzed: de'i phyir yon tan dgu po mtho ris dang dmyal ba sgrub par byed pa ji ltar rigs //
translated: Therefore, how could the nine qualities be reasonable as the establishment of heaven and hell?

original: chos dang chos min bde sdug bsngal //
analyzed: chos dang chos min bde sdug bsngal //
translated: Virtue and vice, happiness and suffering,

original: 'dod dang zhe sdang de bzhin te //
analyzed: 'dod dang zhe sdang de bzhin te //
translated: desire and hatred,

original: rtsol ba shes pa 'du byed rnams //
analyzed: rtsol ba shes pa 'du byed rnams //
translated: striving and consciousness, and formations

original: bdag yod pa la rtags rnams so //
analyzed: bdag yod pa la rtags rnams so //
translated: are the signs of the existence of the self.

original: zhes 'byung ba de ni mi rigs te //üîΩgang gi phyir rtags ni rtags can mtshon par byed pas de las tha dad pa yin nam //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba de ni mi rigs te // gang gi phyir rtags ni rtags can mtshon par byed pas de las tha dad pa yin nam //
translated: This is unreasonable.üîΩBecause if the sign is different from the sign-possessor, it is not tenable that it is a sign.

original: tha mi dad pa yin //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa yin //
translated: Or if it is not different, it is not tenable that it is a sign.

original: gal te tha dad pa yin na dngos po thams cad la chos la sogs pa rtags su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa yin na dngos po thams cad la chos la sogs pa rtags su 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are different, then all things would be the signs of dharmas, etc.

original: yang na tha mi dad pa yin na de'i tshe //
analyzed: yang na tha mi dad pa yin na de'i tshe //
translated: Or, if they are not different, then

original: rang rig pa yin nam //
analyzed: rang rig pa yin nam //
translated: are they self-knowing?

original: gzhan yin // de las gzhan yin na //
analyzed: gzhan yin // de las gzhan yin na //
translated: Or are they other?

original: rang gis mi rigs pa'i chos la sogs pas dmyal ba dang mtho ris la sogs pa'i 'bras bu dang 'brel pa med do //
analyzed: rang gis mi rigs pa'i chos la sogs pas dmyal ba dang mtho ris la sogs pa'i 'bras bu dang 'brel pa med do //
translated: If they are other, then there would be no connection between the result, such as hell and heaven, and the dharma, etc., which are not one‚Äôs own.

original: rang rig pa yin na bems po nyid du ji ltar 'gyur zhes phan tshun 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: rang rig pa yin na bems po nyid du ji ltar 'gyur zhes phan tshun 'gal ba'o //
translated: If they are self-knowing, then how could they be insentient? Thus they are mutually contradictory.

original: me dang du ba bzhin du bdag dang rtags dag gi 'brel pa yin na de yang chos la sogs pa'i bya ba rtogs par byed pa 'byung bas rtogs par bya ba rgyur 'gyur ba bdag 'gog par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: me dang du ba bzhin du bdag dang rtags dag gi 'brel pa yin na de yang chos la sogs pa'i bya ba rtogs par byed pa 'byung bas rtogs par bya ba rgyur 'gyur ba bdag 'gog par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If the connection between the self and the sign is like that between fire and smoke, then since the arising of the understanding of the activity of dharma, etc. would be the object of understanding, the self would become the cause. It follows that the self would be refuted,

original: 'bras bu 'byung bas rgyu rnams nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir bdag med bdag ces rigs pa pa dang bye brag smra ba rnams la lan no //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'byung bas rgyu rnams nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir bdag med bdag ces rigs pa pa dang bye brag smra ba rnams la lan no //
translated: because the arising of the result would destroy the cause. This is the response to the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas and the logicians who say that there is no self.

original: 'jig rten rgyang phan pas ni mngon sum kho na tshad ma yin gyi rjes @51a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang phan pas ni mngon sum kho na tshad ma yin gyi rjes @51a * //
translated: The Lokayata state that only direct perception is valid cognition.üîΩ

original: su dpag pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: su dpag pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The Lokayatas say that perception alone is a means of valid knowledge, not inference.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lag pa reg pas lod pa yis //
analyzed: lag pa reg pas lod pa yis //
translated: When the hand is burned by contact with fire,

original: dka' ba'i lam du rgyug pa na //
analyzed: dka' ba'i lam du rgyug pa na //
translated: one runs away from the path which is difficult to traverse.

original: rjes su dpag pa gtsor gyur la //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa gtsor gyur la //
translated: Inference is the principal means of valid knowledge.

original: ltung ba dag ni dkon pa min //
analyzed: ltung ba dag ni dkon pa min //
translated: It is not rare to fall into error.

original: 'bad pas don ni rjes dpag pa //
analyzed: 'bad pas don ni rjes dpag pa //
translated: One should infer the meaning with effort.

original: mkhas pa mjal bar spro rnams kyi //
analyzed: mkhas pa mjal bar spro rnams kyi //
translated: The wise who are eager to meet

original: shin tu mkhas pa gzhan rnams kyis //
analyzed: shin tu mkhas pa gzhan rnams kyis //
translated: the very wise

original: rnam pa gzhan du sgrub par byed //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du sgrub par byed //
translated: establish in a different way.

original: de bas na rjes su dpag pa med do //
analyzed: de bas na rjes su dpag pa med do //
translated: Therefore, inference does not exist.

original: gang mngon sum gyis nye bar dmigs pa de yod do /
analyzed: gang mngon sum gyis nye bar dmigs pa de yod do /
translated: What is perceived by the senses exists.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: ji srid 'tsho bar bde tshol zhing //üîΩshi nas 'byung ba khyod la med //
analyzed: ji srid 'tsho bar bde tshol zhing // shi nas 'byung ba khyod la med //
translated: ‚ÄúYou seek happiness as long as you live,

original: thal bar 'gyur ba'i 'chi ba la //üîΩslar yang 'byung bag las 'gyur //
analyzed: thal bar 'gyur ba'i 'chi ba la // slar yang 'byung bag las 'gyur //
translated: but after death there is no continuation for you.üîΩFrom the ashes of the burned

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: there is no possibility of a return to life.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du 'byung ba chen po bzhi 'gyur ba las sna tshogs 'di dag so sor snang ba yin gyi sems pa zhes bya ba gzhan gang yang med de /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'byung ba chen po bzhi 'gyur ba las sna tshogs 'di dag so sor snang ba yin gyi sems pa zhes bya ba gzhan gang yang med de /
translated: Likewise, these various appearances are due to the transformation of the four great elements, and there is no other so-called ‚Äúsentience.‚Äù

original: gang gi longs spyod dang thar pa bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi longs spyod dang thar pa bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: For the sake of the enjoyment and liberation of that,

original: rjes su dpag pa tshad ma nyid yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa tshad ma nyid yin no //
translated: inference is valid cognition.

original: gal te 'byung ba chen po yongs su gyur pa mtshungs pa yin na yang /
analyzed: gal te 'byung ba chen po yongs su gyur pa mtshungs pa yin na yang /
translated: If the transformation of the great elements is the same,

original: g-yo ba nyid dang mi g-yo ba nyid mi rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: g-yo ba nyid dang mi g-yo ba nyid mi rigs so zhe na /
translated: it is unreasonable that there is movement and no movement.

original: de la yang smras pa nges pa can gyi 'bru yongs su gyur pa las skyes pa'i chang gis ji ltar myos pa'i nus pa de bzhin du pha dang ma las skyes pa'i lus kyi gong bu'i sems kyi nus pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang smras pa nges pa can gyi 'bru yongs su gyur pa las skyes pa'i chang gis ji ltar myos pa'i nus pa de bzhin du pha dang ma las skyes pa'i lus kyi gong bu'i sems kyi nus pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: To that, we reply: Just as alcohol arises from the transformation of specific grains and has the power to intoxicate, in the same way, the power of the mind arises from the transformation of the body produced from the father and mother.

original: shing la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams de ltar ma skyes pas sems pa med do //
analyzed: shing la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams de ltar ma skyes pas sems pa med do //
translated: Since things like trees are not produced in that way, they are without sentience.

original: 'byung ba chen po yongs su gyur pa ni mtshungs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po yongs su gyur pa ni mtshungs pa kho na'o //
translated: The transformation of the great elements is the same.

original: de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te /
translated: That also is not reasonable.

original: 'byung ba chen po ni bems po dang sems pa ni bems po ma yin pas shes pa de dag ni phan tshun rgyu gcig pa ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po ni bems po dang sems pa ni bems po ma yin pas shes pa de dag ni phan tshun rgyu gcig pa ni mi rigs so //
translated: Because the great elements are insentient and the mind is not insentient, it is not reasonable that those two are mutually the same cause.

original: rgyu mtshungs pa yin pas thams cad sems pa nyid du 'gyur ba'am sems pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu mtshungs pa yin pas thams cad sems pa nyid du 'gyur ba'am sems pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Because they are the same cause, everything would be either sentient or not sentient.

original: rgyu med na rtag tu yod pa 'am med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu med na rtag tu yod pa 'am med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is no cause, it would always exist or not exist.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: rgyu med gzhan la ltos med phyir //
analyzed: rgyu med gzhan la ltos med phyir //
translated: Because it is not causeless and does not depend on another,

original: rtag tu yod pa'am med par 'gyur//
analyzed: rtag tu yod pa'am med par 'gyur//
translated: it would always exist or not exist.

original: dngos po yi ni ltos pa las //
analyzed: dngos po yi ni ltos pa las //
translated: From the dependence of things,

original: brgya la nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: brgya la nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: it would sometimes occur.

original: don gzhan rgyu mtshan can nyid ni //
analyzed: don gzhan rgyu mtshan can nyid ni //
translated: If the meaning of another is the reason,

original: chos de gzhan pa nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: chos de gzhan pa nyid du 'gyur //
translated: that phenomenon would be different.

original: phyi nas 'byung ba rgyu med nyid //
analyzed: phyi nas 'byung ba rgyu med nyid //
translated: Later arising would be causeless,

original: 'bras bu nges pa can mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'bras bu nges pa can mi 'gyur //
translated: and the effect would not be certain.

original: zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: sems pa dang 'byung ba chen po rnams ni tha dad med cing tha @51b dad med pa'i rgyu can no //
analyzed: sems pa dang 'byung ba chen po rnams ni tha dad med cing tha @51b dad med pa'i rgyu can no //
translated: The mind and the great elements are not different and are not caused by what is not different.

original: gal te 'byung ba chen po las tha dad pa bdag gis sems pa khas ma blangs te /
analyzed: gal te 'byung ba chen po las tha dad pa bdag gis sems pa khas ma blangs te /
translated: If you do not accept that the self is a thinker that is different from the great elements,

original: 'on kyang de'i rang bzhin de rnams yin zhes zer ba na /
analyzed: 'on kyang de'i rang bzhin de rnams yin zhes zer ba na /
translated: but say that the nature of the self is the great elements,

original: 'di yang bden pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang bden pa ma yin te /
translated: that is not correct.

original: sems dang 'byung ba chen po dag ni tha dad pa'i tshad ma'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dang 'byung ba chen po dag ni tha dad pa'i tshad ma'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mind and the great elements are the objects of different valid knowledges.

original: dper na dbang po'i mngon sum gyis 'di nyid du so sor snang ba ni 'byung ba chen po'o //
analyzed: dper na dbang po'i mngon sum gyis 'di nyid du so sor snang ba ni 'byung ba chen po'o //
translated: For example, the great elements are perceived by the sense direct perception in this way.

original: rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis bdag nyid du so sor snang ba ni sems pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis bdag nyid du so sor snang ba ni sems pa nyid do //
translated: The mind itself is perceived by reflexive awareness direct perception.

original: 'di nyid dang bdag nyid dbang po dang rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyi tshad ma dag dang gzhal bya rnams phan tshun tha dad pa'i phyir ro //üîΩchos rnams kyi 'di nyid kho na dbye ba'am dbye ba'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: 'di nyid dang bdag nyid dbang po dang rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyi tshad ma dag dang gzhal bya rnams phan tshun tha dad pa'i phyir ro // chos rnams kyi 'di nyid kho na dbye ba'am dbye ba'i rgyu ste /
translated: Because the objects of the two valid knowledges, direct perception of the sense faculties and reflexive awareness direct perception, are mutually different.üîΩThe difference or cause of difference of phenomena is this.

original: gang 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa'am rgyu'i dbye ba'o //
analyzed: gang 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa'am rgyu'i dbye ba'o //
translated: It is the possession of mutually exclusive attributes or the difference of causes.

original: de ltar na bde bar gshegs pa khyed rnams la dngos po gcig la ni tshad ma tha dad pa 'jug par mthong ngo //
analyzed: de ltar na bde bar gshegs pa khyed rnams la dngos po gcig la ni tshad ma tha dad pa 'jug par mthong ngo //
translated: Thus, O Sugatas, we see that different valid cognitions can apply to a single thing.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: dngos po nyid dang skad cig ma dag bzhin no //
analyzed: dngos po nyid dang skad cig ma dag bzhin no //
translated: it is like the case of a thing and its momentariness.

original: dper na mngon sum yan lag thams cad dang ldan pa ma nyams pa'i dngos po nges par byas pa'am /
analyzed: dper na mngon sum yan lag thams cad dang ldan pa ma nyams pa'i dngos po nges par byas pa'am /
translated: For example, a thing that is complete with all its parts and is not defective is ascertained by a valid cognition of direct perception,

original: slar yang de nyid du rjes su dpag pas skad cig ma'i ngo bor dpag par bya ba de bzhin du 'byung ba dang sems pa'i bdag nyid can dbyer med pa'i dngos po can la yang dbang po'i mngon sum dang rang rig pa'i mngon sum 'jug par 'gyur zhe
analyzed: slar yang de nyid du rjes su dpag pas skad cig ma'i ngo bor dpag par bya ba de bzhin du 'byung ba dang sems pa'i bdag nyid can dbyer med pa'i dngos po can la yang dbang po'i mngon sum dang rang rig pa'i mngon sum 'jug par 'gyur zhe
translated: and then again, it is inferred to have the nature of momentariness by inference. In the same way, direct perception of the sense faculties and direct perception of reflexive awareness can apply to a thing that has the nature of the elements and intention and is inseparable.

original: na / smras pa dbyer med pa'i dngos po mngon sum gyis yongs su gcod pa yin te /
analyzed: na / smras pa dbyer med pa'i dngos po mngon sum gyis yongs su gcod pa yin te /
translated: We reply: A thing that is inseparable is ascertained by direct perception.

original: 'on kyang yul gang du gang la the tshom yod pa de dag tu 'jal ba po de'i 'khrul pa tsam yang spang bar bya ba'i phyir rjes su dpag pa 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on kyang yul gang du gang la the tshom yod pa de dag tu 'jal ba po de'i 'khrul pa tsam yang spang bar bya ba'i phyir rjes su dpag pa 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: But inference does operate in order to eliminate even the slightest error on the part of the person who is in doubt about something.

original: dper na dngos po rtag par smra ba'i skad cig ma yin pa nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: dper na dngos po rtag par smra ba'i skad cig ma yin pa nyid kyi'o //
translated: For example, in the case of the thesis that things are permanent, the inference is that they are momentary.

original: khyed cag la yang 'khrul ba gang yang mi dgos te /
analyzed: khyed cag la yang 'khrul ba gang yang mi dgos te /
translated: And you do not need any error at all.

original: gang bzlog par bya ba'i phyir tshad ma gzhan btsal bar bya ste /
analyzed: gang bzlog par bya ba'i phyir tshad ma gzhan btsal bar bya ste /
