translated: For the purpose of refuting that, another valid cognition is sought.

original: sems pa nyid 'byung ba chen po'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems pa nyid 'byung ba chen po'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mind itself has the nature of the great elements.

original: de'i phyir dbyer med pa'i dngos po la tha dad pa'i tshad ma 'jug par mthong ba'i phyir sems pa tha dad pa yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbyer med pa'i dngos po la tha dad pa'i tshad ma 'jug par mthong ba'i phyir sems pa tha dad pa yod pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, because a valid cognition that distinguishes them is seen to operate with regard to an entity that is not different, the mind is certainly different.

original: chang gis myos pa bzhin zhes dpe ni don dang mi ldan pa ste /
analyzed: chang gis myos pa bzhin zhes dpe ni don dang mi ldan pa ste /
translated: The example of ‚Äúlike one who is intoxicated by alcohol‚Äù is meaningless.

original: lhan cig mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not observed together.

original: gang gi tshe chang gi rdzas myong bar mi byed pa na de'i tshe myos pa'i nus pa ga la yod de //üîΩchang @52a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe chang gi rdzas myong bar mi byed pa na de'i tshe myos pa'i nus pa ga la yod de // chang @52a * //
translated: When the substance of the alcohol is not experienced, how can there be the power of intoxication?

original: gis myos par gyur pa na yang lus kyi nang du thim pas myong ba'i nus pa gcig tu snang gi chang ni ma yin zhes lhan cig dmigs pa med do //
analyzed: gis myos par gyur pa na yang lus kyi nang du thim pas myong ba'i nus pa gcig tu snang gi chang ni ma yin zhes lhan cig dmigs pa med do //
translated: Even when one is intoxicated by alcohol, the power of experience is perceived as being in the body, which is saturated by the alcohol, but not in the alcohol itself. Thus, there is no co-apprehension of the two.

original: de bzhin du yang 'byung ba dang sems pa dag la med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang 'byung ba dang sems pa dag la med do //
translated: In the same way, there is no co-apprehension of the elements and consciousness.

original: dper na lus med pas kyang phra ba'i lus dang ldan pa'i sems pa yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: dper na lus med pas kyang phra ba'i lus dang ldan pa'i sems pa yod pa nyid do //
translated: For example, even though the body does not exist, consciousness, which is endowed with a subtle body, does exist.

original: sems dang ldan pa ni lus thams cad du mthong ngo //
analyzed: sems dang ldan pa ni lus thams cad du mthong ngo //
translated: And one who possesses consciousness is seen to have a body.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams la yang ting nge 'dzin gyi lus med par mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams la yang ting nge 'dzin gyi lus med par mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: And in the formless realm, the body of concentration does not cease to exist.

original: gzhi dang gzhi can gyi 'brel pa ni lus dang / sems dag la 'brel pa rigs pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzhi dang gzhi can gyi 'brel pa ni lus dang / sems dag la 'brel pa rigs pa nyid do //
translated: The relation of the basis and the one who possesses the basis is reasonable in the case of the body and mind.

original: gzhi 'jig pas gzhi can 'jig par ma mthong ste /
analyzed: gzhi 'jig pas gzhi can 'jig par ma mthong ste /
translated: But the destruction of the basis is not seen to result in the destruction of the one who possesses the basis.

original: shing bcad pas bya rog bcad pa ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: shing bcad pas bya rog bcad pa ma mthong ngo //
translated: For example, when a tree is cut down, the crow is not seen to be cut down.

original: gal te de lta yin na gson pa dang 'chi ba'i tha snyad ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na gson pa dang 'chi ba'i tha snyad ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If that is so, how can there be the conventions of living and dying?

original: smras pa / thog ma med pa'i dus nas sred pa dang ma rig pa'i bag chags kun 'byung gi bden pa'i rnam grangs can gyi dbang gis srog dang dbang po'i tshogs g-yo bar gyur pas tshe gnas par byed pa'i las kyi dbang gis phung po za ma tog gi nang du
analyzed: smras pa / thog ma med pa'i dus nas sred pa dang ma rig pa'i bag chags kun 'byung gi bden pa'i rnam grangs can gyi dbang gis srog dang dbang po'i tshogs g-yo bar gyur pas tshe gnas par byed pa'i las kyi dbang gis phung po za ma tog gi nang du
translated: It is said: By the power of the craving and ignorance that have arisen since beginningless time, the collection of life and faculties moves, and the aggregates are like a box.

original: ji srid rnam par shes pa gnas pa de srid gson po yin zhes tha snyad 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ji srid rnam par shes pa gnas pa de srid gson po yin zhes tha snyad 'byung ngo //
translated: As long as consciousness remains, there is the convention of living.

original: tshe gnas par byed pa'i las 'gog pas srog la sogs pa'i 'khor lo 'dzad pas 'chi'o zhes 'jig rten du grags so //
analyzed: tshe gnas par byed pa'i las 'gog pas srog la sogs pa'i 'khor lo 'dzad pas 'chi'o zhes 'jig rten du grags so //
translated: When the karma that sustains life ceases, the wheel of life and so on is exhausted and there is the convention of death.

original: rnam par shes pa ni yang dang yang du skye zhing 'gog par 'gyur zhes 'byung ba chen po las sems tha dad pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni yang dang yang du skye zhing 'gog par 'gyur zhes 'byung ba chen po las sems tha dad pa kho na'o //
translated: It is said that consciousness is born and ceases again and again, and that mind is distinct from the great elements.

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ni yod de de rnams kyi yang bde ba la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa dge ba dang mi dge ba yod pas mtho ris dang dmyal ba la sogs pa yod ces de rtogs par bya ba'i phyir rjes su dpag
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ni yod de de rnams kyi yang bde ba la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa dge ba dang mi dge ba yod pas mtho ris dang dmyal ba la sogs pa yod ces de rtogs par bya ba'i phyir rjes su dpag
translated: Therefore, the six collections of consciousness exist, and since the virtuous and nonvirtuous that establish pleasure and so on exist, high status, such as the god realm, and the hells exist.

original: pa yang yod pa kho na'o zhes 'jig rten rgyang phan pa la lan no //
analyzed: pa yang yod pa kho na'o zhes 'jig rten rgyang phan pa la lan no //
translated: Thus inference exists, and so the Lokayata is refuted.

original: mchod 'os rnams kyis kyang yongs su 'gyur ba dang / gang zag rtag pa yin zhes smra ba'o //
analyzed: mchod 'os rnams kyis kyang yongs su 'gyur ba dang / gang zag rtag pa yin zhes smra ba'o //
translated: The Lokayata also say that the self is permanent and that it is transformed by the gods.

original: de rnams kyi gzhung 'di yin te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi gzhung 'di yin te /
translated: Their scriptures are as follows.

original: dus gsum gyi dngos po rnams ni gang ma 'ongs pa'i dus su gnas pa de dag de ltar 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dus gsum gyi dngos po rnams ni gang ma 'ongs pa'i dus su gnas pa de dag de ltar 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Things of the three times exist because things that exist in the future arise in that way.

original: gang yang da ltar byung ba de dag 'das pa'i dus nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang yang da ltar byung ba de dag 'das pa'i dus nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Also, things that exist in the present become the past.

original: 'das pa rnams kyang ma 'ongs par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'das pa rnams kyang ma 'ongs par 'gyur zhing /
translated: The past also becomes the future.

original: ma 'ongs pa yang da ltar byung bar 'gyur @52b zhes gang yang skye ba dang 'jig par mi 'gyur te gser bzhin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa yang da ltar byung bar 'gyur @52b zhes gang yang skye ba dang 'jig par mi 'gyur te gser bzhin no //
translated: and the future would become the present. Nothing would arise or disintegrate, like gold.

original: dper na rna cha 'gyur bas gser dang gser yang 'gyur bas rna cha lta bur 'gyur zhes gser gyi rang gzugs nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na rna cha 'gyur bas gser dang gser yang 'gyur bas rna cha lta bur 'gyur zhes gser gyi rang gzugs nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, a ring is not different from gold, and gold is not different from a ring. The nature of gold is not lost.

original: de ltar yin pas zho yang rnga mor 'gyur ba dang rnga mo yang zhor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yin pas zho yang rnga mor 'gyur ba dang rnga mo yang zhor 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, milk would become a cow, and a cow would become milk.

original: bdag rtag pa la ni 'gyur bas kyang skyon med do //
analyzed: bdag rtag pa la ni 'gyur bas kyang skyon med do //
translated: But there is no fault in the permanence of the self.

original: ji skad du /üîΩsnga ma'i chos gzhan spangs pa ni //
analyzed: ji skad du / snga ma'i chos gzhan spangs pa ni //
translated: As it is said:üîΩWhen one abandons the previous state

original: gang tshe chos gzhan len gyur na //
analyzed: gang tshe chos gzhan len gyur na //
translated: and takes up another state,

original: chos can de nyid las ma 'phos //üîΩyongs su gyur pa de bshad do //
analyzed: chos can de nyid las ma 'phos // yongs su gyur pa de bshad do //
translated: the possessor of the state does not move from itself.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: This is explained as transformation.

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: To this we say:

original: gal te 'gro ba dang mi 'gro ba'i bdag nyid 'gro ba bdag rtag pa'i ngo bo yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'gro ba dang mi 'gro ba'i bdag nyid 'gro ba bdag rtag pa'i ngo bo yin na /
translated: If the self, which is the nature of both the mover and the non-mover, is the permanent entity,üîΩthen it is not tenable that it moves.

original: de'i tshe ci'i phyir yongs su 'gyur te yongs su 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni rang gi gzugs 'jig pa'i bdag nyid mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi chos kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe ci'i phyir yongs su 'gyur te yongs su 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni rang gi gzugs 'jig pa'i bdag nyid mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi chos kyi khyad par ro //
translated: Why would it transform? ‚Äú Transformation‚Äù is a particular quality of a dharma that has the characteristic of impermanence, the nature of which is the destruction of its own form.

original: gang mi rtag pa de ji ltar bdag yin gal te gser dang mdud pa dang khu tshur gyi rigs pas rang gi ngo bo mi 'jig ces zer na /
analyzed: gang mi rtag pa de ji ltar bdag yin gal te gser dang mdud pa dang khu tshur gyi rigs pas rang gi ngo bo mi 'jig ces zer na /
translated: How could that which is impermanent be the self? If you say that its own nature does not perish, like gold, because of the argument of the fist and the knot,

original: de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te /
translated: that is not reasonable.

original: gser la khyad par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gser la khyad par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a difference in gold is seen.

original: dper na gser ltar snang ba 'jig pas kyang de ni brtag pa shes pa rnams kyis sra ba dang kha dog la sogs pas byas pa'i khyad par 'gas nges par 'byung ngo//
analyzed: dper na gser ltar snang ba 'jig pas kyang de ni brtag pa shes pa rnams kyis sra ba dang kha dog la sogs pas byas pa'i khyad par 'gas nges par 'byung ngo//
translated: For example, because of the destruction of what appears to be gold, those who know how to examine it will certainly find a difference in its hardness, color, and so on.

original: gang khyad par 'byung ba de nyid mi rtag pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang khyad par 'byung ba de nyid mi rtag pa nyid do //
translated: That which is found to be different is impermanent.

original: gal te bdag ces bya ba tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: gal te bdag ces bya ba tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa yang rung ste /
translated: If what is called the self is neither different nor not different,

original: de'i rang gi ngo bo 'jig par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rang gi ngo bo 'jig par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: then its own nature would not perish.

original: de yang bden pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang bden pa ma yin te /
translated: That is also not true.

original: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa ni phan tshun 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa ni phan tshun 'gal ba'o //
translated: Difference and non-difference are mutually exclusive.

original: gal te tha dad na ci'i phyir tha mi dad /
analyzed: gal te tha dad na ci'i phyir tha mi dad /
translated: If they are different, why are they not different?

original: tha mi dad pa la tha dad pa yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa la tha dad pa yang mi rigs te /
translated: If they are not different, it is not reasonable that they are different.

original: tha mi dad pa yang yin la tha dad pa yang yin zhes 'gal ba'i chos brtags pa'i dbang gis bdag ji ltar brtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa yang yin la tha dad pa yang yin zhes 'gal ba'i chos brtags pa'i dbang gis bdag ji ltar brtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: How can the self be imagined by the power of imagining a contradictory property, that it is both not different and different?

original: de'i phyir na gang zag gi tha snyad ni brtags pa yin no zhes mchod 'os pa la lan no //
analyzed: de'i phyir na gang zag gi tha snyad ni brtags pa yin no zhes mchod 'os pa la lan no //
translated: Therefore, the conventional designation of the person is an imputation.

original: zhi ba ba na re rtag cing thams cad byed pa kun shes pa 'dod pa dang bya ba dang ye shes kyi nus pa gsum gyi mthus skye ba dang gnas pa dang / 'jig par byed pa 'jig rten gsum gyi dbang phyug kho na rgyu yin zhes de nyid las thams cad 'byung zhing thim par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhi ba ba na re rtag cing thams cad byed pa kun shes pa 'dod pa dang bya ba dang ye shes kyi nus pa gsum gyi mthus skye ba dang gnas pa dang / 'jig par byed pa 'jig rten gsum gyi dbang phyug kho na rgyu yin zhes de nyid las thams cad 'byung zhing thim par 'gyur ro //
translated: ≈öiva is the cause of everything, because he is permanent, he is the creator of everything, and he is the lord of the three worlds, by the power of the three abilities: desire, action, and knowledge. He is the cause of origination, duration, and destruction. Everything arises from him and dissolves into him.

original: brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dbye bas dbye bar 'gyur ba'i @53a * //
analyzed: brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dbye bas dbye bar 'gyur ba'i @53a * //
translated: The world is divided into the categories of the stable and the moving.

original: 'bras bu'i dngos po gang yin pa de dag thams cad 'jig pa'i chos can de las 'byung zhing /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i dngos po gang yin pa de dag thams cad 'jig pa'i chos can de las 'byung zhing /
translated: All things that are effects arise from that which is subject to destruction.

original: rang nyid ni mi 'jig go //
analyzed: rang nyid ni mi 'jig go //
translated: But the self is not subject to destruction.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: 'dir ni gnas skabs gnyis yin te //üîΩbya ba byed pa nyid du grags //
analyzed: 'dir ni gnas skabs gnyis yin te // bya ba byed pa nyid du grags //
translated: Here there are two states:üîΩThe state of activity is well known.

original: bya ba nyid ni zad gyur pa //üîΩbyed pa nyid ni zad med do //
analyzed: bya ba nyid ni zad gyur pa // byed pa nyid ni zad med do //
translated: The state of activity is exhausted,

original: zhes 'byung ngo ;
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo ;
translated: But the state of activity is not exhausted.

original: / sbyor ba ni gang dang gang rgyu rtag pa las byung ba de dag ni 'jig pa'i chos can du mthong ste /
analyzed: / sbyor ba ni gang dang gang rgyu rtag pa las byung ba de dag ni 'jig pa'i chos can du mthong ste /
translated: Whatever is seen to arise from a permanent cause is subject to destruction,

original: dug gi shing gi myu gu dang 'dab ma dang 'bras bu dang yal ga bzhin no //
analyzed: dug gi shing gi myu gu dang 'dab ma dang 'bras bu dang yal ga bzhin no //
translated: Like the sprout, leaf, fruit, and branch of a poisonous tree.

original: rtag pa'i dbang phyug las 'byung ba thams cad 'jig pa'i chos can yin gyi rtsa bar gyur pa'i dbang phyug la 'jig pa med de nam mkha' bzhin zhes rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: rtag pa'i dbang phyug las 'byung ba thams cad 'jig pa'i chos can yin gyi rtsa bar gyur pa'i dbang phyug la 'jig pa med de nam mkha' bzhin zhes rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: Everything that arises from permanent ƒ™≈õvara is subject to destruction, but ƒ™≈õvara, the root, is not subject to destruction, like space. This is a natural inference.

original: smras pa / gal te des khams gsum skyed par byed na de'i tshe ji ltar rtag pa yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / gal te des khams gsum skyed par byed na de'i tshe ji ltar rtag pa yin te /
translated: Objection: If it generates the three realms, then how could it be permanent?

original: byed pa dang rtag pa nyid phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa dang rtag pa nyid phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because activity and permanence are mutually exclusive.

original: byed pa po yin na ci'i phyir sngon du mi byed /
analyzed: byed pa po yin na ci'i phyir sngon du mi byed /
translated: If it is an agent, why does it not always act?

original: lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa ci dgos te /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa ci dgos te /
translated: What need is there to rely on cooperating conditions?

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa ni nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa ni nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which relies on others is not autonomous.

original: yang na ltos pa mi dgos na de'i tshe ci ste byed de nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: yang na ltos pa mi dgos na de'i tshe ci ste byed de nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: Moreover, if it does not need to rely on others, then why does it act? It would be like space.

original: de'i phyir bya ba'i dus dang bya ba med pa'i dus dag yod pas byed pa dang mi byed pas phan tshun 'gal ba yin pas mi rtag pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bya ba'i dus dang bya ba med pa'i dus dag yod pas byed pa dang mi byed pas phan tshun 'gal ba yin pas mi rtag pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, because it sometimes acts and sometimes does not act, it is contradictory for it to be both active and inactive. Therefore it is definitely impermanent.

original: yang na gal te dbang phyug des rang dbang du byed pa yin na de'i tshe sngon du bshad pa'i nus pa gsum la ltos pa mi rigs so //
analyzed: yang na gal te dbang phyug des rang dbang du byed pa yin na de'i tshe sngon du bshad pa'i nus pa gsum la ltos pa mi rigs so //
translated: Moreover, if that ƒ™≈õvara acts autonomously, then it is illogical to rely on the three abilities explained previously.

original: yang na dbang phyug las nus pa tha mi dad pa zhe na /
analyzed: yang na dbang phyug las nus pa tha mi dad pa zhe na /
translated: Or if ƒ™≈õvara is not distinct from the abilities,

original: de'i tshe nus pa kho na byed pa yin gyi dbang phyug ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe nus pa kho na byed pa yin gyi dbang phyug ni ma yin no //
translated: At that time, only the potency is the agent, not God.

original: yang na dbang phyug byed pa po yin na nus pas ci zhig bya //
analyzed: yang na dbang phyug byed pa po yin na nus pas ci zhig bya //
translated: Or, if God is the agent, what does the potency do?

original: yang na dbang phyug gi nus pas zhes 'brel pa gang zhig yin //
analyzed: yang na dbang phyug gi nus pas zhes 'brel pa gang zhig yin //
translated: Or, what is the relation between the potency of God and God?

original: de'i bdag nyid la sngon du bshad pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid la sngon du bshad pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are identical, the previously explained error would follow.

original: rgyu 'bras kyi 'brel pas kyang dbang phyug la nus ba skyes pas dbang phyug 'gog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu 'bras kyi 'brel pas kyang dbang phyug la nus ba skyes pas dbang phyug 'gog par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are related as cause and effect, then God would be refuted because the potency would arise from a cause.

original: de yang 'dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang 'dod pa ma yin te /
translated: But that is unacceptable.

original: de rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because God is permanent.

original: rgyu rnams ni nges par 'bras bu dang ldan par mi 'gyur zhes nus pa kho na rgyu ru 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: rgyu rnams ni nges par 'bras bu dang ldan par mi 'gyur zhes nus pa kho na rgyu ru 'gal ba med do //
translated: It is not contradictory for the potency itself to be the cause, since causes are not necessarily related to their effects.

original: de bas na dbang phyug byed pa por mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na dbang phyug byed pa por mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, God would not be the agent.

original: 'du ba'i 'brel pas de'i bdag nyid du 'thad ce na /
analyzed: 'du ba'i 'brel pas de'i bdag nyid du 'thad ce na /
translated: If you say that it is tenable that they are identical through the relation of inherence,

original: 'du ba zhes bya ba ci yin na snam bu dang snal ma tha dad pa dag la yang 'dir snal ma la snam bu @53b zhes tha snyad yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'du ba zhes bya ba ci yin na snam bu dang snal ma tha dad pa dag la yang 'dir snal ma la snam bu @53b zhes tha snyad yin zhe na /
translated: What is called ‚Äúcollection‚Äù ?  Here, the convention ‚Äúcloth‚Äù is in relation to threads, even though cloth and threads are different.

original: 'o na ni snal ma las ma gtogs pa'i snam bu gang zhig yod /
analyzed: 'o na ni snal ma las ma gtogs pa'i snam bu gang zhig yod /
translated: But then what is cloth that is not other than threads?

original: gang la ltos pas de dag gi 'du ba'i 'brel par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang la ltos pas de dag gi 'du ba'i 'brel par 'gyur /
translated: In dependence on what would they be related as a collection?

original: chu dang zheng gi bdag nyid khebs pa la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pa snam bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: chu dang zheng gi bdag nyid khebs pa la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pa snam bu yin zhe na /
translated: Cloth performs the function of covering, which has the nature of length and width.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: de'i tshe de dag snal ma ma yin gyi snam bu gcig pu kho na don gyi bya ba byed pas so //
analyzed: de'i tshe de dag snal ma ma yin gyi snam bu gcig pu kho na don gyi bya ba byed pas so //
translated: At that time, they are not threads, but cloth alone performs the function of the object.

original: gang don gyi bya ba byed pa de nyid bden pa'i don no //
analyzed: gang don gyi bya ba byed pa de nyid bden pa'i don no //
translated: That which performs the function of the object is the object of truth.

original: gal te snam bu ma yin na de'i tshe snal ma ma yin pas 'brel pa med de /
analyzed: gal te snam bu ma yin na de'i tshe snal ma ma yin pas 'brel pa med de /
translated: If it is not cloth, then since it is not threads, there is no relation.

original: gnyis la 'brel pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis la 'brel pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a relation exists between two things.üîΩMoreover, if the cause, the threads, and the cloth exist as their own nature,

original: yang na rgyu spun dang snam bu rang gi bdag nyid du gnas pa yin na de'i tshe /
analyzed: yang na rgyu spun dang snam bu rang gi bdag nyid du gnas pa yin na de'i tshe /
translated: then at that time,

original: 'brel ba med de rang dbang yin pas so //
analyzed: 'brel ba med de rang dbang yin pas so //
translated: There is no relation, because it is independent.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gang phyir 'brel ba gzhan dbang ni //
analyzed: gang phyir 'brel ba gzhan dbang ni //
translated: Since the relation is dependent,

original: grub pas gzhan dbang gang zhig yod //üîΩde bas dngos po thams cad kyi //
analyzed: grub pas gzhan dbang gang zhig yod // de bas dngos po thams cad kyi //
translated: what is the dependent?üîΩTherefore,

original: de nyid kyis ni 'brel ba med //üîΩces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni 'brel ba med // ces 'byung ngo //
translated: all things are without relation by way of reality.

original: gal te 'du ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pas snal ma dang snam bu'i 'brel pa yin na de'i tshe 'du ba la gzhan 'du ba dang de la yang gzhan dang gzhan thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'du ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pas snal ma dang snam bu'i 'brel pa yin na de'i tshe 'du ba la gzhan 'du ba dang de la yang gzhan dang gzhan thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the relation of the thread and the cloth is a relation characterized by inherence, then it follows that inherence is without end, since inherence would require another inherence, and that another, and so on.

original: gal te ltos pa med na de'i tshe 'brel pa med pa des gang gi 'brel pa byed /
analyzed: gal te ltos pa med na de'i tshe 'brel pa med pa des gang gi 'brel pa byed /
translated: If there is no dependence, then what relation is there without dependence?

original: de bas na snal ma rnams dang snam bu dag tha dad pa kho nar snang bar gyur na /
analyzed: de bas na snal ma rnams dang snam bu dag tha dad pa kho nar snang bar gyur na /
translated: Therefore, if the thread and the cloth were to appear as absolutely distinct,

original: de ltar yang ma mthong ste /
analyzed: de ltar yang ma mthong ste /
translated: then that would be seen, but it is not.

original: 'dir snal ma la snam bu yod ces sgra dang rnam par rtog pa tsam yin gyi tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir snal ma la snam bu yod ces sgra dang rnam par rtog pa tsam yin gyi tshad ma yin no //
translated: Here, the statement ‚ÄúThe cloth is in the thread‚Äù is merely a verbal expression and a conceptual thought, but it is not a valid cognition.

original: de bas na dngos po rnam par dpyod pa na snam bu zhes bya ba med do //
analyzed: de bas na dngos po rnam par dpyod pa na snam bu zhes bya ba med do //
translated: Therefore, when one examines things, there is no such thing as cloth.

original: snal ma kho na ni thags mkhan gyi yongs su las kyi nus pas gnas skabs de lta bu thob pa gang gis khebs pa la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pa'o //
analyzed: snal ma kho na ni thags mkhan gyi yongs su las kyi nus pas gnas skabs de lta bu thob pa gang gis khebs pa la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pa'o //
translated: It is the threads themselves that, by the power of the weaver‚Äôs work, have attained a condition in which they perform the function of covering, etc.

original: blo dman pas snam bu zhes rtog ste /
analyzed: blo dman pas snam bu zhes rtog ste /
translated: The ignorant imagine that it is cloth.

original: bum pa chag pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bum pa chag pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like a broken pot.

original: dper na rdza mkhan gyi sprul pa'i dus su 'jig pa'i chos can kho na bum pa skyes pa de 'jig par byed pa rgyu gzhan med do //
analyzed: dper na rdza mkhan gyi sprul pa'i dus su 'jig pa'i chos can kho na bum pa skyes pa de 'jig par byed pa rgyu gzhan med do //
translated: For example, when a pot is produced, it is subject to destruction at the very time of its creation; there is no other cause of its destruction.

original: tho ba la sogs pa phrad pa'i dus su bum pa chag go zhes 'jig rten pas sems so //
analyzed: tho ba la sogs pa phrad pa'i dus su bum pa chag go zhes 'jig rten pas sems so //
translated: When it comes into contact with a hammer, etc., the world thinks that the pot is destroyed.

original: bum pa de 'jig rten pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bum pa de 'jig rten pa ma yin te /
translated: But the pot is not the world;

original: dang po kho na de 'jig pas so //
analyzed: dang po kho na de 'jig pas so //
translated: it is destroyed from the very beginning.

original: gyo mo la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'i gnas skabs gzhan skyes pa nyid do //
analyzed: gyo mo la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'i gnas skabs gzhan skyes pa nyid do //
translated: It is only the arising of another state, such as shards, etc.,

original: de bzhin du snal ma rnams ni khebs pa la sogs pa'i las can la snam bur btags pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du snal ma rnams ni khebs pa la sogs pa'i las can la snam bur btags pa'o //
translated: In the same way, the threads are designated as cloth because they perform the function of covering, etc.

original: @54a * // de'i phyir 'du ba'i 'brel pa med pas dbang phyug dang nus pa gcig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: @54a * // de'i phyir 'du ba'i 'brel pa med pas dbang phyug dang nus pa gcig pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since there is no relation of inherence, God is not identical with potency.

original: gal te nus pa des nus pa gzhan la ltos pa'am mi ltos pa yin grang /
analyzed: gal te nus pa des nus pa gzhan la ltos pa'am mi ltos pa yin grang /
translated: If potency is dependent on another potency or not dependent on another potency,

original: gal te ltos par byed na de'i tshe des kyang gzhan la ltos pa dgos zhes thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te ltos par byed na de'i tshe des kyang gzhan la ltos pa dgos zhes thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: if it is dependent, then it must be dependent on another, and so on ad infinitum.

original: yang na ltos pa med na nus pa med pa nus pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na ltos pa med na nus pa med pa nus pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not dependent, then that which is not potent is not potent.

original: de bas na skyed par mi byed do //
analyzed: de bas na skyed par mi byed do //
translated: Therefore, it does not produce.

original: nus pa dang dbang phyug tha dad pas skyon snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: nus pa dang dbang phyug tha dad pas skyon snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Since potency and God are different, the previous error is repeated.

original: de nyid kyis na kun shes pa nyid kyang mi rigs te de la thams cad shes pa nyid gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na kun shes pa nyid kyang mi rigs te de la thams cad shes pa nyid gang yin zhe na /
translated: Therefore, omniscience is also not reasonable. What is omniscience?

original: thams cad shes pa na thams cad shes pa zhe na /
analyzed: thams cad shes pa na thams cad shes pa zhe na /
translated: If it is the knowledge of all,

original: 'das pa la sogs pa'i dus gsum na gnas pa'i sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa shes pa'am /
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa'i dus gsum na gnas pa'i sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa shes pa'am /
translated: is it the knowledge of the mental activities of all sentient beings abiding in the three times, past, future, and present,

original: sems kyi rang bzhin shes she na /
analyzed: sems kyi rang bzhin shes she na /
translated: or is it the knowledge of the nature of mind?

original: gal te 'das pa las sogs pa shes na de'i tshe khyu mchog dang 'phel ba la sogs pas byas pa'i skar ma'i bstan bcos yongs su shes pas pha rol po'i sems kyi spyod pa dang dus gsum gyi mtshan nyid bdag cag gis kyang shes pas thams cad shes
analyzed: gal te 'das pa las sogs pa shes na de'i tshe khyu mchog dang 'phel ba la sogs pas byas pa'i skar ma'i bstan bcos yongs su shes pas pha rol po'i sems kyi spyod pa dang dus gsum gyi mtshan nyid bdag cag gis kyang shes pas thams cad shes
translated: If he knows the past, etc., then he would know the nature of the activities of the minds of others, and the characteristics of the three times, because he would know the treatise on astrology composed by Brihaspati, A≈õvin, etc.

original: par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, it follows that he would know everything.

original: yang na sems kyi ngo bo nyid shes pa yin na bdag yod pa'am med par shes she na /
analyzed: yang na sems kyi ngo bo nyid shes pa yin na bdag yod pa'am med par shes she na /
translated: Or, if he knows the nature of mind, does he know the self as existent or as nonexistent?

original: bdag med par ni mi shes te ;
analyzed: bdag med par ni mi shes te ;
translated: He does not know the self as nonexistent,

original: de ltar mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he does not accept that.

original: bdag yod par shes she na /
analyzed: bdag yod par shes she na /
translated: Does he know the self as existent?

original: do mi shes te bdag sngon du bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: do mi shes te bdag sngon du bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He does not know that, because the self has been refuted.

original: dngos po rnams kyi bdag med pa kho na don dam pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi bdag med pa kho na don dam pa yin te /
translated: The selflessness of all things is the ultimate,

original: de yang le'u gnyis pa las 'chad par 'gyur te de'i phyir de ni thams cad shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang le'u gnyis pa las 'chad par 'gyur te de'i phyir de ni thams cad shes pa ma yin no //
translated: and that will be explained in the second chapter. Therefore, he does not know everything.

original: byed pa yin du 'jug na des ni cig car du thams cad ci'i phyir skye ba dang 'jig par mi byed par rim gyis pa'i phyir mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa yin du 'jug na des ni cig car du thams cad ci'i phyir skye ba dang 'jig par mi byed par rim gyis pa'i phyir mi rtag pa'o //
translated: If it is allowed to operate, then why does it not cause the arising and ceasing of everything simultaneously?

original: ltos pa med pa'i dngos pos cig car dang rim gyis don gyi bya ba ma mthong bas nam mkha' bzhin du dbang phyug med do zhes dbang phyug 'dod pa la lan no //
analyzed: ltos pa med pa'i dngos pos cig car dang rim gyis don gyi bya ba ma mthong bas nam mkha' bzhin du dbang phyug med do zhes dbang phyug 'dod pa la lan no //
translated: Since it is not seen that a thing that is independent operates either simultaneously or sequentially, like space, God does not exist.

original: spyod pa la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: spyod pa la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The conduct of the tƒ´rthikas is also twofold:

original: bya ba'i phyogs la gnas pa dang / ye shes kyi phyogs la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba'i phyogs la gnas pa dang / ye shes kyi phyogs la gnas pa'o //
translated: the conduct of those who abide in the side of action and the conduct of those who abide in the side of wisdom.

original: de la bya ba'i phyogs la gnas pa la tshad ma brgyad de /
analyzed: de la bya ba'i phyogs la gnas pa la tshad ma brgyad de /
translated: The conduct of those who abide in the side of action is based on eight authorities:

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: as it is said:üîΩDirect perception, inference,

original: mngon sum dang ni rjes dpag dang // sgra las byung ba dpe dang bcas //
analyzed: mngon sum dang ni rjes dpag dang // sgra las byung ba dpe dang bcas //
translated: scripture with an example,üîΩthe power of things, nonexistence,

original: don gyi shugs dang med nyid dang// @54b srid dang yod snyam de bzhin te //
analyzed: don gyi shugs dang med nyid dang// @54b srid dang yod snyam de bzhin te //
translated: existence, and doubt.üîΩThe conduct of those who abide in the side of wisdom is based on the four authorities of the noble ones:

original: zhes bshad pas so //
analyzed: zhes bshad pas so //
translated: as it is said:üîΩThe four authorities of the noble onesüîΩare direct perception, inference,

original: tshad med rnams kyis dngos po rnams la spyi dang khyad par du 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: tshad med rnams kyis dngos po rnams la spyi dang khyad par du 'jog par byed do //
translated: scripture, and reasoning.üîΩThe four authorities of the tƒ´rthikasüîΩare direct perception, inference,üîΩscripture, and reasoning.

original: mchod sbyin la sogs pa srog gcod pa dang bcas pas kyang mtho ris dang thar ba dag 'dod do //
analyzed: mchod sbyin la sogs pa srog gcod pa dang bcas pas kyang mtho ris dang thar ba dag 'dod do //
translated: Even though the sacrifice and so on are accompanied by killing, they desire heaven and liberation.

original: de yang mi rigs te /üîΩde rnams kyi rigs sam /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te / de rnams kyi rigs sam /
translated: That is not reasonable.

original: gsal ba'am spyi dang ldan pa'am de'i 'brel ba'i sgra don yin zhe na /
analyzed: gsal ba'am spyi dang ldan pa'am de'i 'brel ba'i sgra don yin zhe na /
translated: Is it the universal of those, or the particular, or the universal, or the one possessing it, or the meaning of the word related to that?

original: de la spyi zhes bya ba gang yang dngos po las gud na med de dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa de mi dmigs pa'i phyir bum pas dben pa'i sa phyogs bzhin no //
analyzed: de la spyi zhes bya ba gang yang dngos po las gud na med de dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa de mi dmigs pa'i phyir bum pas dben pa'i sa phyogs bzhin no //
translated: There is no so-called universal apart from the thing, because it is not perceived, like a place devoid of a pot.

original: de lta na gcig gi rnam pa rtog pa dang sgra rtog par byed pa'i rgyu ni spyi yin pas khyed kyis ji ltar sbed par byed can /
analyzed: de lta na gcig gi rnam pa rtog pa dang sgra rtog par byed pa'i rgyu ni spyi yin pas khyed kyis ji ltar sbed par byed can /
translated: In that case, the form of one is the cause of conceptualizing and verbalizing, so how do you conceal the universal?

original: de ni bden pa ma yin te khyad par kho na khyad par gzhan las log pas rnam par rtog pa dang sgra gcig tu skyed par byed ces par gcod par byed pa des ci zhig bya'o //
analyzed: de ni bden pa ma yin te khyad par kho na khyad par gzhan las log pas rnam par rtog pa dang sgra gcig tu skyed par byed ces par gcod par byed pa des ci zhig bya'o //
translated: That is not true. It is only the particular that is the cause of conceptualizing and verbalizing, by being distinguished from other particulars. What is the use of that exclusion?

original: khyad par rnams ni sgra dang rnam par rtog pas so sor bstan mi nus pas sgra dang shes pa gcig pa nyid bskyed pa'i nus pa ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par rnams ni sgra dang rnam par rtog pas so sor bstan mi nus pas sgra dang shes pa gcig pa nyid bskyed pa'i nus pa ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But since the differences cannot be shown individually by words and concepts, how can there be a capacity to produce the identity of the word and the cognition?

original: smras pa / khyad par gyis ni 'jug pa gtso bo sgra dang rnam par rtog pa skyed par mi nus te /
analyzed: smras pa / khyad par gyis ni 'jug pa gtso bo sgra dang rnam par rtog pa skyed par mi nus te /
translated: We reply: The differences cannot be the principal factors in the engagement of the word and the production of the concept.

original: 'on kyang rtog bcas kyi rnam par shes pa la so sor snang ba'i spyi tsam gyis so //
analyzed: 'on kyang rtog bcas kyi rnam par shes pa la so sor snang ba'i spyi tsam gyis so //
translated: However, the mere universal that appears individually to conceptual cognition is the principal factor.

original: de bas ji skad du /üîΩbye brag gzhan ni so sor bkag / ma bkag pa dang de dag gi //
analyzed: de bas ji skad du / bye brag gzhan ni so sor bkag / ma bkag pa dang de dag gi //
translated: Therefore, as it is said:üîΩThe other differences are individually excluded,

original: brda yi bye brag gnas yin te //
analyzed: brda yi bye brag gnas yin te //
translated: but the word is based on the nonexcluded and those.üîΩThe difference of the conventional is

original: shes pa po yi 'dod dor ro //üîΩzhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: shes pa po yi 'dod dor ro // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: abandoned by the one who understands.

original: de'i phyir med pa'i spyi ni khas blangs te ji ltar bdag nyid smod par byed /
analyzed: de'i phyir med pa'i spyi ni khas blangs te ji ltar bdag nyid smod par byed /
translated: Therefore, having accepted the universal of nonexistence, how can one disparage oneself?

original: de bas spyi med de /
analyzed: de bas spyi med de /
translated: Therefore, the universal does not exist.

original: khyad par yang sgra'i don ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par yang sgra'i don ma yin te /
translated: The difference is also not the meaning of the word.

original: khyad par ni don gyi bya ba byed pa 'on kyang de skad cig ma can yin pas mi gnas pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: khyad par ni don gyi bya ba byed pa 'on kyang de skad cig ma can yin pas mi gnas pa'i chos can no //
translated: The difference is that the object performs a function, but since it is momentary, it is a phenomenon that does not endure.

original: gang la ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa med pa de nyid de ji ltar rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'am sgra skyed par nus so //
analyzed: gang la ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa med pa de nyid de ji ltar rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'am sgra skyed par nus so //
translated: How can that which does not exist by way of its own entity generate a conceptual consciousness or a term?

original: ji skad du /üîΩsgra yis mtshon cha bshad pa ste /
analyzed: ji skad du / sgra yis mtshon cha bshad pa ste /
translated: As it is said:üîΩThe term ‚Äúindicative‚Äù is explained;

original: tha snyad phyir ni de bshad do ;
analyzed: tha snyad phyir ni de bshad do ;
translated: it is explained for the sake of convention.

original: / de tshe rang gi mtshan nyid med //üîΩdes na de la brda yang med //
analyzed: / de tshe rang gi mtshan nyid med // des na de la brda yang med //
translated: At that time there is no intrinsic identity;

original: ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ces 'byung ngo //
translated: therefore there is no convention for that.

original: 'di la 'di ltar dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la 'di ltar dpyad par bya ste /
translated: This should be analyzed as follows:

original: ci rtog pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa dang sgra dag las khyad par sngon du 'byung ba'am khyad par las kyang sngon du rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa dang sgra dag 'byung ngam /üîΩci @55a * //
analyzed: ci rtog pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa dang sgra dag las khyad par sngon du 'byung ba'am khyad par las kyang sngon du rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa dang sgra dag 'byung ngam / ci @55a * //
translated: Do the conceptual consciousness and term arise prior to the difference, or does the difference arise prior to the conceptual consciousness and term?

original: lhan cig tu skyes pa rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa dang sgra dang khyad par rnams yin nam /
analyzed: lhan cig tu skyes pa rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa dang sgra dang khyad par rnams yin nam /
translated: Or do the difference and the conceptual consciousness and term that arise simultaneously exist?

original: gal te khyad par dang po skyes na de'i tshe de gang gi yul yin /
analyzed: gal te khyad par dang po skyes na de'i tshe de gang gi yul yin /
translated: If the first difference arises, then at that time, what is its object?

original: yang na phyis skyes pa yin na rnam par rtog pa dang sgra dag gi khyad par dang lhan cig tu phan tshun 'brel pa med do//
analyzed: yang na phyis skyes pa yin na rnam par rtog pa dang sgra dag gi khyad par dang lhan cig tu phan tshun 'brel pa med do//
translated: Or, if it arises later, then there is no mutual connection between the difference and the conceptual thought and the word.

original: rgyu de dag gis rgyu dang 'bras bu 'brel pa ni tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu de dag gis rgyu dang 'bras bu 'brel pa ni tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: By those reasons, the connection between cause and effect is not a valid means of knowledge,

original: 'khrul pa dang ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa dang ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is mistaken and indefinite.

original: khyad par sgra dang rnam par rtog pa rnams lhan cig tu 'byung bas gang gi gang yul yin zhes nges pa med do //
analyzed: khyad par sgra dang rnam par rtog pa rnams lhan cig tu 'byung bas gang gi gang yul yin zhes nges pa med do //
translated: Since the differences, the words, and the conceptual thoughts arise together, there is no certainty as to whose object is which.

original: ma nges pa la brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i 'brel pa med de goo'u sgra dag bzhin no //
analyzed: ma nges pa la brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i 'brel pa med de goo'u sgra dag bzhin no //
translated: In the indefinite, there is no connection between the expressed and the expression, like the words ‚Äúgau·∏•‚Äù and ‚Äúgo·∏•.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang gal te khyad par sgra'i don du brtags na des me'i sgra brjod pa'i dus su kha tshig par 'gyur ba dang / bum pa brjod pa'i dus su yang bum pas kha khengs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te khyad par sgra'i don du brtags na des me'i sgra brjod pa'i dus su kha tshig par 'gyur ba dang / bum pa brjod pa'i dus su yang bum pas kha khengs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if the difference is imagined to be the meaning of the word, then when the word ‚Äúfire‚Äù is uttered, the mouth would be burned, and when the word ‚Äúpot‚Äù is uttered, the mouth would be filled with a pot.

original: de ltar ni ma mthong ste /
analyzed: de ltar ni ma mthong ste /
translated: But this is not seen.

original: de'i phyir na khyad par ni sgra'i don ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir na khyad par ni sgra'i don ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the difference is not the meaning of the word.

original: spyi med pas spyi dang ldan pa'ang med de ldan pa'i sgra ni 'brel pa byed pa'i tshig las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi med pas spyi dang ldan pa'ang med de ldan pa'i sgra ni 'brel pa byed pa'i tshig las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Since there is no universal, there is also no possession of a universal, because the word ‚Äúpossession‚Äù arises from the word ‚Äúconnection.‚Äù

original: 'brel pa ni spyi bkag pa'i sgo nas sel ba yin te /
analyzed: 'brel pa ni spyi bkag pa'i sgo nas sel ba yin te /
translated: And connection is exclusion, as was previously explained in the refutation of universals.

original: gnyis las 'brel pa 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis las 'brel pa 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because connection is asserted to be twofold.

original: de'i phyir sngar bshad pa'i rim pas 'brel pa rtag par byed na dngos po rnams kyi phan tshun 'brel ba gang yang med de thams cad rang nyid las grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir sngar bshad pa'i rim pas 'brel pa rtag par byed na dngos po rnams kyi phan tshun 'brel ba gang yang med de thams cad rang nyid las grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, if one makes connection permanent in the manner previously explained, then there is no connection whatsoever among things, because everything is established from itself alone.üîΩAll things

original: dngos po thams cad rang bzhin gyis //üîΩrang rang ngo bor gnas pa ste //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad rang bzhin gyis // rang rang ngo bor gnas pa ste //
translated: Abide in their own nature.üîΩBecause of the exclusion

original: rang dang gzhan gyi ngo bo las //üîΩgang phyir ldog pa la brten pas //üîΩde phyir dngos rnams gang gang las //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi ngo bo las // gang phyir ldog pa la brten pas // de phyir dngos rnams gang gang las //
translated: From itself and from another.üîΩTherefore, the reason

original: ldog pa de yi rgyu mtshan ni //
analyzed: ldog pa de yi rgyu mtshan ni //
translated: For the exclusion of thingsüîΩFrom each other is thoroughly examined

original: spyi yi dbye bar rab brtags pas //
analyzed: spyi yi dbye bar rab brtags pas //
translated: As a division of universals.

original: de yi khyad par gzung bar byed //üîΩde phyir gang zhig chos gzhan gyi //
analyzed: de yi khyad par gzung bar byed // de phyir gang zhig chos gzhan gyi //
translated: One should grasp its distinction.üîΩTherefore, that which is the realization

original: khyad par yang dag rtogs 'gyur ba //
analyzed: khyad par yang dag rtogs 'gyur ba //
translated: of the distinction of another phenomenon

original: de las gzhan gyis de mi rigs //
analyzed: de las gzhan gyis de mi rigs //
translated: is not suitable from that which is other.

original: des na tha dad tha snyad yin //
analyzed: des na tha dad tha snyad yin //
translated: Therefore, it is a convention of difference.

original: gzhan dbang nyid dang 'brel ba yin //
analyzed: gzhan dbang nyid dang 'brel ba yin //
translated: It is related to the dependent itself.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'brel pa med par bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'brel pa med par bshad do //
translated: Thus, it is explained that there is no relation.

original: de ltar spyi la sogs pa bkag pas dpyod pa pa rnams la sgra'i don nyid med do zhes don gang la tshad ma brgyad don dang ldan par mi 'gyur te gzhal bya med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar spyi la sogs pa bkag pas dpyod pa pa rnams la sgra'i don nyid med do zhes don gang la tshad ma brgyad don dang ldan par mi 'gyur te gzhal bya med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In that way, because universals and so on are refuted, the Mƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsakas do not have the meaning of words. Thus, what object would be endowed with the eight valid knowledges? Because there is no object of comprehension.

original: gang gi phyir tshad ma las gzhal bya grub ces @55b bshad do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshad ma las gzhal bya grub ces @55b bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is explained that the object of comprehension is established from valid knowledge.

original: de bas na yul med pa'i sgra rnams kyis don gang rjod par byed do //
analyzed: de bas na yul med pa'i sgra rnams kyis don gang rjod par byed do //
translated: Therefore, what object do words that do not have an object express?

original: gzhan yang dpyod pa pa rnams kyi sgra'i don ma grub pas kyang khas blangs te lan smra bar bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang dpyod pa pa rnams kyi sgra'i don ma grub pas kyang khas blangs te lan smra bar bya ste /
translated: Moreover, the Mƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsakas‚Äô meaning of words is not established. Nevertheless, we will respond to their assertions.

original: re zhig bya ba'i phyogs su ni mchod sbyin dang khrus dang brtul zhugs dang smyung ba dang dka' thub la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid mtho ris dang thar pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i phyir /
analyzed: re zhig bya ba'i phyogs su ni mchod sbyin dang khrus dang brtul zhugs dang smyung ba dang dka' thub la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid mtho ris dang thar pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i phyir /
translated: In the context of action, the characteristics of sacrifice, bathing, disciplined conduct, fasting, austerities and so on are for the sake of obtaining the result of high rebirth and liberation.üîΩ

original: rnam par 'tshe ba'i bdag nyid kyi las ra gsod pa la sogs pa 'gal ba mi rigs te /
analyzed: rnam par 'tshe ba'i bdag nyid kyi las ra gsod pa la sogs pa 'gal ba mi rigs te /
translated: In the context of action, it is illogical to kill animals such as goats for the sake of attaining the result of high status and liberation, which is characterized by heaven and liberation, through such means as sacrifice, bathing, austerities, fasting, and mortification.

original: mtho ris ni bde ba la long sa spyod pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: mtho ris ni bde ba la long sa spyod pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: Because high status is characterized by the enjoyment of pleasure in the higher realms,

original: bde ba sbyin pas thob par 'gyur gyi srog chags gsod pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bde ba sbyin pas thob par 'gyur gyi srog chags gsod pas ni ma yin no //
translated: it is attained by giving pleasure, not by killing living beings.

original: yang na cho ga mkhan gyi sngags kyi mthus de sgrol ba yin na /
analyzed: yang na cho ga mkhan gyi sngags kyi mthus de sgrol ba yin na /
translated: If you say that the ritual master liberates the animal through the power of his mantra,

original: de ci'i phyir sgo thams cad bkag nas sgrol ba yin te /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir sgo thams cad bkag nas sgrol ba yin te /
translated: why does he liberate it by blocking all its avenues of escape?

original: ci sngags kyi mthu med dam yang na dbang po bkag pa gcig pu gtso bo yin na de'i tshe sngags don med do //
analyzed: ci sngags kyi mthu med dam yang na dbang po bkag pa gcig pu gtso bo yin na de'i tshe sngags don med do //
translated: If the power of the mantra is ineffective, or if blocking the senses is the main thing, then the mantra is pointless.

original: sngags dang bcas pas rlung bkag par byed pa snying rjes gsod pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: sngags dang bcas pas rlung bkag par byed pa snying rjes gsod pa yin zhe na /
translated: If you say that the ritual master kills the animal out of compassion, blocking its wind-energies with the mantra,

original: de lta na shin tu yid du 'ong ba rang gi nye ba rnams ci'i phyir mi gsod /üîΩde ni des mi 'dod ce na /
analyzed: de lta na shin tu yid du 'ong ba rang gi nye ba rnams ci'i phyir mi gsod / de ni des mi 'dod ce na /
translated: If that is so, why not kill one‚Äôs own dear relatives?üîΩIf you say that they do not desire it,

original: phyugs kyis kyang 'dod pa ma yin zhes ci'i phyir rnam par 'tshe /
analyzed: phyugs kyis kyang 'dod pa ma yin zhes ci'i phyir rnam par 'tshe /
translated: why do you harm them?

original: de bas rnam par 'tshe ba'i bdag nyid can me mchod pa'i las la sogs pa sdig pa yin pa'i phyir mtho ris kyi rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas rnam par 'tshe ba'i bdag nyid can me mchod pa'i las la sogs pa sdig pa yin pa'i phyir mtho ris kyi rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the nature of harming is sinful, such as the rite of fire sacrifice, it is not a cause of heaven.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: srog chags gsod pa mi bzad pa //
analyzed: srog chags gsod pa mi bzad pa //
translated: Those who kill living beings,

original: drag po khrag gis lag bsgos pa //
analyzed: drag po khrag gis lag bsgos pa //
translated: cruel, their hands bloody,

original: rtag tu sdig pa'i las spyod pa //
analyzed: rtag tu sdig pa'i las spyod pa //
translated: always engaging in sinful actions,

original: de dag du 'bod skye bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de dag du 'bod skye bar 'gyur // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: are born in the hell of Sa·πÉjƒ´va.

original: gzhan yang rtog pa dang ldan pa'i phyir thar bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rtog pa dang ldan pa'i phyir thar bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, one does not attain liberation because of conceptualization.

original: gang gi bya ba'i phyogs ni me mchod pa dang / kha don dang khrus la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir te rtog pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi bya ba'i phyogs ni me mchod pa dang / kha don dang khrus la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir te rtog pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Since one is endowed with the side of action, such as fire sacrifice, recitation, bathing, and so on, one has conceptualization.

original: thams cad 'dor ba'i rang bzhin ni mi rtog pa ste thar ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad 'dor ba'i rang bzhin ni mi rtog pa ste thar ba'o //
translated: The nature of abandoning everything is non-conceptualization, which is liberation.

original: de bas na rtog pa dang bcas pa'i lam gyis mi rtog pa'i thar pa thob par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na rtog pa dang bcas pa'i lam gyis mi rtog pa'i thar pa thob par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the path that is conceptual will not attain the non-conceptual liberation.

original: rgyu mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cause is not similar.

original: nas kyi sa bon las s'a lu'i 'bras bu mi 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: nas kyi sa bon las s'a lu'i 'bras bu mi 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: A rice sprout does not arise from a barley seed.

original: de bas na rtog pa thams cad yongs su spangs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rtag tu dri ma med pa zag pa med cing rnam par mi rtog pa'i thar pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na rtog pa thams cad yongs su spangs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rtag tu dri ma med pa zag pa med cing rnam par mi rtog pa'i thar pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, by the samƒÅdhi that completely abandons all concepts, one will always attain the stainless, uncontaminated, non-conceptual liberation.

original: de bas khyed cag gi bya ba'i phyogs su 'bras bu gang yang thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes dpyod pa pa rnams @56a * //
analyzed: de bas khyed cag gi bya ba'i phyogs su 'bras bu gang yang thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes dpyod pa pa rnams @56a * //
translated: Therefore, you will not attain any result in the direction of your activities.

original: kyis gtsang sbra la sogs pa ngal ba don med du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kyis gtsang sbra la sogs pa ngal ba don med du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the exertion of the Mƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsakas in purity and so on will be pointless.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:üîΩSome desire virtue through bathing, some are contemptuous of caste,

original: khrus kyis dge 'dod rigs kyis brnyas pa dang // rig byed tshad mar byed pa kha cig yod //
analyzed: khrus kyis dge 'dod rigs kyis brnyas pa dang // rig byed tshad mar byed pa kha cig yod //
translated: some take the Vedas to be valid,

original: sdig pa zad phyir dka' thub la brten pa //
analyzed: sdig pa zad phyir dka' thub la brten pa //
translated: some rely on austerities to exhaust sin.

original: blo med rnams kyi blun po'i rtags lnga'o //
analyzed: blo med rnams kyi blun po'i rtags lnga'o //
translated: These are the five signs of fools among the unwise.

original: zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyi dpyod pa pa rnams la lan no //üîΩye shes kyi phyogs su yang chos gos la sogs pa 'dzin pa ni 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyi dpyod pa pa rnams la lan no // ye shes kyi phyogs su yang chos gos la sogs pa 'dzin pa ni 'gal ba'o //
translated: This is the reply to the Mƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsakas who maintain the thesis stated in the passage from the ≈öƒÅrƒ´rakamƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsƒÅ:üîΩ‚ÄúThe Vedas are eternal, because they are free from the three defects of speech, because they are not contradicted, and because they are like the words of a trustworthy person.‚ÄùüîΩThe Mƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsakas who are VedƒÅntins, and who are Brahmins, maintain the thesis of the omniscience of the one who renounces everything, that is, the self, in the VedƒÅnta.

original: rig byed kyi mtha' gsang bar smra ba bram ze rnams kyi thams cad 'dor ba'i ye shes can gyi phyogs su chos gos 'dzin pa dang / gtsug phud 'dzin pa dang / dbyug pa gsum pa dang / thig le gsum spras pa dang / krishna sa ra'i pags pa gyon pa dang /
analyzed: rig byed kyi mtha' gsang bar smra ba bram ze rnams kyi thams cad 'dor ba'i ye shes can gyi phyogs su chos gos 'dzin pa dang / gtsug phud 'dzin pa dang / dbyug pa gsum pa dang / thig le gsum spras pa dang / krishna sa ra'i pags pa gyon pa dang /
translated: The thesis that one attains reality by holding the ritual thread, by holding the topknot, by holding the three sticks, by wearing the three red dots, by wearing the skin of a black antelope,

original: yul nas yul du 'khyam pa la sogs pa ni 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: yul nas yul du 'khyam pa la sogs pa ni 'gal ba'o //
translated: by wandering from place to place, and so on, is contradictory.

original: dang po dam pa'i rnal 'byor la gnas pa'i brtul zhugs pa rnams kyis de dag thams cad spyod pa ni chos gos la sogs pas de kho nyid thob pa ma yin te spros pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang po dam pa'i rnal 'byor la gnas pa'i brtul zhugs pa rnams kyis de dag thams cad spyod pa ni chos gos la sogs pas de kho nyid thob pa ma yin te spros pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: At first, the ascetics who abide in the yoga of the Vedas practice all of those, but they do not attain reality by means of the ritual thread and so on, because they are conceptual.

original: spros pa med pa'i rgyus spros pa med pa'i 'bras bu bskyed pa yin gyi spros pa dang bcas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: spros pa med pa'i rgyus spros pa med pa'i 'bras bu bskyed pa yin gyi spros pa dang bcas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The effect of freedom from elaborations is produced by the cause of freedom from elaborations, not by that which is associated with elaborations.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gzhan rkyen med cing zhi ba ste //
analyzed: gzhan rkyen med cing zhi ba ste //
translated: Without other conditions, it is peace,

original: spros pa dag gis ma spros pa //
analyzed: spros pa dag gis ma spros pa //
translated: not elaborated by elaborations.üîΩIt is not a different object, nonconceptual‚Äî

original: tha dad don min rnam mi rtog /'di ni yang dag mtshan nyid do//üîΩzhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: tha dad don min rnam mi rtog /'di ni yang dag mtshan nyid do// zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: this is the characteristic of reality.

original: de'i phyir rang gi phyogs khas blangs pa ma grub ste tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi phyogs khas blangs pa ma grub ste tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the position of the opponent is not established because there is no valid cognition.

original: gzhan yang de rnams kyi phyogs ni sna tshogs kyi ngo bo dngos po thams cad gang snang ba de ni tshangs pa nyid kho na'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de rnams kyi phyogs ni sna tshogs kyi ngo bo dngos po thams cad gang snang ba de ni tshangs pa nyid kho na'o //
translated: Moreover, their position is that all things, which are of various natures, are only Brahman, whatever appears.

original: dper na bum pa dang re lde la sogs pa phyi rol du snang ba gang yin pa de dag rnam par dpyod pa na rang gzugs su yod pa ma yin te snang ba gud na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na bum pa dang re lde la sogs pa phyi rol du snang ba gang yin pa de dag rnam par dpyod pa na rang gzugs su yod pa ma yin te snang ba gud na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, whatever appears externally, such as a pot, a fence, and so on, when analyzed, does not exist in its own form because the appearance does not exist elsewhere.

original: snang ba yang bdag nyid kyis yod kyi 'di nyid kyis ni rig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: snang ba yang bdag nyid kyis yod kyi 'di nyid kyis ni rig pa ma yin no //
translated: The light is also by its own nature, but it is not known by this.

original: bdag nyid dang 'di nyid ces phan tshun 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid dang 'di nyid ces phan tshun 'gal ba'o //
translated: The own nature and this are mutually contradictory.

original: de'i phyir snang bar gyur pa'i bdag nyid kyis bsdus pa'i dngos po snang ba gang yin pa de nyid tshangs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir snang bar gyur pa'i bdag nyid kyis bsdus pa'i dngos po snang ba gang yin pa de nyid tshangs pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, whatever entity is included in the light of the own nature of the light is Brahman.

original: rtag tu dga' ba'i bdag nyid bag chags sna tshogs dang bcas pa de nyid kyi dbye ba 'di dag go //
analyzed: rtag tu dga' ba'i bdag nyid bag chags sna tshogs dang bcas pa de nyid kyi dbye ba 'di dag go //
translated: That very thing is the various divisions of the nature of constant bliss together with the various traces.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: tshangs pa'i tshul ni dga' ba ste //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i tshul ni dga' ba ste //
translated: The way of Brahman is bliss.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo zhes tshangs pas smra ba rnams kyi rang gi phyogs te de mi rigs pa ni tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo zhes tshangs pas smra ba rnams kyi rang gi phyogs te de mi rigs pa ni tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is the position of the BrahmavƒÅdins. It is unreasonable because there is no valid cognition.

original: @56b tshangs pa nyid yod pa'i tshad ma mthong ba'o //
analyzed: @56b tshangs pa nyid yod pa'i tshad ma mthong ba'o //
translated: The valid cognition of the existence of Brahman is not seen.

original: re zhig mngon sum yang ma yin te mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: re zhig mngon sum yang ma yin te mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: First, it is not direct perception because it is not conceptual.

original: tshangs pa'i sna tshogs pa nyid ni rnam par rtog pas 'jog bar bya bas so //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i sna tshogs pa nyid ni rnam par rtog pas 'jog bar bya bas so //
translated: The various aspects of Brahman are established by conceptualization.

original: de lta na gzhan yang rtog pa dang bcas pa'ang mngon sum ma yin nam /
analyzed: de lta na gzhan yang rtog pa dang bcas pa'ang mngon sum ma yin nam /
translated: In that case, then also that which is associated with thought is not perception.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: dang po mthong ba'i shes yod de //
analyzed: dang po mthong ba'i shes yod de //
translated: First, there is knowledge of what is seen,

original: rtog pa thams cad rnam bral ba //
analyzed: rtog pa thams cad rnam bral ba //
translated: Free from all thought.

original: byis pa lkugs pa dang 'dra ba'i //
analyzed: byis pa lkugs pa dang 'dra ba'i //
translated: Like a mute,

original: shes pa dag pa'i dngos las byung //
analyzed: shes pa dag pa'i dngos las byung //
translated: Knowledge arises from a pure thing.

original: de las gzhan pa'i dngos po ni //üîΩskyes sogs chos bcas gang gis ni //üîΩblo yis rtogs ba de nyid kyang //üîΩmngon sum nyid du 'dod pa yin //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i dngos po ni // skyes sogs chos bcas gang gis ni // blo yis rtogs ba de nyid kyang // mngon sum nyid du 'dod pa yin //
translated: Other thingsüîΩAre known by the mind through such things as origination.üîΩThat itself

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Is also asserted to be perception.

original: de la smras pa ;
analyzed: de la smras pa ;
translated: To this we reply:

original: dang po mi rtog pa kho na tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: dang po mi rtog pa kho na tshad ma yin te /
translated: First, only that which is non-conceptual is valid knowledge.

original: gang gi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi don gyi bya ba byed nus pa yul dang rgyu yin pa de nyid mi rtog pa tshad ma'o //
analyzed: gang gi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi don gyi bya ba byed nus pa yul dang rgyu yin pa de nyid mi rtog pa tshad ma'o //
translated: That which is the object and cause of the activity of the object that is able to perform a function of its own characteristic is itself non-conceptual valid knowledge.

original: de nyid kyis bya ba byas pa'i phyir gzhan ni brtags pa la brtag pa dang mtshungs pa don med pa ni tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyis bya ba byas pa'i phyir gzhan ni brtags pa la brtag pa dang mtshungs pa don med pa ni tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Because it performs its function by that itself, another that is similar to an investigation of an investigation is meaningless and is not valid knowledge.

original: don dang phrad par byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don dang phrad par byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It does not cause contact with the object.

original: bstan pa'i don la skyes bu 'jug pa na de thob pas tshad ma'i bya ba de nyid du rdzogs so //
analyzed: bstan pa'i don la skyes bu 'jug pa na de thob pas tshad ma'i bya ba de nyid du rdzogs so //
translated: When a person engages in the meaning of the teaching, the function of valid knowledge is completed right there by attaining it.

original: de lta bu'i mtshan nyid dang po kho na la yod kyi /
analyzed: de lta bu'i mtshan nyid dang po kho na la yod kyi /
translated: Such a definition exists only in the first,

original: gnyis pa la ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ma yin no //
translated: but not in the second.

original: de'i phyir mi rtog pa'i bdag nyid mngon sum gyi ni de yul ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi rtog pa'i bdag nyid mngon sum gyi ni de yul ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, that is not the object of direct perception, which has a non-conceptual nature.

original: gang gi yul yin pa de ni tshad ma ma yin no zhes tshangs pa nyid la yod pa la mngon sum mi 'jug go //
analyzed: gang gi yul yin pa de ni tshad ma ma yin no zhes tshangs pa nyid la yod pa la mngon sum mi 'jug go //
translated: That which is its object is not valid knowledge. Thus, direct perception does not engage in Brahmanhood.

original: rjes su dpag pa yang de bzhin te gang gi phyir rjes su dpag pa ni rtags dang rtags can gyi 'brel pa sngon du 'gro bar 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang de bzhin te gang gi phyir rjes su dpag pa ni rtags dang rtags can gyi 'brel pa sngon du 'gro bar 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: Inference is also like that, because inference engages with the connection between the reason and the property possessor as a prerequisite,

original: du ba dang me bzhin no //
analyzed: du ba dang me bzhin no //
translated: like smoke and fire.

original: tshangs pa de'i 'bras bur gyur pa'i rtags gang yang ma mthong ste /
analyzed: tshangs pa de'i 'bras bur gyur pa'i rtags gang yang ma mthong ste /
translated: No reason that is the effect of Brahmanhood is seen at all.

original: gang gis de mthong ba med par mi 'byung bas rtags can du gyur pa tshangs pa nyid dpag par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis de mthong ba med par mi 'byung bas rtags can du gyur pa tshangs pa nyid dpag par bya'o //
translated: Since it does not occur without seeing that, Brahmanhood, which becomes the property possessor, should be inferred.

original: dngos po thams cad de las 'byung ba yin zhes 'bras bu mthong bas de dpag par bya zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad de las 'byung ba yin zhes 'bras bu mthong bas de dpag par bya zhe na /
translated: If you say that since the effect is seen, it is inferred that all things arise from that,

original: de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te /
translated: that is not correct.

original: gang 'bras bu skyed par byed pa de ni rgyu nyid de /
analyzed: gang 'bras bu skyed par byed pa de ni rgyu nyid de /
translated: That which produces the effect is the cause itself.

original: 'bras bu byung bas de 'jig par 'gyur bas rtag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu byung bas de 'jig par 'gyur bas rtag pa ma yin no //
translated: Since the effect arises, it is not permanent.

original: tshangs pa nyid kyi tshul ni khyed cag gi phyogs su rtag par 'dod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: tshangs pa nyid kyi tshul ni khyed cag gi phyogs su rtag par 'dod pa ma yin nam /
translated: Brahman, is it not that your system asserts permanence?

original: re zhig rgyu nyid du 'dod na yang /
analyzed: re zhig rgyu nyid du 'dod na yang /
translated: Even if you assert it as the cause,

original: rang dang 'dra ba'i 'bras bu ci'i phyir mi skyed phyin ci log par skyed pa la rigs pa ma mthong ngo //üîΩdper na lha @57a * //
analyzed: rang dang 'dra ba'i 'bras bu ci'i phyir mi skyed phyin ci log par skyed pa la rigs pa ma mthong ngo // dper na lha @57a * //
translated: why does it not produce an effect that is similar to itself? It is not logical to produce an effect that is contrary to it.

original: la sogs pa kha cig bde bar gyur pa dang / yi dags la sogs pa kha cig sdug bsngal can du mthong ba'i phyir ro //üîΩde'i sna tshogs pa nyid de lta bu yod ce na /üîΩsmras pa sna tshogs pa nyid ni de dang tha dad pa yin nam /
analyzed: la sogs pa kha cig bde bar gyur pa dang / yi dags la sogs pa kha cig sdug bsngal can du mthong ba'i phyir ro // de'i sna tshogs pa nyid de lta bu yod ce na / smras pa sna tshogs pa nyid ni de dang tha dad pa yin nam /
translated: For example, some gods and so on are seen to be happy, and some hungry ghosts and so on are seen to be miserable.üîΩIf you say that such diversity exists in Brahman,üîΩwe reply: Is that diversity different from Brahman or not?

original: tha mi dad pa yin /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa yin /
translated: If it is different,

original: tha dad pa yin na tshangs pa de nyid kyis der mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa yin na tshangs pa de nyid kyis der mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are different, then Brahma himself would not be that.

original: dbyer med pas de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de dang 'dra ba dga' ba'i gzugs can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbyer med pas de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de dang 'dra ba dga' ba'i gzugs can du 'gyur te /
translated: If they are not different, then whatever is the nature of that would be the form of pleasure.

original: tshangs pa'i gzugs ni dga' ba ste //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i gzugs ni dga' ba ste //
translated: The form of Brahma is pleasure.

original: zhes bshad pas so //
analyzed: zhes bshad pas so //
translated: This is explained.

original: de ltar yang ma mthong ste de'i phyir na 'bras bu'i rjes su dpag pa med do //
analyzed: de ltar yang ma mthong ste de'i phyir na 'bras bu'i rjes su dpag pa med do //
translated: But that is not seen, therefore there is no inference of an effect.

original: yang na skyon de bsal bar bya ba'i phyir rgyu'i rjes su dpag pa rtog par byed na /
analyzed: yang na skyon de bsal bar bya ba'i phyir rgyu'i rjes su dpag pa rtog par byed na /
translated: Or, if you imagine an inference of a cause in order to remove that fault,üîΩfor example,

original: dper na / bung ba ma he sbrul dag dang // ta ma la yi 'od nag can //
analyzed: dper na / bung ba ma he sbrul dag dang // ta ma la yi 'od nag can //
translated: bees, buffaloes, and snakes,üîΩand the dark light of the tamala tree,

original: sprin rnams de dang 'dra ba ni //
analyzed: sprin rnams de dang 'dra ba ni //
translated: clouds are like that,

original: char 'bab nam yang slu mi byed //
analyzed: char 'bab nam yang slu mi byed //
translated: never deceiving when it rains.

original: ces 'byung ba de bzhin du tshangs pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid gal te med na de'i tshe sna tshogs pa nyid kyang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ces 'byung ba de bzhin du tshangs pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid gal te med na de'i tshe sna tshogs pa nyid kyang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If Brahma, the nature of all, does not exist, then diversity would not arise.

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: To that, we reply:

original: rgyu'i rjes su dpag pa ni slu ba yin pa'i phyir nges pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: rgyu'i rjes su dpag pa ni slu ba yin pa'i phyir nges pa med pa nyid do //
translated: Inference from the effect to the cause is uncertain, because it is deceptive.

original: dper na / phyogs bcur khyab pa'i shin tu nag po'i mdog can sprin rnams las kyang char res 'ga' mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dper na / phyogs bcur khyab pa'i shin tu nag po'i mdog can sprin rnams las kyang char res 'ga' mi 'byung ngo //
translated: For example, rain does not always fall from clouds that are very dark and spread over the ten directions.

original: nyi ma dro ba'i dus su sprin chung du las kyang char pa 'byung bar mthong bas rgyu'i rjes su dpag pa ni slu ba kho na'o //
analyzed: nyi ma dro ba'i dus su sprin chung du las kyang char pa 'byung bar mthong bas rgyu'i rjes su dpag pa ni slu ba kho na'o //
translated: And rain falls from small clouds at a time when the sun is warm. Therefore, inference from the effect to the cause is deceptive.

original: des ni grog mo 'byung ba dang nya 'phar ba la sogs pa bkag go //
analyzed: des ni grog mo 'byung ba dang nya 'phar ba la sogs pa bkag go //
translated: This refutes the inference from the appearance of ants to the appearance of rain, and so on.

original: spyi ru mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa ni rtog par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: spyi ru mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa ni rtog par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: Inference from what is seen in general is conceptual.

original: dper na khang bzangs la sogs pa brtsigs pa'i sngon du 'gro ba 'phel bar mthong bas nags kyi sman la sogs pa rnams kyi skye ba sngon du 'gro ba'i 'phel ba rjes su dpag par bya'o //
analyzed: dper na khang bzangs la sogs pa brtsigs pa'i sngon du 'gro ba 'phel bar mthong bas nags kyi sman la sogs pa rnams kyi skye ba sngon du 'gro ba'i 'phel ba rjes su dpag par bya'o //
translated: For example, one infers the growth of trees and so on in the forest from the growth of trees and so on that one has seen previously when building a house and so on.

original: de ltar tshangs pa'i sna tshogs pa nyid kyis dngos po sna tshogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar tshangs pa'i sna tshogs pa nyid kyis dngos po sna tshogs pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, the diversity of things is due to the diversity of Brahman.

original: tshig gi don sna tshogs pa nyid kyang tshangs pa'i sna tshogs pa nyid rjes su dpag par bya'o //
analyzed: tshig gi don sna tshogs pa nyid kyang tshangs pa'i sna tshogs pa nyid rjes su dpag par bya'o //
translated: The various meanings of the words should be inferred to be the various meanings of BrahmƒÅ.

original: de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te /
translated: But that is not reasonable.

original: gang gi phyir tshangs pa sna tshogs pa smra ba pos tshangs pa'i rang bzhin can dngos po rnams 'dod do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshangs pa sna tshogs pa smra ba pos tshangs pa'i rang bzhin can dngos po rnams 'dod do //
translated: Because the various meanings of BrahmƒÅ are asserted to be things that have the nature of BrahmƒÅ.

original: spyir mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa'i phyogs su tha dad par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyir mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa'i phyogs su tha dad par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In general, inference based on perception would entail a fallacy of overextension.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshig gi don @57b rnams gud du grub pa yin pas tshangs pa'i sna tshogs pa nyid nges pa dang tshangs pa yang gud na grub pas tshig gi don sna tshogs tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: tshig gi don @57b rnams gud du grub pa yin pas tshangs pa'i sna tshogs pa nyid nges pa dang tshangs pa yang gud na grub pas tshig gi don sna tshogs tha dad pa'o //
translated: Because the meanings of the words are established separately, the various meanings of BrahmƒÅ are ascertained, and BrahmƒÅ is also established separately, so the various meanings of the words are different.

original: de las slu ba nyid kyis kyang nges pa med de /
analyzed: de las slu ba nyid kyis kyang nges pa med de /
translated: And because of deception, there is no certainty.

original: de yang dper na spyir mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa ni slu bar mthong ste /
analyzed: de yang dper na spyir mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa ni slu bar mthong ste /
translated: For example, inference based on perception in general is seen to be deceptive.

original: khang bzangs la sogs pa'i 'phel ba skye ba sngon du 'gro bas nags tshal la sogs pa'i 'phel ba rtogs par mi byed do //
analyzed: khang bzangs la sogs pa'i 'phel ba skye ba sngon du 'gro bas nags tshal la sogs pa'i 'phel ba rtogs par mi byed do //
translated: The growth of a forest, etc. is not understood from the growth of a house, etc. which precedes it.

original: nags tshal la sogs pa kha cig ni chu 'bab pas kyang 'phel bar mi 'gyur ba dang / kha cig kyang mig 'phrul mkhan gyis sprul pa yang mthong ngo //
analyzed: nags tshal la sogs pa kha cig ni chu 'bab pas kyang 'phel bar mi 'gyur ba dang / kha cig kyang mig 'phrul mkhan gyis sprul pa yang mthong ngo //
translated: And some forests, etc. do not grow even from the flow of water, and some are seen to be conjured up by magicians.

original: de bas na rjes su dpag pa des des pa med do //
