analyzed: de bas na rjes su dpag pa des des pa med do //
translated: Therefore, that inference is not conclusive.

original: sgra las byung ba yang tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra las byung ba yang tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: Nor is verbal testimony a means of valid knowledge,

original: tshangs pa'i sna tshogs pa nyid la sngon du bshad pa'i rigs pas sgra dang don dag gi 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i sna tshogs pa nyid la sngon du bshad pa'i rigs pas sgra dang don dag gi 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because, as previously explained, there is no connection between the word and its meaning in the case of the diversity of Brahman.

original: don tsam yang so sor bstan par sgras mi nus na de'i sna tshogs pa nyid ji ltar brjod /
analyzed: don tsam yang so sor bstan par sgras mi nus na de'i sna tshogs pa nyid ji ltar brjod /
translated: If a word cannot express even a mere object, how can it express its diversity?

original: spyi'i rnam pas nus kyang sgra'i rang gi mtshan nyid dang lhan cig tu don gyi rang gi mtshan nyid la brjod pa dang rjod par byed pa'i mtshan nyid med do //
analyzed: spyi'i rnam pas nus kyang sgra'i rang gi mtshan nyid dang lhan cig tu don gyi rang gi mtshan nyid la brjod pa dang rjod par byed pa'i mtshan nyid med do //
translated: Although it is possible in general, the intrinsic identity of the word does not have the identity of expressing or being expressed simultaneously with the intrinsic identity of the object.

original: spyi'i yang gong du bkag pas ji ltar de kho bos tshad mar gzung /
analyzed: spyi'i yang gong du bkag pas ji ltar de kho bos tshad mar gzung /
translated: Since the general has been refuted above, how can I accept that as valid?

original: skad cig ma yin pas kyang nges pa med de /
analyzed: skad cig ma yin pas kyang nges pa med de /
translated: Also, there is no certainty due to momentariness.

original: gang gi phyir sgra ni gnas dang byed pa dang skyes bu'i rtsol ba las 'byung bas brjod ma thag tu 'jig par 'gyur ba de rang gzugs su yod par mi 'gyur bas ji ltar don rtogs par byed de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgra ni gnas dang byed pa dang skyes bu'i rtsol ba las 'byung bas brjod ma thag tu 'jig par 'gyur ba de rang gzugs su yod par mi 'gyur bas ji ltar don rtogs par byed de /
translated: Because sound arises from place, action, and the effort of the person, it would cease immediately after being uttered, and since it would not exist in its own form, how could it cause the object to be understood?

original: ga dang au dang tsheg drag rnams re re lhan cig tu mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ga dang au dang tsheg drag rnams re re lhan cig tu mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because ga, au, and visarga are not observed individually or together.

original: rna ba'i dbang pos gzung bar bya ba dbyangs tsam ni rtogs par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rna ba'i dbang pos gzung bar bya ba dbyangs tsam ni rtogs par byed pa yin te /
translated: Only the melody that is to be apprehended by the ear faculty is the cause of understanding,

original: dril bu'i sgra bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: dril bu'i sgra bzhin no zhe na /
translated: like the sound of a bell.

original: smras pa yi ge dang tshig dang ngag rnams kyis rang gi ngo bo dor nas don gzhan gyi dbyangs tsam mi dmigs so //
analyzed: smras pa yi ge dang tshig dang ngag rnams kyis rang gi ngo bo dor nas don gzhan gyi dbyangs tsam mi dmigs so //
translated: Reply: Having abandoned the nature of letters, words, and speech, one does not observe mere sound as another object.

original: de rnams zhig nas dbyangs ni mi 'jig par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de rnams zhig nas dbyangs ni mi 'jig par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could sound be imperishable after they perish?

original: de'i phyir na dbyangs tsam gyi tha snyad ni btags pa yin gyi nges pa'i rgyur ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir na dbyangs tsam gyi tha snyad ni btags pa yin gyi nges pa'i rgyur ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the convention of mere sound is a designation, but it is not a cause of ascertainment.

original: dpe yang tshad ma ma yin te gang gi phyir de ni chos gsum dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: dpe yang tshad ma ma yin te gang gi phyir de ni chos gsum dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: An example is not a valid means of knowledge because it has three properties:

original: dpe dang dpe las byung ba dang thun mong gi chos kyis so //
analyzed: dpe dang dpe las byung ba dang thun mong gi chos kyis so //
translated: the example, the property of the example, and the common property.

original: dper na ba dang 'dra ba ni ba men no //üîΩde la ba men mthong ba'i skyes bus pa la gnas pa'i lkog shal la @58a * //üîΩsogs pa'i chos mthun pa'i phyir ba men ma mthong ba'i skyes bu kha cig rtogs par byed de /
analyzed: dper na ba dang 'dra ba ni ba men no // de la ba men mthong ba'i skyes bus pa la gnas pa'i lkog shal la @58a * // sogs pa'i chos mthun pa'i phyir ba men ma mthong ba'i skyes bu kha cig rtogs par byed de /
translated: For example, a gayal is like a cow.üîΩWhen a person sees a gayal, he understands that a gayal is like a cow because of the common property of the dewlap, etc.

original: ba dang 'dra ba ni ba men no zhes pas so //
analyzed: ba dang 'dra ba ni ba men no zhes pas so //
translated: Some person who has not seen a gayal understands it because of the statement, ‚ÄúA gayal is like a cow.‚Äù

original: des ni de'i ba men yin zhes khong du chud do //
analyzed: des ni de'i ba men yin zhes khong du chud do //
translated: He understands that it is a gayal.

original: de bzhin du 'dir tshangs pa'i sna tshogs pa nyid dngos po sna tshogs pa nyid kyis dpe ma yin pa dang / de la sogs pas kyang ma yin te de dang mthun pa'i chos med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir tshangs pa'i sna tshogs pa nyid dngos po sna tshogs pa nyid kyis dpe ma yin pa dang / de la sogs pas kyang ma yin te de dang mthun pa'i chos med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the same way, here, the diversity of BrahmƒÅ is not an example of the diversity of things, and so on, because there is no property common to both.

original: tshangs pa ni gzugs med pa dang / dngos po rnams gzugs can yin pas gang gis dper bya'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa ni gzugs med pa dang / dngos po rnams gzugs can yin pas gang gis dper bya'o //
translated: BrahmƒÅ is formless, and things are form, so by what are they to be exemplified?

original: don gyi shugs kyis kyang nges pa med do //
analyzed: don gyi shugs kyis kyang nges pa med do //
translated: Nor is there ascertainment by the force of the meaning.

original: dper na lha sbyin chen po nyin par mi za zhes bya bas don gyi shugs kyis mtshan mo za zhes nges so //
analyzed: dper na lha sbyin chen po nyin par mi za zhes bya bas don gyi shugs kyis mtshan mo za zhes nges so //
translated: For example, by the statement ‚ÄúMahƒÅdeva does not eat during the day,‚Äù the force of the meaning ascertains that he eats at night.

original: de ltar tshig gi don rnams la sna tshogs pa med do //
analyzed: de ltar tshig gi don rnams la sna tshogs pa med do //
translated: Thus, there is no diversity in the meanings of the words.

original: don gyi shugs kyis tshangs pa la yod do zhes mi rigs te /
analyzed: don gyi shugs kyis tshangs pa la yod do zhes mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable to say that the force of the meaning exists in BrahmƒÅ,

original: dngos po rnams la sna tshogs pa nyid dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po rnams la sna tshogs pa nyid dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the diversity of things is observed.

original: gcig bkag pas chos gzhan nges par dmigs pas ni don gyi shugs so //
analyzed: gcig bkag pas chos gzhan nges par dmigs pas ni don gyi shugs so //
translated: The force of the meaning is the ascertainment of one thing by the negation of another.

original: de yang dngos po dang tshangs pa dag la med do //
analyzed: de yang dngos po dang tshangs pa dag la med do //
translated: And that does not exist in things or in BrahmƒÅ.

original: dngos po med pa yang tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa yang tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: Non-entity is not a valid cognition,

original: gang gi phyir de la rnam pa bzhi yod de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de la rnam pa bzhi yod de /
translated: because it has four aspects:

original: snga na med pa dang 'jig pas med pa dang phan tshun med pa dang shin tu med pa'o //
analyzed: snga na med pa dang 'jig pas med pa dang phan tshun med pa dang shin tu med pa'o //
translated: non-existence prior to, non-existence due to destruction, mutual non-existence, and complete non-existence.

original: de la snga na med pa ni 'o ma zhor gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de la snga na med pa ni 'o ma zhor gyur pa'o //
translated: Among them, non-existence prior to is milk turning into curd.

original: 'jig pas med pa ni bum pa thob dang phrad pas 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig pas med pa ni bum pa thob dang phrad pas 'jig pa'o //
translated: Non-existence due to destruction is a pot destroyed by meeting with a blow.

original: phan tshun med pa ni snam bu dang bum pa dag go //
analyzed: phan tshun med pa ni snam bu dang bum pa dag go //
translated: Mutual non-existence is cloth and pot.

original: shin tu med pa ni ri bong gi rva la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu med pa ni ri bong gi rva la sogs pa'o //
translated: Complete non-existence is the horn of a rabbit, and so on.üîΩNon-entity is a valid cognition with respect to a non-existent object, but not with respect to an existent object.

original: dngos po med pa ni yul la dngos po med pa tshad ma yin gyi dngos po yod pa'i yul du ni ma yin no zhes ji ltar des ni dngos po'i chos ni tshangs pa'i sna tshogs pa nyid sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni yul la dngos po med pa tshad ma yin gyi dngos po yod pa'i yul du ni ma yin no zhes ji ltar des ni dngos po'i chos ni tshangs pa'i sna tshogs pa nyid sgrub par byed de /
translated: How does it establish the various qualities of an entity, such as the Brahman?

original: dgag pa gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgag pa gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because negation is primary.

original: zho la mar srid pa dang / til 'bru la mar khu zhes srid pa ni tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: zho la mar srid pa dang / til 'bru la mar khu zhes srid pa ni tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: The existence of butter in milk and the existence of oil in sesame seeds are not valid cognitions.

original: sa mi gshin pa las skyes pa'i til 'bru rnams la mar khu mi 'byung bas so //
analyzed: sa mi gshin pa las skyes pa'i til 'bru rnams la mar khu mi 'byung bas so //
translated: because sesame oil does not arise from sesame seeds that are not ripe.

original: phal cher la dgongs pa ni nges par byed pa'i rgyu ma yin te slu ba'i phyir ro snyam pas yod pa yang tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: phal cher la dgongs pa ni nges par byed pa'i rgyu ma yin te slu ba'i phyir ro snyam pas yod pa yang tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: The intention is that the majority is not a cause of ascertainment, because it is deceptive.

original: shing 'di la gnod sbyin yod pa dang / khang pa 'di la sha za yod do zhes nges pa med do //
analyzed: shing 'di la gnod sbyin yod pa dang / khang pa 'di la sha za yod do zhes nges pa med do //
translated: The existence of a yak·π£a in this tree and the existence of a pi≈õƒÅca in this house are not ascertained.

original: res 'ga' de nas gzhan du 'gro ba'i phyir dang sngags shes pa'i skyes bu'i nus pa'i @58b 'brel pas gnod sbyin la sogs pa bskrad pa rnams der mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: res 'ga' de nas gzhan du 'gro ba'i phyir dang sngags shes pa'i skyes bu'i nus pa'i @58b 'brel pas gnod sbyin la sogs pa bskrad pa rnams der mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because sometimes they go elsewhere and because the yak·π£a and so on are expelled by the power of a mantra-knowing person and do not remain there.

original: de bzhin du 'dir tshangs pa'i sna tshogs pa nyid dngos po rnams la ma des so //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir tshangs pa'i sna tshogs pa nyid dngos po rnams la ma des so //
translated: In the same way, here the diversity of BrahmƒÅ is not ascertained in things.üîΩThe unseen, by nature, is distant, like a pi≈õƒÅca and so on.

original: ma mthong ba rang bzhin gyis bskal pa sha za la sogs pa la snyam pa zhes bya bas nges par byed par rigs so //
analyzed: ma mthong ba rang bzhin gyis bskal pa sha za la sogs pa la snyam pa zhes bya bas nges par byed par rigs so //
translated: Thus it is reasonable to ascertain.

original: sna tshogs pa ni mngon sum gyis snang na snyam pas ji ltar nges par byed do //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa ni mngon sum gyis snang na snyam pas ji ltar nges par byed do //
translated: The diversity is perceived by direct perception. How can it be ascertained?

original: de bas na tshad ma brgyad kyis ma grub pa'i tshangs pa nyid dang de'i sna tshogs pa nyid du gnas pa dad pa dam pa ba rnams ji ltar grol bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de bas na tshad ma brgyad kyis ma grub pa'i tshangs pa nyid dang de'i sna tshogs pa nyid du gnas pa dad pa dam pa ba rnams ji ltar grol bar 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, the highest faith of the faithful in the non-establishment of Brahman and its diversity by the eight means of valid knowledge‚Äîhow can that be liberated?

original: des ni tshangs pa zhi ba smra ba'i phyogs kyang bkag go / gal te tshangs ba nyid dngos po'i sna tshogs ma skyes pa zhi ba yin no //
analyzed: des ni tshangs pa zhi ba smra ba'i phyogs kyang bkag go / gal te tshangs ba nyid dngos po'i sna tshogs ma skyes pa zhi ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the position of the proponents of the peace of Brahman is also refuted. If the diversity of entities is not produced, it is peace.

original: ji ltar dngos po 'di rnams rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po 'di rnams rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ngo //
translated: How do these entities appear in various aspects?

original: de rnams kyang zhi ba yin zhes 'dod pa rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de rnams kyang zhi ba yin zhes 'dod pa rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable to assert that they are peace.

original: tshad ma dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it contradicts valid knowledge.

original: gang gi phyir mthong ba la mi rigs pa zhes bya ba med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mthong ba la mi rigs pa zhes bya ba med do //
translated: Because there is no such thing as ‚Äúunreasonable‚Äù in perception.

original: 'khrul pa kho na dngos po rnams kyi sna tshogs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'khrul pa kho na dngos po rnams kyi sna tshogs pa yin zhe na /
translated: If the diversity of entities is just error,

original: 'khrul pa ni ci de las tha dad pa'am tha mi dad ce na /
analyzed: 'khrul pa ni ci de las tha dad pa'am tha mi dad ce na /
translated: is error different from them or not different?

original: tha dad pa yin na 'khrul pa dang tshangs pa nyid gnyis ka yod ces tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa yin na 'khrul pa dang tshangs pa nyid gnyis ka yod ces tha dad pa'o //
translated: If they are different, then both error and Brahman would exist, and they would be different.

original: tshangs pa ni gnyis su med pas 'gal lo //
analyzed: tshangs pa ni gnyis su med pas 'gal lo //
translated: But Brahman is nondual, so this is contradictory.

original: tha mi dad pa ni tshangs pa nyid 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin du song bas de kho na nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa ni tshangs pa nyid 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin du song bas de kho na nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are not different, then Brahman would become the nature of error, and it would not be reality.

original: de ni 'khrul pa med pa yin du 'jug na ci'i phyir 'khrul pa skyed par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'khrul pa med pa yin du 'jug na ci'i phyir 'khrul pa skyed par byed pa yin te /
translated: If it is accepted that Brahman is without error, then why does it generate error?

original: 'gyur ba med pa la spros pa med de nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa la spros pa med de nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: There is no proliferation in the unchanging, like space.

original: de bas na zhi ba'i tshangs pa nyid smra ba'i phyogs ni mi rigs so zhes tshad ma ba dpyod pa pa'i lan no //
analyzed: de bas na zhi ba'i tshangs pa nyid smra ba'i phyogs ni mi rigs so zhes tshad ma ba dpyod pa pa'i lan no //
translated: Therefore, the position of the proponents of peaceful Brahman is unreasonable. This is the response of the logicians.

original: de rnams bstan pa drug la gnas pa phyin ci log pa'i blo can du bshad do //
analyzed: de rnams bstan pa drug la gnas pa phyin ci log pa'i blo can du bshad do //
translated: They are explained as having mistaken minds that abide in the six teachings.

original: nges pa'i blo can ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: nges pa'i blo can ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Those with certain minds are of four types:

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang rnal 'byor spyod pa dang dbu ma'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang rnal 'byor spyod pa dang dbu ma'i dbye bas so //
translated: ≈õrƒÅvakas, pratyekabuddhas, yogƒÅcƒÅras, and MƒÅdhyamikas.

original: de la nyan thos pa'i gzhung ni bden pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la nyan thos pa'i gzhung ni bden pa bzhi ste /
translated: The scriptures of the Sravakas are the four noble truths.

original: sdug bsngal dang ; kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang ; kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mo //
translated: They are the truths of suffering, origin, cessation, and the path.

original: de la bden pa gnyis ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dbye bas gnas pa ni 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: de la bden pa gnyis ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dbye bas gnas pa ni 'khor ba'o //
translated: Among them, two truths are the basis of the distinction of cause and effect, which is samsara.

original: bden pa yang gnyis ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bye brag gi mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa yang gnyis ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bye brag gi mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Two truths are nirvana, distinguished by cause and effect.

original: de la 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i dbye bas nyon mongs @59a * //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i dbye bas nyon mongs @59a * //
translated: Among them, the afflictions are divided into the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm.

original: pa dgu bcu rtsa brgyad mthong ba dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyis spangs te /
analyzed: pa dgu bcu rtsa brgyad mthong ba dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyis spangs te /
translated: They are abandoned by the path of seeing and the path of cultivation.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa gtsor gyur pa rang gi don tsam dang ldan pa nyan thos kyi byang chub thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa gtsor gyur pa rang gi don tsam dang ldan pa nyan thos kyi byang chub thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: One attains the enlightenment of the Sravakas, which is endowed with the mere benefit for oneself, the meditative absorption of cessation being foremost.

original: de rnams kyi re ba ni gzhan gyi don gyis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de rnams kyi re ba ni gzhan gyi don gyis ci zhig bya /
translated: What use is it to them to have the benefit of others?

original: bdag gi don ni bsgrub bya yin //
analyzed: bdag gi don ni bsgrub bya yin //
translated: The benefit for oneself is what should be accomplished.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: Such statements occur.

original: de rnams gang zag la bdag med par 'dod cing /
analyzed: de rnams gang zag la bdag med par 'dod cing /
translated: They assert the selflessness of persons.

original: phung po la sogs pa chos rnams la bdag yod par 'dod cing gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa la zhen pa'o //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa chos rnams la bdag yod par 'dod cing gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa la zhen pa'o //
translated: They assert that the self exists in phenomena such as the aggregates, and they cling to the apprehended and the apprehender.

original: de'i phyir de rnams kyi grol ba rnam par dag pa ma yin pas sngags kyi theg pa chen por snod ma yin par bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de rnams kyi grol ba rnam par dag pa ma yin pas sngags kyi theg pa chen por snod ma yin par bshad do //
translated: Therefore, since their liberation is not pure, they are explained to be unsuitable vessels for the Great Vehicle of Mantra.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: dge slong nyid du gang gnas pa //
analyzed: dge slong nyid du gang gnas pa //
translated: Those who abide as bhik·π£us,

original: gang yang rtog ge ba rnams mi //
analyzed: gang yang rtog ge ba rnams mi //
translated: Those who are logicians,üîΩThose who are old,

original: rgan por gyur pa gang rnams dang // de la de nyid bstan mi bya //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rgan por gyur pa gang rnams dang // de la de nyid bstan mi bya // zhes gsungs so //
translated: The truth should not be taught to them.

original: mdo sde pa zhes bya bas rjes su dpag pas phyi'i don 'dod de /
analyzed: mdo sde pa zhes bya bas rjes su dpag pas phyi'i don 'dod de /
translated: The so-called SautrƒÅntikas assert external objects through inference.

original: phyi'i don ni gcig dang du mas ma grub pas med pas kyang rnam par shes pa'i skye ba gzhan du na mi 'gyur bas rjes su dpag pa yin te /
analyzed: phyi'i don ni gcig dang du mas ma grub pas med pas kyang rnam par shes pa'i skye ba gzhan du na mi 'gyur bas rjes su dpag pa yin te /
translated: Since external objects are not established as singular or manifold, they do not exist. Since consciousness would not arise in any other way, it is an inference.

original: mig gi dbang po bzhin no zhes rjes su dpog pa'i mdo sde pa phyi'i don smra ba rnams kyis snga ma bzhin du thar pa ni rnam par ma dag pas de dag kyang sngags kyi snod du rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po bzhin no zhes rjes su dpog pa'i mdo sde pa phyi'i don smra ba rnams kyis snga ma bzhin du thar pa ni rnam par ma dag pas de dag kyang sngags kyi snod du rung ba ma yin no //
translated: As before, they say that liberation is not possible for those whose minds are impure, and so they are not suitable as vessels for the mantra vehicle.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The Yogacaras are of two types:

original: rnam pa dang bcas pa smra ba dang / rnam pa med pa smra ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa dang bcas pa smra ba dang / rnam pa med pa smra ba'o //
translated: those who speak of aspects and those who do not speak of aspects.

original: de la dngos po thams cad phyi rol du so sor snang ba rnams rang gi rnam pa yin te /
analyzed: de la dngos po thams cad phyi rol du so sor snang ba rnams rang gi rnam pa yin te /
translated: The former say that all things that appear externally are one's own aspects.

original: rang gi rnam par snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi rnam par snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They say that because they appear as one's own aspects,

original: gang dang gang rang snang ba'i dngos po de dang de yod de blo bzhin no ;
analyzed: gang dang gang rang snang ba'i dngos po de dang de yod de blo bzhin no ;
translated: whatever things appear to oneself exist, like the mind.

original: / gzhan gyi snang ba bum pa la sogs par rang nyid kyis yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: / gzhan gyi snang ba bum pa la sogs par rang nyid kyis yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The latter say that things that appear to others, such as pots, do not exist by themselves.

original: gzhan gang yin pa de rnam par shes pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gang yin pa de rnam par shes pa yin no //
translated: Whatever is other is consciousness.

original: don ni gcig dang du mar ma grub pas zhes grags so zhes smra ba de'i gzhung ni mi bden te /
analyzed: don ni gcig dang du mar ma grub pas zhes grags so zhes smra ba de'i gzhung ni mi bden te /
translated: The meaning is that since it is not established as one or many, it is renowned.

original: gal te don med na gang la ltos nas rnam par shes pa 'byung /
analyzed: gal te don med na gang la ltos nas rnam par shes pa 'byung /
translated: If the object does not exist, with respect to what would consciousness arise?

original: rnam par shes pas na rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pas na rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Because it is consciousness, it is consciousness.

original: de bas na rnam par rig pa smra ba rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba 'di yin te /
analyzed: de bas na rnam par rig pa smra ba rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba 'di yin te /
translated: Therefore, this proponent of representation contradicts his own words,

original: rnam par shes pa 'dod pa dang don 'gog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'dod pa dang don 'gog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he asserts consciousness but refutes the object.

original: gal te gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam par rtog pa 'khrul pa yin na de'i tshe rnam par rig pa yang 'khrul par 'gyur @59b ro ;
analyzed: gal te gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam par rtog pa 'khrul pa yin na de'i tshe rnam par rig pa yang 'khrul par 'gyur @59b ro ;
translated: If the conception of apprehended and apprehender is mistaken, then at that time representation would also be mistaken.

original: / des khas blangs na yang de'i thar pa ma dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / des khas blangs na yang de'i thar pa ma dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: If he accepts that, then his liberation would be impure.üîΩOr else, why would it not be pure?

original: yang na ci'i phyir rnam par ma dag / bdag cag rnams kyi ni mtshan nyid gsum ste /
analyzed: yang na ci'i phyir rnam par ma dag / bdag cag rnams kyi ni mtshan nyid gsum ste /
translated: For us, there are three natures:

original: kun brtags dang / gzhan dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'o //
analyzed: kun brtags dang / gzhan dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'o //
translated: the imagined, the dependent, and the consummate.

original: de la kun brtags ni yang dag ba ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de la kun brtags ni yang dag ba ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The imagined is the characteristic of unreal imagination.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: It is the discrimination of apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: gzhan dbang zhes bya ba ni de'i rnam pa so sor snang ba'i 'khrul ba'i gzhi'o //
analyzed: gzhan dbang zhes bya ba ni de'i rnam pa so sor snang ba'i 'khrul ba'i gzhi'o //
translated: The dependent is the basis of error, the appearance of its aspects.

original: yongs su grub pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis kyis stong pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis kyis stong pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The perfected is the characteristic of emptiness of duality.

original: dngos po shes don de yi rnams //
analyzed: dngos po shes don de yi rnams //
translated: Things and consciousnesses and their aspects

original: de med pa nyid mkhas pa yis //
analyzed: de med pa nyid mkhas pa yis //
translated: are not existent for the wise.

original: kun brtags la sogs mtshan nyid ni //
analyzed: kun brtags la sogs mtshan nyid ni //
translated: The characteristics of the imagined and so on

original: go rims bzhin du shes par bya //üîΩzhes 'byung ngo //üîΩde la mtshan nyid gnyis med pas yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ni spros pa'i dri ma thams cad dang bral ba /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du shes par bya // zhes 'byung ngo // de la mtshan nyid gnyis med pas yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ni spros pa'i dri ma thams cad dang bral ba /
translated: should be understood in order.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes zhes bya ba rnam par dag pa'i thar pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes zhes bya ba rnam par dag pa'i thar pa yin zhe na /
translated: The perfected nature, which is the nonexistence of the duality of subject and object, is the pure liberation called the pristine wisdom of the expanse of reality, free from all stains of conceptual elaboration.

original: de yang bden pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang bden pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not so, becauseüîΩthe imagined nature is not established by valid cognition.

original: rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni mdud pa thams cad dang bral ba'i stong pa nyid du bshad kyi //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni mdud pa thams cad dang bral ba'i stong pa nyid du bshad kyi //
translated: Purity is explained as emptiness free from all knots.

original: rnam par rig pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not consciousness.

original: de'i dmigs pa ji srid blo la rgyu ba de'i bar du rnam par ma dag pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dmigs pa ji srid blo la rgyu ba de'i bar du rnam par ma dag pa'o //
translated: As long as the mind moves toward its object, it is impure.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:üîΩThe teachings about consciousness

original: 'byung ba che sogs rnam shes la //
analyzed: 'byung ba che sogs rnam shes la //
translated: and the great elements, etc.

original: bstan pa de dag 'gog par 'gyur //
analyzed: bstan pa de dag 'gog par 'gyur //
translated: are stopped.

original: de ni ye shes la thi ma zhing //
analyzed: de ni ye shes la thi ma zhing //
translated: That is not wisdom,

original: nges par phyin ci log pa yin //üîΩzhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: nges par phyin ci log pa yin // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: it is definitely mistaken.

original: kam pa la'i zhal snga nas kyis //
analyzed: kam pa la'i zhal snga nas kyis //
translated: Kambala says:

original: re zhig thams cad brdzun yin te //
analyzed: re zhig thams cad brdzun yin te //
translated: First, everything is false.üîΩAs long as there is conceptualization,

original: ji srid ji srid rnam par rtog / gang zhig rtog par mi byed pa //üîΩde yi bden pa de nyid yin //
analyzed: ji srid ji srid rnam par rtog / gang zhig rtog par mi byed pa // de yi bden pa de nyid yin //
translated: for one who does not conceptualize,

original: zhes gsungs so ;
analyzed: zhes gsungs so ;
translated: that is the truth of reality.

original: / rnam rig tsam nyid 'di dag ces //
analyzed: / rnam rig tsam nyid 'di dag ces //
translated: These are just consciousnesses,

original: de ltar nye bar dmigs gyur pa //
analyzed: de ltar nye bar dmigs gyur pa //
translated: thus it is observed.

original: mdun du cung zad 'jog byed na //
analyzed: mdun du cung zad 'jog byed na //
translated: If one places it a little in front,

original: de tsam la yang gnas mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de tsam la yang gnas mi 'gyur //
translated: it will not remain just that much.

original: zhes khyed cag rnams kyi rnag gi tshig dang 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: zhes khyed cag rnams kyi rnag gi tshig dang 'gal ba'o //
translated: This contradicts your own words.

original: 'o na ji ltar 'gal ba yin zhes 'dod na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar 'gal ba yin zhes 'dod na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúHow is it contradictory?‚ÄùüîΩwe reply:

original: smras pa / gang tshe shes pa'i dmigs pa ni //
analyzed: smras pa / gang tshe shes pa'i dmigs pa ni //
translated: When the object of consciousness

original: dmigs pa nyid du mi 'gyur na //
analyzed: dmigs pa nyid du mi 'gyur na //
translated: is not an object of consciousness,

original: de tshe rnam rig la gnas shing //
analyzed: de tshe rnam rig la gnas shing //
translated: then abiding in consciousness,

original: gzung ba med pas de mi 'dzin //
analyzed: gzung ba med pas de mi 'dzin //
translated: since there is no object, it is not apprehended.

original: zhe na / de yang bden pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhe na / de yang bden pa ma yin te /
translated: That is also not correct.

original: gang gi phyir de lta bus kyang stong pa nyid ni mngon par rtogs pa ma yin te /üîΩrnam par rig par 'jig par byas pa'i phyir de yang sngon du @60a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta bus kyang stong pa nyid ni mngon par rtogs pa ma yin te / rnam par rig par 'jig par byas pa'i phyir de yang sngon du @60a * //
translated: Because in that way emptiness is not directly perceived.

original: bkag zin to //
analyzed: bkag zin to //
translated: Since it is the destruction of consciousness, it was previously refuted.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gal te shes pa shes bya'i sngon //
analyzed: gal te shes pa shes bya'i sngon //
translated: If consciousness precedes the object of consciousness,

original: ci la dmigs te de byung ste //
analyzed: ci la dmigs te de byung ste //
translated: with respect to what object does it arise?

original: shes bya zhig pas shes 'byung na //
analyzed: shes bya zhig pas shes 'byung na //
translated: If consciousness arises from the destruction of the object of consciousness,

original: ci la dmigs te de 'byung 'gyur //
analyzed: ci la dmigs te de 'byung 'gyur //
translated: with respect to what object does it arise?

original: zhes 'byung bas shes pa dang shes bya dag la 'brel pa med pas rnam par shes pa'i snang ba med do ;
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas shes pa dang shes bya dag la 'brel pa med pas rnam par shes pa'i snang ba med do ;
translated: Since there is no relation between consciousness and the object of consciousness, the appearance of consciousness does not exist.

original: / de'i phyir de lta bu'i lta ba can sngags kyi theg pa chen po la mi 'jug pas rjes su gzung bar bya'o zhes rnam par rig pa smra ba po rnams la lan no //
analyzed: / de'i phyir de lta bu'i lta ba can sngags kyi theg pa chen po la mi 'jug pas rjes su gzung bar bya'o zhes rnam par rig pa smra ba po rnams la lan no //
translated: Therefore, those who have such a view should be accepted as followers of the Mantra Vehicle of the Great Vehicle.

original: dbu ma pa zhes bya bas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba 'ba' zhig tu dri ma med pa'i mtha' yas pa nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa /
analyzed: dbu ma pa zhes bya bas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba 'ba' zhig tu dri ma med pa'i mtha' yas pa nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa /
translated: The Madhyamikas, on the other hand, maintain that the ultimate is the sole absence of the conceptualization of subject and object, which is stainless, infinite, and like space.

original: dngos po thams cad kyi de kho na nyid ces bya ba 'dod de rnam par thar pa gsum gyis rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad kyi de kho na nyid ces bya ba 'dod de rnam par thar pa gsum gyis rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is called the reality of all things, because it is to be realized by means of the three doors of liberation.

original: de bas na dngos po thams cad stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: de bas na dngos po thams cad stong pa nyid de /
translated: Therefore, all things are emptiness,

original: gcig dang du mas bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig dang du mas bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are devoid of unity and multiplicity.

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan dang bral ba dngos po rnams yin te dbang phyug la sogs pa dpyod pa na mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan dang bral ba dngos po rnams yin te dbang phyug la sogs pa dpyod pa na mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Things are devoid of the causal signs of ƒ™≈õvara, etc., because ƒ™≈õvara, etc., are not perceived when investigated.

original: dngos po thams cad smon pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad smon pa med pa yin te /
translated: All things are wishless,üîΩbecause they are devoid of the nature of the three defilements.

original: smon par bya ba ma grub pas so //
analyzed: smon par bya ba ma grub pas so //
translated: Because the object of the prayer is not established.

original: 'di la sbyor ba ni dngos po thams cad stong pa yin te gcig dang du mas bral ba'i phyir gzugs brnyan bzhin no //üîΩde la gal te /
analyzed: 'di la sbyor ba ni dngos po thams cad stong pa yin te gcig dang du mas bral ba'i phyir gzugs brnyan bzhin no // de la gal te /
translated: Here, the argument is: all things are empty, because they are free from being one or many, like a reflection.

original: chos mthun pa'i dpes ngo bo med pa nyid dmigs na de bzhin du yang de tsam las gtan tshigs kyi 'brel ba nges so //
analyzed: chos mthun pa'i dpes ngo bo med pa nyid dmigs na de bzhin du yang de tsam las gtan tshigs kyi 'brel ba nges so //
translated: In this regard, if the non-existence of entity is perceived through a similar example, then in that case, the connection of the reason is ascertained from just that much.

original: rjes su 'gro ba nye bar len pa'i ldog pa don gyis rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba nye bar len pa'i ldog pa don gyis rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the reverse of the pervasion is understood by implication.

original: mkhas pa rnams kyis gtan tshigs gcig pu tsam gyis nges pa yin gyi yan lag lnga'am yan lag gsum gyi tshig gi sbyor ba bstan mi dgos so //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyis gtan tshigs gcig pu tsam gyis nges pa yin gyi yan lag lnga'am yan lag gsum gyi tshig gi sbyor ba bstan mi dgos so //
translated: The wise ascertain [the reason] through just the single reason, and it is not necessary to teach the application of the five-membered or three-membered statement.

original: de dngos dang ni rgyu dngos dag / dpe yis de ni mi rigs la //
analyzed: de dngos dang ni rgyu dngos dag / dpe yis de ni mi rigs la //
translated: By the actual [example], the actual cause, and the example, that is unreasonable.

original: smra ba yin gyi mkhas pa la //
analyzed: smra ba yin gyi mkhas pa la //
translated: It is the speaker, not the wise one,

original: gtan tshigs gcig pu smra ba yin //
analyzed: gtan tshigs gcig pu smra ba yin //
translated: who speaks of the single reason.

original: de'i phyir phyogs dang dpe la sogs pa'i tshig rgyas pa spangs te rjes su 'gro ba tsam gyis kho bo cag gi stong pa nyid du 'grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyogs dang dpe la sogs pa'i tshig rgyas pa spangs te rjes su 'gro ba tsam gyis kho bo cag gi stong pa nyid du 'grub po //
translated: Therefore, we establish emptiness by mere implication, having abandoned the words of the example and so on.

original: gal te gcig dang du mas bral ba tsam gyis stong pa nyid nges par byed na /
analyzed: gal te gcig dang du mas bral ba tsam gyis stong pa nyid nges par byed na /
translated: If emptiness is ascertained by mere freedom from singularity and plurality,

original: de ci'i phyir bye brag bco brgyad pa'i stong pa nyid gsungs she na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir bye brag bco brgyad pa'i stong pa nyid gsungs she na /
translated: why did the Buddha teach the emptiness of the eighteen dhƒÅtus?

original: smras pa 'dir ni gdod ma nas ma rig pa'i bag chags kyi shugs kyi dbang gis @60b ji srid rnam par rtog pa de dang de dag gi rgyu ba spang ba'i don du 'bad pa bya ba yin te /
analyzed: smras pa 'dir ni gdod ma nas ma rig pa'i bag chags kyi shugs kyi dbang gis @60b ji srid rnam par rtog pa de dang de dag gi rgyu ba spang ba'i don du 'bad pa bya ba yin te /
translated: We reply: Here, from the beginning, the power of the force of the latent tendencies of ignorance is such that one should strive to abandon the movement of this and that discursive thought.

original: nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang / chen po stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang / chen po stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid dang /
translated: The eighteen are the emptiness of the inner, the emptiness of the outer, the emptiness of the outer and inner, the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of great immensity, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena,

original: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang ; mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin med pa stong pa nyid dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang ; mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin med pa stong pa nyid dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang /
translated: The emptiness of the compounded and the emptiness of the uncompounded, the emptiness of what transcends limits, the emptiness of no beginning or end, the emptiness of non-repudiation, the emptiness of inherent natures, the emptiness of all things,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / ngo bo med pa'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / ngo bo med pa'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid do //
translated: the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence, and the emptiness of the essential nature of non-repudiation.

original: nang gi chos ni mig la sogs pa nyid kyis stong pa yin no zhes stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: nang gi chos ni mig la sogs pa nyid kyis stong pa yin no zhes stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of inner phenomena refers to the eyes and so forth being empty of their own identity.

original: phyi'i chos ni gzugs la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: phyi'i chos ni gzugs la sogs pa ste /
translated: Outer phenomena are forms and so forth.

original: de dag gzugs la sogs pa stong pa nyid kyis stong pa zhes phyi stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de dag gzugs la sogs pa stong pa nyid kyis stong pa zhes phyi stong pa nyid do //
translated: They are empty of the emptiness of forms and so forth. This is the emptiness of the outer.

original: nang dang phyi'i chos ni nang dang phyi'i chos nyid kyis stong pa ste phyi nang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: nang dang phyi'i chos ni nang dang phyi'i chos nyid kyis stong pa ste phyi nang stong pa nyid do //
translated: Inner and outer phenomena are empty of the identity of inner and outer phenomena. This is the emptiness of the outer and inner.

original: chos thams cad kyis stong pa gang yin pa de nyid kyis stong pa yin no zhes stong pa nyid kyi stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyis stong pa gang yin pa de nyid kyis stong pa yin no zhes stong pa nyid kyi stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of emptiness is the emptiness of that emptiness by means of which all things are empty.

original: shar la sogs pa'i phyogs rnams la shar la sogs pa'i phyogs nyid kyis stong pa yin no zhes stong pa chen po'o //
analyzed: shar la sogs pa'i phyogs rnams la shar la sogs pa'i phyogs nyid kyis stong pa yin no zhes stong pa chen po'o //
translated: The great emptiness is the emptiness of the eastern direction, etc.

original: don dam pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: don dam pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: The ultimate is nirvana.

original: de yang mya ngan las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyis stong pa yin zhes don dam pa'i stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de yang mya ngan las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyis stong pa yin zhes don dam pa'i stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of that is the emptiness of the ultimate.

original: 'dus byas pa ni khams gsum ste /
analyzed: 'dus byas pa ni khams gsum ste /
translated: The compounded is the three realms.

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams so //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams so //
translated: They are the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm.

original: de de rnams kyis stong pa yin no zhes 'dus byas stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de de rnams kyis stong pa yin no zhes 'dus byas stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of those is the emptiness of the compounded.

original: skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dang bral ba ni 'dus ma byas pa ste /
analyzed: skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dang bral ba ni 'dus ma byas pa ste /
translated: The uncompounded is that which is free from arising, enduring, and ceasing.üîΩThe emptiness of that is the emptiness of the uncompounded.

original: de de nyid kyis stong pa ni 'dus ma byas kyi stong pa nyid dang / rtag pa dang chad pa dag ni mtha'o //
analyzed: de de nyid kyis stong pa ni 'dus ma byas kyi stong pa nyid dang / rtag pa dang chad pa dag ni mtha'o //
translated: The extremes are eternalism and annihilationism.

original: de dag nyid kyis stong pa ni mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de dag nyid kyis stong pa ni mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of that itself is the emptiness of what is beyond extremes.

original: gang thog ma dang ma med pa de la bden pa'i dngos po med de /
analyzed: gang thog ma dang ma med pa de la bden pa'i dngos po med de /
translated: That which has no beginning and no end is devoid of a truly existent entity.

original: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med cing thog ma dang bar dang mthas stong pa'i phyir thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med cing thog ma dang bar dang mthas stong pa'i phyir thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i stong pa nyid do //
translated: Since it is empty of a beginning, middle, and end, it is the emptiness of what is without beginning or end.

original: dor ba ni spang ba ste de las log pa ni dor ba med pa ste /
analyzed: dor ba ni spang ba ste de las log pa ni dor ba med pa ste /
translated: Discarding is rejecting. The opposite of that is non-discarding.

original: de nyid kyis stong pas na dor ba med pa'i stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid kyis stong pas na dor ba med pa'i stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of that itself is the emptiness of non-discarding.

original: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa @61a * //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa @61a * //
translated: The nature of all phenomena

original: de ni sus kyang ma byas pa dang 'dus ma byas pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni sus kyang ma byas pa dang 'dus ma byas pa yang ma yin te /
translated: is not created by anyone, nor is it unconditioned.

original: de rang bzhin gyis stong pas na /
analyzed: de rang bzhin gyis stong pas na /
translated: Since that is empty of itself,

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa'o //
translated: it is the emptiness of nature.

original: chos thams cad ni 'dus byas pa dang 'dus ma byas pa de dag de nyid kyis stong pas na chos thams cad stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni 'dus byas pa dang 'dus ma byas pa de dag de nyid kyis stong pas na chos thams cad stong pa nyid do //
translated: Since all phenomena, whether conditioned or unconditioned, are empty of their very own nature, it is the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: chos thams cad ni rang rang gi gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis stong pas na rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni rang rang gi gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis stong pas na rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid do //
translated: Since all phenomena are empty of their own characteristics, such as form, etc., there is emptiness of own-characteristics.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba nyid kyis stong pas na mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba nyid kyis stong pas na mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: Since the past, future, and present are empty, there is emptiness of non-apprehension.

original: sbyor ba las byung ba'i chos kyi mtshan nyid med de rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba las byung ba'i chos kyi mtshan nyid med de rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The characteristics of the dharmas that arise from application do not exist, because they arise from dependent origination.

original: sbyor ba ni sbyor ba nyid kyis stong pas na ngo bo nyid do //üîΩrang bzhin gyis stong pas na rang gi ngo bo stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni sbyor ba nyid kyis stong pas na ngo bo nyid do // rang bzhin gyis stong pas na rang gi ngo bo stong pa nyid do //
translated: Since application is empty of application itself, there is emptiness of essential nature.üîΩSince the essential nature is empty of the essential nature itself, there is emptiness of essential nature.

original: dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin dngos po de de nyid kyis stong pas na ngo bo med pa'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin dngos po de de nyid kyis stong pas na ngo bo med pa'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid do //
translated: Since the nature of non-entity is empty of that very non-entity itself, there is emptiness of the nature of non-entity.

original: de'i phyir stong pa nyid bco brgyad bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir stong pa nyid bco brgyad bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the eighteen kinds of emptiness are taught.

original: de bas na rnam par thar pa gsum thob pas rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rjes thogs la sa bcu gnyis pa kun tu 'od kyi sa la byang chub sems dpas byang chub thob bo zhes de nyid yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid do
analyzed: de bas na rnam par thar pa gsum thob pas rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rjes thogs la sa bcu gnyis pa kun tu 'od kyi sa la byang chub sems dpas byang chub thob bo zhes de nyid yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid do
translated: Therefore, the Bodhisattva attains enlightenment on the twelfth stage, the stage of Universal Light, immediately after the vajra-like samadhi, by attaining the three liberations.

original: // phyogs der nyan thos la sogs pa'i 'dod pa'i dngos po'i mngon par zhen pa med de /
analyzed: // phyogs der nyan thos la sogs pa'i 'dod pa'i dngos po'i mngon par zhen pa med de /
translated: In that direction, there is no clinging to the desired things of sravakas and so on,

original: de rnams kyi stong pa nyid mngon du gyur pa la spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyi stong pa nyid mngon du gyur pa la spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their emptiness has become manifest and is abandoned.

original: ji skad du /üîΩdngos po gos dang 'dra ba rnams //
analyzed: ji skad du / dngos po gos dang 'dra ba rnams //
translated: As it is said:üîΩThings, like clothes,

original: rnam pa du mas tha dad pa //
analyzed: rnam pa du mas tha dad pa //
translated: are differentiated in many ways.

original: stong pa nyid kyi mes tshig na //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mes tshig na //
translated: When they are burned by the fire of emptiness,

original: thal ba'i dbye ba gang yang med //üîΩsnod dang sems can zhes bya ba'i //
analyzed: thal ba'i dbye ba gang yang med // snod dang sems can zhes bya ba'i //
translated: there is no differentiation of ashes.

original: 'jig rten gnyis po 'dis bsregs nas //üîΩda yang rang nyid de nyid du //
analyzed: 'jig rten gnyis po 'dis bsregs nas // da yang rang nyid de nyid du //
translated: When the two worlds, called the world of the vessel and the world of beings,üîΩare burned,üîΩthen again, like a lamp,

original: me sgron bzhin du zhi bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: me sgron bzhin du zhi bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes 'byung ngo //
translated: they are pacified in reality.

original: sngon gyi smon lam dang snying rje chen pos bskul bas sems can gyi don 'grub pa yin pas chad pa'i phyogs med do //
analyzed: sngon gyi smon lam dang snying rje chen pos bskul bas sems can gyi don 'grub pa yin pas chad pa'i phyogs med do //
translated: Since the benefit of sentient beings is accomplished by the power of former prayers and great compassion, there is no extreme of annihilation.üîΩSince one is always absorbed in the concentration free from all conceptual elaborations, there is no extreme of permanence.

original: spros pa thams cad dang bral ba'i ting nge 'dzin la rtag tu gzhol bas rtag pa yang med do zhes stong pa nyid smra ba theg pa chen po ba bdag cag rnams kyi zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi bdag nyid zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi
analyzed: spros pa thams cad dang bral ba'i ting nge 'dzin la rtag tu gzhol bas rtag pa yang med do zhes stong pa nyid smra ba theg pa chen po ba bdag cag rnams kyi zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi bdag nyid zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi
translated: Thus, the Mahayana proponents of emptiness, ourselves, have the concentration of the union of serenity and insight.

original: phyogs so // 'o na mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'i rnam par thar pa yang yod de de ci'i phyir ma bstan zhe na /
analyzed: phyogs so // 'o na mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'i rnam par thar pa yang yod de de ci'i phyir ma bstan zhe na /
translated: Now, is there also a liberation that is non-compounded? If so, why is it not taught?

original: de ni yod pa bden @61b te ;
analyzed: de ni yod pa bden @61b te ;
translated: It is true that it exists,

original: 'on kyang gsum pa la goms pas 'bad pa med par lhun gyis grub pa yin te chu thigs bzhin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang gsum pa la goms pas 'bad pa med par lhun gyis grub pa yin te chu thigs bzhin no //
translated: but it is spontaneously achieved without effort by being habituated to the third, just as in the case of the water-crystal.

original: de bas de ni byang chub kyi rgyu yin yang shin tu nye ba'i phyir 'bras bu yang yin pa la skyon gang yang med do //
analyzed: de bas de ni byang chub kyi rgyu yin yang shin tu nye ba'i phyir 'bras bu yang yin pa la skyon gang yang med do //
translated: Therefore, although it is a cause of enlightenment, it is also an effect, and there is no fault in that, because it is very close to enlightenment.

original: dbu ma pa de rnams gal te rang bzhin med par smra na yang sngags kyi theg pa chen po ni thabs du mas khyad par du 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbu ma pa de rnams gal te rang bzhin med par smra na yang sngags kyi theg pa chen po ni thabs du mas khyad par du 'gyur te /
translated: Although those Madhyamikas speak of essencelessness, the Mantra Mahayana is distinguished by many methods.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said,

original: don gcig pa la ma rmongs phyir //
analyzed: don gcig pa la ma rmongs phyir //
translated: Because of non-delusion with respect to the same object,

original: thabs mang bas ni dka' thub med //
analyzed: thabs mang bas ni dka' thub med //
translated: Because of many methods, there is no hardship,

original: dbang po rno ba'i dbang byas nas //
analyzed: dbang po rno ba'i dbang byas nas //
translated: Because of the sharpness of the faculties,

original: sngags kyi theg pa khyad par 'phags //üîΩzhes 'byung ngo //üîΩde la pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor pas chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid de kho na ji ltar thob pa bzhin du sngags kyi theg pa chen po pa rnams kyis kyang thob par 'gyur ro zhes 'bras bu log par rtog pa gang
analyzed: sngags kyi theg pa khyad par 'phags // zhes 'byung ngo // de la pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor pas chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid de kho na ji ltar thob pa bzhin du sngags kyi theg pa chen po pa rnams kyis kyang thob par 'gyur ro zhes 'bras bu log par rtog pa gang
translated: The Mantra Vehicle is especially exalted.

original: yang med do //
analyzed: yang med do //
translated: There is no misconception of the effect, that is, that the practitioners of the Mantra Mahayana attain just that which is the nature of the exalted wisdom of the expanse of reality, just as it is attained by the practitioners of the perfections.

original: 'on kyang de rnams la rmongs pa yod de /
analyzed: 'on kyang de rnams la rmongs pa yod de /
translated: However, they are deluded with respect to that.

original: dper na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thugs rje'i dbang gis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir don gnyer ba rnams la mgo bo la sogs pa sbyin par byed de /
analyzed: dper na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thugs rje'i dbang gis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir don gnyer ba rnams la mgo bo la sogs pa sbyin par byed de /
translated: For example, a bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva, out of compassion, in order to perfect the perfection of generosity, gives his head and so on to those who request it.

original: de'i des ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i des ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: By that, he does not become perfected in the perfection of generosity,

original: sems can gcig la phan pa yin gyi kun la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gcig la phan pa yin gyi kun la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it benefits only one being, not all.

original: gang gi phyir sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas na pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas na pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because of the perfection of generosity, it is called a perfection.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de ni dge ba'i 'du byed de dag gis gzhan dang gzhan du skye zhing 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de ni dge ba'i 'du byed de dag gis gzhan dang gzhan du skye zhing 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: For that very reason, he is reborn and transmigrates through death in other and other existences by those wholesome formations.

original: de bas na bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis thob pa'i byang chub can ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis thob pa'i byang chub can ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one who attains enlightenment through three incalculable aeons is called a bodhisattva.

original: sngags kyi theg pa la gnas pa la rmongs pa med de /
analyzed: sngags kyi theg pa la gnas pa la rmongs pa med de /
translated: For one abiding in the Mantra Vehicle, there is no delusion.

original: 'gro ba gsum por nges sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa spro ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis cig car du rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba gsum por nges sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa spro ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis cig car du rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the three types of beings are certain to give the perfection of generosity, and so on, in sequence, and all at once, they are perfected.

original: sems can gyi bsod nams kyi bdag po'i rkyen dang de rnams kyi skal ba nyid kyis kyang bsam ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi bsod nams kyi bdag po'i rkyen dang de rnams kyi skal ba nyid kyis kyang bsam ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: And also, by the condition of the merit of sentient beings, and by their own good fortune, all wishes are fulfilled.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: lha yi dbang pos char phab kyang //
analyzed: lha yi dbang pos char phab kyang //
translated: Even though the lord of the gods sends down rain,

original: sa bon ngan pa skye mi 'gyur //
analyzed: sa bon ngan pa skye mi 'gyur //
translated: bad seeds do not grow.

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni byung na yang //üîΩskal med pas ni 'bras mi thob //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni byung na yang // skal med pas ni 'bras mi thob //
translated: Even when the buddhas appear,

original: ces 'byung ngo //üîΩde nyid kyi @62a * //
analyzed: ces 'byung ngo // de nyid kyi @62a * //
translated: the unfortunate do not obtain the fruit.

original: phyir des ni skad cig ma gcig gis byang chub pa yin no //
analyzed: phyir des ni skad cig ma gcig gis byang chub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, in one instant, they are enlightened.

original: de bzhin du nyan thos pa rnams kyis 'bras bu dang thabs yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du nyan thos pa rnams kyis 'bras bu dang thabs yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: Likewise, the fruits and means of the ≈õrƒÅvakas are not correct.

original: mi sdug pa la sogs pa bsgoms pas chos kyi dbyings thob par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi sdug pa la sogs pa bsgoms pas chos kyi dbyings thob par mi 'gyur te /
translated: By cultivating the unappealing and so on, the dharma-dhƒÅtu is not attained.

original: des keng rus la sogs pa tsam thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des keng rus la sogs pa tsam thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because by that, only a skeleton and so on is attained.

original: de yang de kho na nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang de kho na nyid ma yin no //
translated: That is not reality.

original: mar me lta bu mya ngan las 'das pa tshad ma gnyis dang bral ba rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa med pa gang yin pa de yang de kho na nyid du bstan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mar me lta bu mya ngan las 'das pa tshad ma gnyis dang bral ba rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa med pa gang yin pa de yang de kho na nyid du bstan pa ma yin te /
translated: That which is like a lamp, nirvana, devoid of the two valid cognitions, and devoid of the perfection of benefit for self and other, that is not taught as reality.

original: mthong ba'i chos kyis de kho na nyid mi thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos kyis de kho na nyid mi thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because reality is not attained through the phenomena of seeing.

original: theg pa chen po rnams kyi de kho na nyid ngo bo gcig yin mod kyi 'on kyang thabs ni gcig kho na ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen po rnams kyi de kho na nyid ngo bo gcig yin mod kyi 'on kyang thabs ni gcig kho na ste /
translated: The reality of the Mahayana is indeed of one essence, but there is only one method.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo nas stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo nas stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because emptiness is realized through the door of liberation.

original: de yang brtags pa pa yin te /üîΩgcig dang du ma la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs kyis de rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de yang brtags pa pa yin te / gcig dang du ma la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs kyis de rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: That is also imagined,üîΩbecause it is to be realized through reasons such as one and many.

original: / mes pa dang rigs dang bag chags dang bag la nyal ba dang / bsam pa sna tshogs pa'i sems can gyi khams la lam gcig bstan pa ni mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / mes pa dang rigs dang bag chags dang bag la nyal ba dang / bsam pa sna tshogs pa'i sems can gyi khams la lam gcig bstan pa ni mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not accepted that a single path is taught for the various realms of sentient beings with their various desires, lineages, latent tendencies, and dormant states.

original: de bzhin du theg pa chen po pa rnams kyis kyang dka' thub dang mgo la sogs pa sbyin pa dang / stong pa nyid bco brgyad bsgom pa dang / bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis byang chub thob pa'i phyir sangs rgyas nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du theg pa chen po pa rnams kyis kyang dka' thub dang mgo la sogs pa sbyin pa dang / stong pa nyid bco brgyad bsgom pa dang / bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis byang chub thob pa'i phyir sangs rgyas nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, those of the Mahayana attain buddhahood by giving their heads and so on, by meditating on the eighteen emptinesses, and by attaining enlightenment in three incalculable aeons.

original: de bzhin du sngags kyi theg pa'i spyod pa dang ldan pas dka' thub dang brtul zhugs la mi brten te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sngags kyi theg pa'i spyod pa dang ldan pas dka' thub dang brtul zhugs la mi brten te /
translated: Likewise, those endowed with the conduct of the mantra vehicle do not rely on austerities and vows.

original: de rnams kyis 'dod pa'i yon tan lngas spyod pa'i sgo nas de nyid thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyis 'dod pa'i yon tan lngas spyod pa'i sgo nas de nyid thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they attain reality by engaging in the five sense objects.

original: le'u lnga pa las kyang /
analyzed: le'u lnga pa las kyang /
translated: Also, chapter 5 states:

original: dka' thub nyes pa ma rungs la //
analyzed: dka' thub nyes pa ma rungs la //
translated: Those who rely on evil austerities

original: rten par byed pas 'grub mi 'gyur //
analyzed: rten par byed pas 'grub mi 'gyur //
translated: will not attain accomplishment.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan longs spyod la //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan longs spyod la //
translated: Those who rely on the enjoyment of sense objects

original: brten pas myur du 'grub par 'gyur //üîΩzhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: brten pas myur du 'grub par 'gyur // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: will swiftly attain accomplishment.

original: gzhan las kyang /
analyzed: gzhan las kyang /
translated: Also, another text states:

original: dka' thub nyes pa ma rungs pas ;
analyzed: dka' thub nyes pa ma rungs pas ;
translated: Those who rely on evil austerities

original: sdug bsngal dang ldan lus skam 'gyur //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang ldan lus skam 'gyur //
translated: will experience suffering and their bodies will dry up.

original: sdug bsngal gyis ni sems g-yengs te //üîΩg-yengs pas dngos grub thob mi 'gyur //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyis ni sems g-yengs te // g-yengs pas dngos grub thob mi 'gyur //
translated: The mind is distracted by suffering,

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: and one does not attain success through distraction.

original: de bzhin du theg pa chen po pa rnams ni dbang po rno ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du theg pa chen po pa rnams ni dbang po rno ba ma yin te /
translated: Thus, those of the Mahayana are not of sharp faculties,

original: de rnams kyi dad pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams dman pa @62b yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyi dad pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams dman pa @62b yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their qualities of faith, etc., are inferior.

original: de ltar ji srid tha mal pa'i lus ma sbyangs pa de srid du tha mal pa ma yin pa'i rdo rje'i sku'i mtshan nyid kyi sangs rgyas nyid thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar ji srid tha mal pa'i lus ma sbyangs pa de srid du tha mal pa ma yin pa'i rdo rje'i sku'i mtshan nyid kyi sangs rgyas nyid thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, as long as the ordinary body is not purified, one does not attain Buddhahood, which is characterized by the extraordinary vajra body.

original: de yang theg pa chen po la med de //
analyzed: de yang theg pa chen po la med de //
translated: And that is not in the Mahayana,

original: lha'i rnam pa bsgom pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha'i rnam pa bsgom pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no cultivation of the divine form.

original: de mi bsgom pa ni dbang po rno ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mi bsgom pa ni dbang po rno ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is not cultivated because of the lack of sharp faculties.

original: lus gang gi tha mal pa 'ching ba de nyid kyi rnam par sbyang ba dang yongs su shes na grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus gang gi tha mal pa 'ching ba de nyid kyi rnam par sbyang ba dang yongs su shes na grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the body is purified, which is bound by the ordinary, one is liberated through the transformation and thorough knowledge of that very body.

original: de yang / rmongs pa gang gis 'ching ba ni //
analyzed: de yang / rmongs pa gang gis 'ching ba ni //
translated: And that is so,

original: mkhas pa des ni rab tu grol //üîΩde ltar byang chub bsgom pa'i phyir //üîΩthabs 'di thams cad log pa yin //
analyzed: mkhas pa des ni rab tu grol // de ltar byang chub bsgom pa'i phyir // thabs 'di thams cad log pa yin //
translated: The wise are completely liberated.üîΩThus, all these methods

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: are for the sake of cultivating enlightenment.

original: gang dang gang gis skye bo rnams //
analyzed: gang dang gang gis skye bo rnams //
translated: Whatever binds beings

original: mi bzad las kyis 'ching 'gyur ba //
analyzed: mi bzad las kyis 'ching 'gyur ba //
translated: with unbearable karma,

original: thabs dang bcas pa de nyid kyis //üîΩsrid pa'i 'ching ba las grol 'gyur //
analyzed: thabs dang bcas pa de nyid kyis // srid pa'i 'ching ba las grol 'gyur //
translated: by that very method,

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: they are liberated from the bondage of existence.

original: 'od srungs 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di lta ste /
translated: KƒÅ≈õyapa, it is like this:

original: bu ram gyi shing dang 'bras kyi zhing rnams la lud kyi phung po phan par gyur pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la yang nyon mongs pa kho na phan par 'gyur zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: bu ram gyi shing dang 'bras kyi zhing rnams la lud kyi phung po phan par gyur pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la yang nyon mongs pa kho na phan par 'gyur zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: Just as a heap of manure is beneficial for sugarcane and rice fields, so too afflictions alone are beneficial for the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva.

original: de'i phyir sngags kyi theg pa la snod du gyur pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams ni dbang po rno ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sngags kyi theg pa la snod du gyur pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams ni dbang po rno ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, yogins who are vessels for the Mantra Vehicle have sharp faculties.

original: theg pa chen po pa de dag kyang 'dir rjes su gzung bar bya ba yin pa dang / sngags kyi theg pa chen po'i snod du rung ba yin te /
analyzed: theg pa chen po pa de dag kyang 'dir rjes su gzung bar bya ba yin pa dang / sngags kyi theg pa chen po'i snod du rung ba yin te /
translated: And those who are MahƒÅyƒÅnists are to be accepted here,

original: 'bras bu la dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu la dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and are suitable as vessels for the MahƒÅyƒÅna of Mantra, because the result is indivisible.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As is said:üîΩThe result is the nature of the realm of phenomena,

original: dga' ba mi zad 'od gsal zhing //
analyzed: dga' ba mi zad 'od gsal zhing //
translated: which is inexhaustible joy, clear light,

original: sna tshogs gzugs can mi rtog pa //
analyzed: sna tshogs gzugs can mi rtog pa //
translated: having various forms, non-conceptual,

original: snying rje chen po'i ros khyab pa //üîΩchos dbyings bdag nyid 'bras bu yin //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: snying rje chen po'i ros khyab pa // chos dbyings bdag nyid 'bras bu yin // zhes gsungs so //
translated: and pervaded by the taste of great compassion.

original: re zhig theg pa chen po 'di bzhag na gsum po dag kyang sngags kyi theg pa chen po'i snod du rung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: re zhig theg pa chen po 'di bzhag na gsum po dag kyang sngags kyi theg pa chen po'i snod du rung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one were to set aside the MahƒÅyƒÅna for a while, even those three would become suitable as vessels for the MahƒÅyƒÅna of Mantra.

original: gang gi tshe de rnams bcom ldan 'das yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'od zer gyi 'khor los bskul ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de rnams bcom ldan 'das yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'od zer gyi 'khor los bskul ba de'i tshe /
translated: When those who are urged by the circle of light rays of the BhagavƒÅn, the perfect Buddhas,

original: don dam pa'i blo yang dag par bskyed pas mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin mngon du byas nas //
analyzed: don dam pa'i blo yang dag par bskyed pas mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin mngon du byas nas //
translated: they give rise to the ultimate mind, and having actualized non-conceptual samƒÅdhi,

original: de kho na nyid la 'jug cing yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid la 'jug cing yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: They will enter into reality and become perfectly complete Buddhas.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal pos dbang bskur bas tha mal pa'i rgyal po rgyal po chen por 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal pos dbang bskur bas tha mal pa'i rgyal po rgyal po chen por 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like an ordinary king becoming a great king through being anointed by a universal monarch.

original: gzhan yang nyan thos la sogs pa de rnams @63a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang nyan thos la sogs pa de rnams @63a * //
translated: Moreover, those ≈õrƒÅvakas and so forth

original: sangs rgyas kyi snod yin zhes ngo mtshar med de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi snod yin zhes ngo mtshar med de /
translated: are not amazing when they are vessels of the Buddha.

original: de ni rang gi tshogs pa dang bcom ldan 'das kyi lam la gnas pa'i phyir sngags kyi theg pa chen po la brten te 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni rang gi tshogs pa dang bcom ldan 'das kyi lam la gnas pa'i phyir sngags kyi theg pa chen po la brten te 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will attain accomplishment by relying on the mantra MahƒÅyƒÅna because they abide in their own assembly and in the path of the BhagavƒÅn.

original: rgyang phan pa la sogs pa gzhan gyi tshogs pa rnams de dag kyang bstan pa 'di la brten te dngos grub thob pa'o //
analyzed: rgyang phan pa la sogs pa gzhan gyi tshogs pa rnams de dag kyang bstan pa 'di la brten te dngos grub thob pa'o //
translated: Those others, such as the LokƒÅyatas, who are not in their assembly will also attain accomplishment by relying on this teaching.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: pha rol smra ba gang dag ni //
analyzed: pha rol smra ba gang dag ni //
translated: Those who speak from the other side

original: rtags kyi dbye bas rnam par gnas //
analyzed: rtags kyi dbye bas rnam par gnas //
translated: are classified by their signs.

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i sprul pas so //üîΩzhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i sprul pas so //üîΩzhes 'byung ngo //
translated: They are emanations of Vajrasattva.

original: tshad ma'i lam la gnas pa mkhas pa de dag re zhig tshad mas grub pa'i bstan bcos thos pa tsam gyis lam 'dir 'jug par 'dod pa de dag gzhan na /
analyzed: tshad ma'i lam la gnas pa mkhas pa de dag re zhig tshad mas grub pa'i bstan bcos thos pa tsam gyis lam 'dir 'jug par 'dod pa de dag gzhan na /
translated: Those scholars who abide in the path of valid knowledge, who wish to enter this path merely by hearing the treatises established by valid knowledge,üîΩare not like others.

original: 'on kyang shin tu gdug pa dang rku ba dang g-yem pa'i chos can dang mtshams med pa'i las byed pa de rnams kyang sngags kyi theg pa chen po la brten te /
analyzed: 'on kyang shin tu gdug pa dang rku ba dang g-yem pa'i chos can dang mtshams med pa'i las byed pa de rnams kyang sngags kyi theg pa chen po la brten te /
translated: However, even those who are very wicked, who are thieves and adulterers, who commit the actions of immediate retribution, by relying on the Mahayana of mantra,

original: dngos grub lhag par thob pa'o //
analyzed: dngos grub lhag par thob pa'o //
translated: attain the supreme siddhi.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: rigs ngan smyug ma mkhan la sogs /
analyzed: rigs ngan smyug ma mkhan la sogs /
translated: Even those of low caste, such as bamboo workers,

original: gsod bas nor ni don gnyer ba //üîΩde yang theg pa mchog 'di la //
analyzed: gsod bas nor ni don gnyer ba // de yang theg pa mchog 'di la //
translated: who kill for the sake of wealth,üîΩeven they will attain

original: bla med dngos grub thob par 'gyur //üîΩmtshams med la sogs las byed rnams //
analyzed: bla med dngos grub thob par 'gyur // mtshams med la sogs las byed rnams //
translated: the unsurpassed siddhi in this supreme vehicle.

original: shin tu sdig can sems can rnams //üîΩde yang theg pa bla med 'di //
analyzed: shin tu sdig can sems can rnams // de yang theg pa bla med 'di //
translated: Even those sentient beings who are very sinful,üîΩwho commit the actions of immediate retribution,üîΩeven they will attain

original: 'grub par 'gyur te the tshom med //üîΩces 'byung ngo ;
analyzed: 'grub par 'gyur te the tshom med // ces 'byung ngo ;
translated: accomplishment in this unsurpassed vehicle, without doubt.

original: / de ltar 'di skyon thams cad las nges par grol ba /
analyzed: / de ltar 'di skyon thams cad las nges par grol ba /
translated: Thus, this [mantra vehicle] is definitely free from all faults.

original: yon tan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: yon tan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
translated: It is adorned with all good qualities.

original: zab pa dang rgya che ba rdo rje theg pa chen po 'di yin no //
analyzed: zab pa dang rgya che ba rdo rje theg pa chen po 'di yin no //
translated: It is the profound and vast Great Vajra Vehicle.

original: de la rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: de la rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: It has five aspects:

original: bya ba dang / spyod pa dang / rnal 'byor dang / rnal 'byor chen po dang / rnal 'byor chen po'i mthar thug pa'i bye brag gis de rnams kyi rang rang gi mtshan nyid dang / dbang po'i dngos po dang / yul gyi bye brag sngon du bshad zin to //
analyzed: bya ba dang / spyod pa dang / rnal 'byor dang / rnal 'byor chen po dang / rnal 'byor chen po'i mthar thug pa'i bye brag gis de rnams kyi rang rang gi mtshan nyid dang / dbang po'i dngos po dang / yul gyi bye brag sngon du bshad zin to //
translated: the Action, Conduct, Yoga, Great Yoga, and Highest Yoga Tantras. Their individual characteristics, the nature of the faculties, and the distinctions of the objects have already been explained.

original: de rnams kyi rim pa gnyis 'di ltar yin te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi rim pa gnyis 'di ltar yin te /
translated: The two stages of these are as follows.

original: de la bya ba'i rgyud kyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi bskyed pa'i rim pa ni dang po'i yi ge tsam yongs su gyur pas so ;
analyzed: de la bya ba'i rgyud kyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi bskyed pa'i rim pa ni dang po'i yi ge tsam yongs su gyur pas so ;
translated: In the Action Tantra, the yogis' stage of generation is the transformation of the mere seed syllable.

original: / rdzogs pa'i rim pa yang mdzod spu las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi 'khor los spro ba dang / bsdu ba'i rim pas so //
analyzed: / rdzogs pa'i rim pa yang mdzod spu las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi 'khor los spro ba dang / bsdu ba'i rim pas so //
translated: The stage of completion is the process of emanating and gathering through the circle of light rays that arise from the ≈´r·πáƒÅ.

original: spyod pa dang rnal 'byor gyi rgyud kyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi bskyed pa'i rim pa ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rnam pa lnga'i rim pas so //
analyzed: spyod pa dang rnal 'byor gyi rgyud kyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi bskyed pa'i rim pa ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rnam pa lnga'i rim pas so //
translated: The generation stage of the yogins of the Action and Yoga Tantras is by the process of the five manifest enlightenments.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa ni phra @63b ba'i rdo rje la sogs pa'i bsgom pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa ni phra @63b ba'i rdo rje la sogs pa'i bsgom pa'i rim pas so //
translated: The perfection stage is by the process of meditation on the subtle vajra and so on.

original: rnal 'byor pa chen po pa rnams kyi bskyed pa'i rim pa ni rnal 'byor bzhi dang ldan pa'i dang po sbyor ba la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pa'am rdo rje bzhi pas so //
