translated: Since the five intuitions appear to be different, it is the relative side.

original: 'chang chen po khyab bdag ces bshad do //
analyzed: 'chang chen po khyab bdag ces bshad do //
translated: When they are gathered into all the potencies, the state of nondual intuition is the reality whose characteristic is the emptiness of everything, which is the Lord, the Great Vajradhara, the intuition and the knowable as one taste, the lord, it is explained.

original: dpal gyi sgra ni sngar bshad do //
analyzed: dpal gyi sgra ni sngar bshad do //
translated: The word ‚Äúsplendor‚Äù was explained above.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' bshad par bya ste /
translated: Vajrasattva is to be explained.

original: spong ba lnga dang ye shes lnga //
analyzed: spong ba lnga dang ye shes lnga //
translated: The five abandonments and the five intuitions

original: rdo rje zhes ni mngon par brjod //
analyzed: rdo rje zhes ni mngon par brjod //
translated: are called ‚Äúvajra.‚Äù

original: don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is this.

original: rnam par shes pa lnga po spong bar byed pa ya shes lnga'i ngo bo nyid stong pa 'od gsal ba ni rdo rjer bshad do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa lnga po spong bar byed pa ya shes lnga'i ngo bo nyid stong pa 'od gsal ba ni rdo rjer bshad do //
translated: The clear light, the emptiness of the nature of the five pristine wisdoms that abandon the five consciousnesses, is explained as the vajra.

original: de nyid sems dpa' ste ngo bo nyid gang la yod pa de ni rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: de nyid sems dpa' ste ngo bo nyid gang la yod pa de ni rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: That itself is the hero, and he who has that nature is Vajrasattva.

original: yang na rdo rje ni thabs kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: yang na rdo rje ni thabs kyi ye shes so //
translated: Alternatively, the vajra is the wisdom of method,

original: sems dpa' ni shes rab kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: sems dpa' ni shes rab kyi ye shes so //
translated: and the hero is the wisdom of wisdom.

original: de dag ro gcig pa ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: de dag ro gcig pa ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: Their single taste is the BhagavƒÅn Vajrasattva.

original: yang na dpal ni thabs te rdo rje shes rab bo //
analyzed: yang na dpal ni thabs te rdo rje shes rab bo //
translated: Alternatively, glory is method, and the vajra is wisdom.

original: des na snying rje dang stong pa nyid dbyer med pa nyid dpal rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: des na snying rje dang stong pa nyid dbyer med pa nyid dpal rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: Therefore, compassion and emptiness are inseparable, and that itself is glorious Vajrasattva.

original: rdo rje rtse mo las kyang //
analyzed: rdo rje rtse mo las kyang //
translated: Also, the Vajra≈õekhara Tantra teaches:

original: brtan zhing snying po khong stong med //
analyzed: brtan zhing snying po khong stong med //
translated: Stable, with an essence, and without hollowness,

original: dbyer med bcad med mtshan nyid can //
analyzed: dbyer med bcad med mtshan nyid can //
translated: inseparable, and with the characteristic of uncuttable,

original: bsreg tu med dang mi 'jig ni //
analyzed: bsreg tu med dang mi 'jig ni //
translated: not burnable, and indestructible,

original: stong nyid rdo rje zhes su bshad //üîΩces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: stong nyid rdo rje zhes su bshad //üîΩces 'byung ngo //
translated: emptiness is explained as the vajra.

original: btud de zhes pa ni lus ngag yid kyis 'dud pa'am de'i bdag nyid du rjes su 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: btud de zhes pa ni lus ngag yid kyis 'dud pa'am de'i bdag nyid du rjes su 'jug pa'o //
translated: Bowing means bowing with body, speech, and mind, or following in the nature of that.

original: rim pa bzhin ni go rims kyis so //
analyzed: rim pa bzhin ni go rims kyis so //
translated: In order means in sequence.

original: zla ba grags pas rab gsal @78b bshad pa ni //
analyzed: zla ba grags pas rab gsal @78b bshad pa ni //
translated: The commentary of Candrakƒ´rti is clearly illuminating,

original: gsal bar ston par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gsal bar ston par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: which means it is clearly teaching.

original: rim pa gnyis po'i gnas zhes gang bshad pa de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /üîΩbskyed pa'i rim pa dang po yin //
analyzed: rim pa gnyis po'i gnas zhes gang bshad pa de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir / bskyed pa'i rim pa dang po yin //
translated: In order to teach just that which was explained as the basis of the two stages,

original: zhes smos te /
analyzed: zhes smos te /
translated: he says, The first is the stage of generation.üîΩThe stage that is primary for the generation is the stage of generation.

original: bskyed pa'i gtsor gyur pa'i rim pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa ste de bzhin du bzla ba dang rdo rje dang sa bon dang spro ba dang bsdu bas lha'i gzugs kyis tha mal pa'i lus bzlog pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rdo rje lta bu'i sku 'byung ba'i
analyzed: bskyed pa'i gtsor gyur pa'i rim pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa ste de bzhin du bzla ba dang rdo rje dang sa bon dang spro ba dang bsdu bas lha'i gzugs kyis tha mal pa'i lus bzlog pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rdo rje lta bu'i sku 'byung ba'i
translated: In that way, by the transformation with the vajra, seed, emanation, and gathering, the ordinary body is reversed by the form of the deity, and the supramundane vajra-like body arises.

original: phyir ro // de la dang po'i sbyor ba la sogs pa dbye ba gsum sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: phyir ro // de la dang po'i sbyor ba la sogs pa dbye ba gsum sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The three divisions of the first yoga and so forth have already been explained.

original: rigs brgya'i bye brag gi mtha' can zhes smra bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: rigs brgya'i bye brag gi mtha' can zhes smra bar bya ba yin te /
translated: It should be said that it has the end of the division of the hundred families.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa gcig pus tha mal pa'i lus rnam par dag par byed mi nus te /üîΩ'on kyang ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi 'og tu gang gi tshe phung po khams dang skye mched kyi bdag nyid kyi lus cha shas kyi dbye bas ye shes lnga'i ngo bo de bzhin gshegs pa lngas rnam par dpen par byed pa de'i tshe tha mal pa'i lus kyi
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa gcig pus tha mal pa'i lus rnam par dag par byed mi nus te / 'on kyang ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi 'og tu gang gi tshe phung po khams dang skye mched kyi bdag nyid kyi lus cha shas kyi dbye bas ye shes lnga'i ngo bo de bzhin gshegs pa lngas rnam par dpen par byed pa de'i tshe tha mal pa'i lus kyi
translated: The stage of generation alone is not able to purify the ordinary body.

original: nye bar dmigs pa spangs nas /
analyzed: nye bar dmigs pa spangs nas /
translated: However, after the three meditative stabilizations, when the body, which is of the nature of the aggregates, constituents, and sense-spheres, is purified by the five transcendent ones, whose nature is the five exalted wisdoms, through the division of its parts, then the observation of the ordinary body is abandoned.

original: tha mal pa ma yin pa'i sku byung ba de nyid bskyed pa'i rim pa'i mthar phyin pa'o //
analyzed: tha mal pa ma yin pa'i sku byung ba de nyid bskyed pa'i rim pa'i mthar phyin pa'o //
translated: The appearance of the extraordinary body is the completion of the stage of generation.

original: gcig pus mi nus zhes smra bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: gcig pus mi nus zhes smra bar mi bya ste /
translated: It should not be said that it is not able to do that alone.

original: ting nge 'dzin gsum bzhin du de grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gsum bzhin du de grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is established like the three meditative stabilizations.

original: rigs brgya'i dbye ba'i mtha' can bskyed pa'i rim pa yin zhes smra bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: rigs brgya'i dbye ba'i mtha' can bskyed pa'i rim pa yin zhes smra bar mi bya ste /
translated: It should not be said that the stage of generation has the end of the division of the hundred families.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ting nge 'dzin gsum rtsa ba'i rgyud las ji ltar brtag pa bzhin du rigs brgya'i dbye ba yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gsum rtsa ba'i rgyud las ji ltar brtag pa bzhin du rigs brgya'i dbye ba yang shes par bya'o //
translated: The division into one hundred families should be understood just as the three meditative stabilizations are investigated in the Root Tantra.

original: de ltar ma yin te gud par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin te gud par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not so, because they are taught separately.

original: ting nge 'dzin gsum bzhin du de yang grub po zhes gang smras pa de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gsum bzhin du de yang grub po zhes gang smras pa de ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not so that just as the three meditative stabilizations are established, so also that is established, as some have said.

original: gnyi ga gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because both are taught.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa rdo rje rnam par snang mdzad chen pos de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'dod chags chen po'i tshul zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so zhes bya ba nas brtsams te de bzhin gshegs pa thams
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa rdo rje rnam par snang mdzad chen pos de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'dod chags chen po'i tshul zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so zhes bya ba nas brtsams te de bzhin gshegs pa thams
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Tathagata Great Vajra Vairocana, entered the meditative stabilization called the method of great passion of all Tathagatas, and so on up to:

original: cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi rdo rje la bzhugs par gyur to zhes bya ba'i bar du dang po'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba nye bar bstan to //
analyzed: cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi rdo rje la bzhugs par gyur to zhes bya ba'i bar du dang po'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba nye bar bstan to //
translated: all Tathagatas dwelt in the vajra of body, speech, and mind of all Tathagatas.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dam tshig 'byung ba chen po rdo rje zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te zhes pa nas @79a * //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dam tshig 'byung ba chen po rdo rje zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te zhes pa nas @79a * //
translated: Then, the BhagavƒÅn entered the samƒÅdhi called ‚Äúvajra great arising of all tathƒÅgata commitments‚Äù and so on,

original: brtsams te / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs mnyes par byed pa dkyil 'khor gyi dam tshig sems dpa' rnams so so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin bstan to //
analyzed: brtsams te / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs mnyes par byed pa dkyil 'khor gyi dam tshig sems dpa' rnams so so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin bstan to //
translated: up to ‚Äúthe commitment beings of the ma·πá·∏çala that please the body, speech, and mind of all tathƒÅgatas.‚Äù This teaches the samƒÅdhi of the supreme ma·πá·∏çala victory.

original: de'i rjes su le'u drug pa la sogs pa dag tu /üîΩsna yi rtse mor yungs kar bsam //
analyzed: de'i rjes su le'u drug pa la sogs pa dag tu / sna yi rtse mor yungs kar bsam //
translated: After that, in the sixth chapter and so on,üîΩthe samƒÅdhi of the supreme victory of activity is taught by ‚Äúimagine a mustard seed at the tip of the nose‚Äù and so on.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas las kyi rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin bstan to zhes de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin gsum po gsal bar bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas las kyi rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin bstan to zhes de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin gsum po gsal bar bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the three samƒÅdhis are clearly taught.

original: rigs brgya'i bye brag gi mtha' can du smra ba kho na'o //
analyzed: rigs brgya'i bye brag gi mtha' can du smra ba kho na'o //
translated: The one who speaks thus has the distinction of a hundred families.

original: de yang dang po yin zhes pa ni dang po lus kyi rnam par rtog pa rags pa spang par bya ba yin zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de yang dang po yin zhes pa ni dang po lus kyi rnam par rtog pa rags pa spang par bya ba yin zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The first of these is the first, that is, the first is the one that should be abandoned, namely, the gross discursive thought of the body.

original: de las lus rnam par dag nas ngag rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de las lus rnam par dag nas ngag rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to purify the speech after the body has been purified,

original: rim pa lnga po'i dang po rdo rje bzlas pa zhes bya ba bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: rim pa lnga po'i dang po rdo rje bzlas pa zhes bya ba bsgom par bya ste /
translated: one should cultivate the first of the five stages, called vajra repetition.

original: de'i phyir gsang sngags kyi sku ni rab sgrub byed ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsang sngags kyi sku ni rab sgrub byed ces bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, the body of the mantra is accomplished.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis bsam pa dang bag la nyal ba dang khams dang bag chags kyi dbye bas sngags kyi sa ya bdun cu rtsa gnyis bshad do //
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis bsam pa dang bag la nyal ba dang khams dang bag chags kyi dbye bas sngags kyi sa ya bdun cu rtsa gnyis bshad do //
translated: In this regard, the Blessed One explained the seventy-two million mantras according to the divisions of intention, latent propensities, elements, and traces.

original: de dag thams cad kyi rtsa ba ni yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa dgu pa phyi ma'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyi rtsa ba ni yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa dgu pa phyi ma'o //
translated: The root of all of them is the last, the forty-nine syllable [mantra].

original: de yang sde tshan brgyad kyi bdag nyid dang po'i yi ge rnams la yongs su thim par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de yang sde tshan brgyad kyi bdag nyid dang po'i yi ge rnams la yongs su thim par gyur pa'o //
translated: That also dissolves into the first syllables, which have the nature of the eight classes.

original: de dag kyang bzhi po la thim //
analyzed: de dag kyang bzhi po la thim //
translated: Those also dissolve into the four.

original: bzhi po yang yi ge gsum gyi bdag nyid du gyur pas zhes yi ge dang tshig dang ngag dang rab tu byed pa dang sngags thams cad kyi yi ge gsum po kho na rgyu'i gtso bo yin te /
analyzed: bzhi po yang yi ge gsum gyi bdag nyid du gyur pas zhes yi ge dang tshig dang ngag dang rab tu byed pa dang sngags thams cad kyi yi ge gsum po kho na rgyu'i gtso bo yin te /
translated: Since all four are of the nature of the three syllables, the three syllables alone are the principal cause of all letters, words, speech, literary compositions, and mantras.

original: rigs gsum rnam par dag pas sku gsung thugs kyi ngo bor gyur pa gsang sngags kyi sku'o//
analyzed: rigs gsum rnam par dag pas sku gsung thugs kyi ngo bor gyur pa gsang sngags kyi sku'o//
translated: The body of the mantra is the essence of the body, speech, and mind of the three families, since it is the purification of the three families.

original: de yang gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang gnyis te /
translated: Moreover, there are two kinds of mantra body:

original: rlung gi bdag nyid dang / yi ge'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: rlung gi bdag nyid dang / yi ge'i bdag nyid do //
translated: the nature of the winds and the nature of the letters.

original: de la 'jug pa dang / gnas pa dang / ldang ba'i rim pas nyin mtshan du nyi khri chig stong drug brgya'i dkyil 'khor bzhi'i sbyor bas goms pas sems rtse gcig pa de nyid gang yin pa de ni rlung gi bdag nyid kyi sngags kyi sku'o //
analyzed: de la 'jug pa dang / gnas pa dang / ldang ba'i rim pas nyin mtshan du nyi khri chig stong drug brgya'i dkyil 'khor bzhi'i sbyor bas goms pas sems rtse gcig pa de nyid gang yin pa de ni rlung gi bdag nyid kyi sngags kyi sku'o //
translated: The mantra body that is the nature of the winds is the one-pointed mind that is familiar with the winds through the yoga of the four cakras, which are twenty-one thousand six hundred in number, day and night, through the process of entering, abiding, and rising.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po la sogs pa'i sngags kyi bzlas pa la yi ge gsum po kho na spyi bo la sogs par gnas pa yan lag ma nyams par bzlas pa'i rim pa goms par byed pa na sems rtse gcig pa nyid gang yin pa de ni yi
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po la sogs pa'i sngags kyi bzlas pa la yi ge gsum po kho na spyi bo la sogs par gnas pa yan lag ma nyams par bzlas pa'i rim pa goms par byed pa na sems rtse gcig pa nyid gang yin pa de ni yi
translated: When one is cultivating the process of reciting the three syllables, A, U, M, without impairment, in the head, etc.,

original: ge'i bdag nyid gsang sngags kyi sku'o //
analyzed: ge'i bdag nyid gsang sngags kyi sku'o //
translated: the mind‚Äôs one-pointedness is the mantra body, the nature of the syllables.

original: de @79b gnyis ka rab tu sgrub par byed pa ni rdzogs par byed pa rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa ste gcig go //
analyzed: de @79b gnyis ka rab tu sgrub par byed pa ni rdzogs par byed pa rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa ste gcig go //
translated: The perfection of both is the perfection process of vajra repetition, the second.

original: des ni ngag gi ngo bo shes nas bstod pa dang smad pa la sogs pa'i tshig gis rnal 'byor pa mgu ba dang mi mgu bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gsung gi rdo rje'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: des ni ngag gi ngo bo shes nas bstod pa dang smad pa la sogs pa'i tshig gis rnal 'byor pa mgu ba dang mi mgu bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gsung gi rdo rje'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'o //
translated: Having understood the nature of speech, the yogi does not become pleased or displeased by words of praise or blame, etc.

original: gcig ces smra bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gcig ces smra bar bya ba yin te /
translated: One should say that there is one,

original: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa gsang sngags kyi sku rab tu sgrub par byed pa gcig ni dang po ste rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i dang po'o //
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa gsang sngags kyi sku rab tu sgrub par byed pa gcig ni dang po ste rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i dang po'o //
translated: the first, the first of the perfection processes, the perfection process of vajra repetition, which perfects the mantra body.

original: la la na re bskyed pa'i rim pa khyad par du gyur pa kho na gsang sngags kyi sku rab tu sgrub par byed pa zhes 'chad pa de ni mi bden te /
analyzed: la la na re bskyed pa'i rim pa khyad par du gyur pa kho na gsang sngags kyi sku rab tu sgrub par byed pa zhes 'chad pa de ni mi bden te /
translated: Some say: Only the special stage of generation is the means of accomplishing the body of mantra.

original: de lta yin na rdo rje bzlas pa ma 'dus par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na rdo rje bzlas pa ma 'dus par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: That is incorrect, because if that were so, it would follow that vajra repetition would not be included.

original: de ma gtogs par ngag rnam par dag pa med pas dgos pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de ma gtogs par ngag rnam par dag pa med pas dgos pa kho na'o //
translated: It is necessary because there is no pure speech other than that.

original: gang gi tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe /
translated: When it is said:

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa dang po yin //üîΩzhes dang po bskyed pa'i rim pa bsgom pa yin na de'i tshe gcig ces smras pas /
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa dang po yin // zhes dang po bskyed pa'i rim pa bsgom pa yin na de'i tshe gcig ces smras pas /
translated: The first is the stage of generation.

original: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa'i 'og tu sems la dmigs pa tsam zhig ni rim pa gnyis pa zhes brjod do zhes smras par mi rigs te /
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa'i 'og tu sems la dmigs pa tsam zhig ni rim pa gnyis pa zhes brjod do zhes smras par mi rigs te /
translated: If the first is the meditation on the stage of generation, then it is said that the second is the stage of focusing on the mind alone, which is called the second stage.

original: rdo rje bzlas pa'i 'og tu de nye bar bstan pa yin gyi bskyed pa'i rim pa'i 'og tu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa'i 'og tu de nye bar bstan pa yin gyi bskyed pa'i rim pa'i 'og tu ni ma yin no //
translated: That is illogical, because it is taught after vajra repetition, not after the stage of generation.

original: de'i phyir gsang sngags kyi sku rab tu sgrub par byed pa'i sgra ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i khyad par ma yin te 'on kyang rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa kho na ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gsang sngags kyi sku rab tu sgrub par byed pa'i sgra ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i khyad par ma yin te 'on kyang rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa kho na ston par byed pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the sound that accomplishes the body of mantra is not a special creation stage, but rather it teaches only the stage of vajra repetition.

original: de'i khyad par byed pa'i phyir gcig ces smra bar bya ba kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i khyad par byed pa'i phyir gcig ces smra bar bya ba kho na'o //
translated: Because it is a special feature of that, it should be said to be one.

original: ji ltar rim pa kho na mchog go //
analyzed: ji ltar rim pa kho na mchog go //
translated: How is the stage alone supreme?

original: sems la dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ngag rnam par dag par gyur pas rnam par shes pa gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi sems la dmigs pa ni mthong ba ste /
analyzed: sems la dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ngag rnam par dag par gyur pas rnam par shes pa gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi sems la dmigs pa ni mthong ba ste /
translated: With regard to ‚Äúthe observation of mind, etc.,‚Äù the observation of mind, which is the nature of the three consciousnesses, is seeing, because of the purity of speech.

original: sngar bshad pa'i sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas 'od gsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas 'od gsal bar bya'o //
translated: It should be made clear by the stage of mantra and seal explained previously.

original: de nyid ni de tsam zhig yin gyi sngags kyi sku'i bdag nyid gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ni de tsam zhig yin gyi sngags kyi sku'i bdag nyid gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: That alone is just that much, and not another nature of the body of mantra.

original: sems rnam par dag pa tsam gcig pu rim pa gnyis pa yin zhes tshig gi don to //
analyzed: sems rnam par dag pa tsam gcig pu rim pa gnyis pa yin zhes tshig gi don to //
translated: The mere purity of mind alone is the second stage. This is the meaning of the words.

original: rnam par dag pa'i sems kyi rgyud dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pas gzhan gyi don bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i sems kyi rgyud dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pas gzhan gyi don bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The yogi who possesses a pure continuum of mind, for the sake of benefiting others,

original: lha'i sku yid kyi rang bzhin gyis chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bur blta bar bya zhes de'i slad du /üîΩkun rdzob bden pa bstan pa ni //
analyzed: lha'i sku yid kyi rang bzhin gyis chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bur blta bar bya zhes de'i slad du / kun rdzob bden pa bstan pa ni //
translated: should see all phenomena as illusion-like, with the divine body that is the nature of mind. For that reason,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: the teaching of conventional truth is stated:

original: 'od gsal ba las myur @80a * //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba las myur @80a * //
translated: From the clear light, quicklyüîΩendowed with the supreme of all aspects, pleasing,

original: bar rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa yid du 'ong ba ni dkyil 'khor pa'i lha tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba /
analyzed: bar rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa yid du 'ong ba ni dkyil 'khor pa'i lha tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba /
translated: surrounded by the assembly of mandala deities,üîΩthe form that is never satiated, the wisdom body,

original: mi ngoms pa'i gzugs ye shes kyi sku spras te gnas pa bstan pa ni sgyu ma dang mtshungs par bdag dang dngos po thams cad la blta'o //
analyzed: mi ngoms pa'i gzugs ye shes kyi sku spras te gnas pa bstan pa ni sgyu ma dang mtshungs par bdag dang dngos po thams cad la blta'o //
translated: arising, should be seen as illusion-like in oneself and all things.

original: yang na yid 'ong ni bstan pa dang dge ba'i rtsa ba smin pa dang rnam par grol ba dang / spro ba'i rim pas 'gro ba'i don byed pas so //
analyzed: yang na yid 'ong ni bstan pa dang dge ba'i rtsa ba smin pa dang rnam par grol ba dang / spro ba'i rim pas 'gro ba'i don byed pas so //
translated: Or, pleasing means benefiting migrating beings through the stages of teaching, ripening roots of virtue, liberation, and enthusiasm.

original: de bas na bdag byin gyis rlob pa zhes bya ba rim pa gsum pa bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na bdag byin gyis rlob pa zhes bya ba rim pa gsum pa bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the third stage, called ‚Äúself-consecration,‚Äù is taught.

original: sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin mngon du byas nas de nyid du mngon par zhen par brgya lam du 'gyur bas de dag par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin mngon du byas nas de nyid du mngon par zhen par brgya lam du 'gyur bas de dag par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Having realized the illusion-like meditative concentration, it is possible that one might cling to that very state. In order to purify that, it is said:

original: kun rdzob bden pa'i dag pa ni //
analyzed: kun rdzob bden pa'i dag pa ni //
translated: The purity of the conventional truth.

original: zhes smos te kun rdzob kyi bden pa ni sgyu ma lta bur mthong ba de'i dag pa gang yin pa thams cad stong pa la 'jug pa ste 'od gsal ba rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes smos te kun rdzob kyi bden pa ni sgyu ma lta bur mthong ba de'i dag pa gang yin pa thams cad stong pa la 'jug pa ste 'od gsal ba rtogs pa'o //
translated: The conventional truth is the perception of things as illusion-like. Its purity is the entry into emptiness, the realization of clear light.

original: de ni mngon par byang chub pa //
analyzed: de ni mngon par byang chub pa //
translated: That is the manifest enlightenment.

original: zhes bya ba rim pa bzhi par bshad do /
analyzed: zhes bya ba rim pa bzhi par bshad do /
translated: This is explained as the fourth stage.

original: 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid thob pas chad pa'i phyogs su lhung bas skyon de bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid thob pas chad pa'i phyogs su lhung bas skyon de bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: Having attained the reality of clear light, one might fall into the extreme of nihilism. In order to remove that fault, it is said:

original: bden gnyis sbyor ba gang yin pa /üîΩzhes smos te /
analyzed: bden gnyis sbyor ba gang yin pa /üîΩzhes smos te /
translated: The union of the two truths.

original: bden pa gnyis ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bdag nyid ye shes kyi sku dang 'od gsal ba'i rnam grangs can bdag la byin gyis rlob pa dang / mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa gnyis dang / de bzhin du phan tshun 'gal ba'i dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams la sbyor ba ni gcig tu byed pa ste gnyis su med par yongs su shes pa gang yin pa de zung du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bdag nyid ye shes kyi sku dang 'od gsal ba'i rnam grangs can bdag la byin gyis rlob pa dang / mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa gnyis dang / de bzhin du phan tshun 'gal ba'i dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams la sbyor ba ni gcig tu byed pa ste gnyis su med par yongs su shes pa gang yin pa de zung du 'jug pa'o //
translated: Likewise, the union is the complete knowledge of the non-duality of the unification of mutually contradictory things and non-things, etc.üîΩThe union is the indivisibility of the engagement in the identity of things and non-things, etc.

original: zung ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du 'jug pa ni dbyer med pa'o zhes rim pa lnga par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zung ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du 'jug pa ni dbyer med pa'o zhes rim pa lnga par shes par bya'o //
translated: This should be known from the Five Stages.

original: de las gzhan pa'i rim pa med de bya ba med pa'i phyir dang mi slob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rim pa med de bya ba med pa'i phyir dang mi slob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no other stage than that, because there is no activity and because there is no more training.

original: grangs la log par rtogs pa la sogs pa sngon du bshad zin to //
analyzed: grangs la log par rtogs pa la sogs pa sngon du bshad zin to //
translated: The misconceptions about the number, etc., have already been explained.

original: bsdus pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bsdus pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the summary, it says:

original: 'di ni sgrub pa'i yan lag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di ni sgrub pa'i yan lag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: This is called the branch of practice, and so on.

original: sgrub pa ni lha'i rnal 'byor gnyis te /
analyzed: sgrub pa ni lha'i rnal 'byor gnyis te /
translated: Practice is the two yogas of the deity,

original: brtags pa dang yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: brtags pa dang yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: the imagined and the perfect.

original: de la brtags pa ni ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de la brtags pa ni ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi bdag nyid do //
translated: Among them, the imagined is the nature of the three meditative stabilizations.

original: yongs su rdzogs pa ni rim pa lnga'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa ni rim pa lnga'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The perfect is the nature of the five stages.

original: de dag gi yan lag ni bye brag ste /
analyzed: de dag gi yan lag ni bye brag ste /
translated: Their branches are the particulars,

original: ting nge 'dzin gsum @80b dang rim pa lnga'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gsum @80b dang rim pa lnga'o //
translated: the three meditative stabilizations and the five stages.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mchog ces smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mchog ces smos te /
translated: For that very reason, it is called supreme,

original: gzhan la ltos pa med pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan la ltos pa med pa ste /
translated: because it is independent of anything else,

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don byed nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don byed nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is able to perform the aims of self and other.

original: de bzhin du yang rgyud kun gyi don zhes bya ba ni dpal gsang ba 'dus pa ma lus pa'i brjod par bya ba gang yin pa de bsdu bar byed pa ni rim pa gnyis po zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang rgyud kun gyi don zhes bya ba ni dpal gsang ba 'dus pa ma lus pa'i brjod par bya ba gang yin pa de bsdu bar byed pa ni rim pa gnyis po zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: Similarly, the meaning of all the tantras is the topic of the entire glorious Guhyasamaja. That which condenses it is the two stages.

original: la la na re bsnyen pa la sogs pa yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa rgyud kyi don du 'chad pa de rnams kyis rdzogs pa'i rim pa ma bzung ste /
analyzed: la la na re bsnyen pa la sogs pa yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa rgyud kyi don du 'chad pa de rnams kyis rdzogs pa'i rim pa ma bzung ste /
translated: Some say that the meaning of the tantra is the four branches of service and so forth, but they do not understand the stage of completion.

original: dpal sangs rgyas ye shes zhabs kyi gzhung bzhin no //
analyzed: dpal sangs rgyas ye shes zhabs kyi gzhung bzhin no //
translated: This is in accordance with the text of the glorious Buddhaj√±ƒÅnapƒÅda.

original: gang yang rdo rje bzhi pos rgyud kyi don bshad par byed pa de rnams kyi bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rim pa tsam yang yongs su ma rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang yang rdo rje bzhi pos rgyud kyi don bshad par byed pa de rnams kyi bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rim pa tsam yang yongs su ma rdzogs pa'o //
translated: Also, those who explain the meaning of the tantra by means of the four vajras do not understand even the stage of the generation process.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: dang po stong nyid byang chub sems //
analyzed: dang po stong nyid byang chub sems //
translated: First, the emptiness mind of enlightenment,

original: gnyis pa sa bon bsdu ba ste //
analyzed: gnyis pa sa bon bsdu ba ste //
translated: second, the gathering of the seed,

original: gsum pa gzugs brnyan rdzogs pa ni //
analyzed: gsum pa gzugs brnyan rdzogs pa ni //
translated: third, the perfect reflection,

original: yi ge dgod pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge dgod pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: fourth, the placement of the syllables.

original: zhes bya bas sbyor ba dang po ting nge 'dzin kho na gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya bas sbyor ba dang po ting nge 'dzin kho na gzung ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the first yoga is taken to be only samƒÅdhi.

original: kho bos ni ji ltar gyur pa de bzhin du 'og nas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: kho bos ni ji ltar gyur pa de bzhin du 'og nas bshad par bya'o //
translated: I will explain below just as it is.

original: da ni rim pa gnyis kyi nang nas rdzogs pa'i rim pa rgyas pa dang mdor bsdus par rtogs par byed pas rgyud shes pa yin gyi gzhan gyis ma yin zhes dgongs nas /
analyzed: da ni rim pa gnyis kyi nang nas rdzogs pa'i rim pa rgyas pa dang mdor bsdus par rtogs par byed pas rgyud shes pa yin gyi gzhan gyis ma yin zhes dgongs nas /
translated: Now, since one should understand the extensive and concise perfection stage from within the two stages, it is the knowledge of tantra, not by others.

original: rim pa 'di'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩde'i sngon du bshad pa'i rim pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: rim pa 'di'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / de'i sngon du bshad pa'i rim pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: Thinking that, he says, ‚ÄúThis stage,‚Äù and so on.

original: spros pa'i rim pa ni rgya che ba'i rim pas so //
analyzed: spros pa'i rim pa ni rgya che ba'i rim pas so //
translated: The stage explained previously is the extensive stage.

original: rnam pa mang ba ni bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa mang ba ni bshad par bya ste /
translated: The many aspects are to be explained.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows.

original: rdo rje bzlas pa ni rnam pa bcu gcig ste /
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa ni rnam pa bcu gcig ste /
translated: Vajra repetition is of eleven types:

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i bzlas pa dang / sku'i bzlas pa dang / gsung gi bzlas pa dang / thugs kyi bzlas pa dang / rin po che'i bzlas pa dang / don yod pa'i bzlas pa dang / khro bo'i bzlas pa dang / zhe sdang gi bzlas pa dang /
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i bzlas pa dang / sku'i bzlas pa dang / gsung gi bzlas pa dang / thugs kyi bzlas pa dang / rin po che'i bzlas pa dang / don yod pa'i bzlas pa dang / khro bo'i bzlas pa dang / zhe sdang gi bzlas pa dang /
translated: the repetition of Great Vajradhara, the repetition of body, the repetition of speech, the repetition of mind, the repetition of Ratnasa·πÉbhava, the repetition of Amoghasiddhi, the repetition of wrath, the repetition of hatred,

original: 'dod chags kyi bzlas pa dang / gti mug gi bzlas pa dang / ma ning gi bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi bzlas pa dang / gti mug gi bzlas pa dang / ma ning gi bzlas pa'o //
translated: the repetition of desire, the repetition of ignorance, and the repetition of the neuter.

original: sems rnam par dag pa la gsum ste /
analyzed: sems rnam par dag pa la gsum ste /
translated: The purification of the mind is threefold:

original: snang ba rnam par dag pa dang / snang ba mched pa rnam par dag pa dang / snang ba nye bar thob par rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba rnam par dag pa dang / snang ba mched pa rnam par dag pa dang / snang ba nye bar thob par rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: the purification of the appearance, the purification of the increase of appearance, and the purification of the attainment of the culmination of the appearance.

original: bdag la byin gyis rlob pa la gsum ste /
analyzed: bdag la byin gyis rlob pa la gsum ste /
translated: The consecration of oneself is threefold:

original: chos kyi skur byin gyis rlob pa dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skur byin gyis rlob pa dang / sprul pa'i skur byin gyis rlob pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi skur byin gyis rlob pa dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skur byin gyis rlob pa dang / sprul pa'i skur byin gyis rlob pa'o //
translated: the consecration of the body as the body of reality, the consecration of the body as the body of perfect enjoyment, and the consecration of the body as the body of manifestation.

original: mngon par byang chub pa la rnam pa @81a * //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa la rnam pa @81a * //
translated: The manifest enlightenment is threefold:

original: gsum ste / chags pa rnam par dag pa dang / chags bral rnam par dag pa dang / chags pa bar ma rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: gsum ste / chags pa rnam par dag pa dang / chags bral rnam par dag pa dang / chags pa bar ma rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: the purification of passion, the purification of the absence of passion, and the purification of the intermediate state between passion and the absence of passion.

original: zung du 'jug pa la gnyis te /
analyzed: zung du 'jug pa la gnyis te /
translated: The union is twofold:

original: rgyu'i zung du 'jug pa dang / 'bras bu'i zung du 'jug go //
analyzed: rgyu'i zung du 'jug pa dang / 'bras bu'i zung du 'jug go //
translated: the union of the cause and the union of the result.

original: rgyu'i zung du 'jug pa la bzhi ste /
analyzed: rgyu'i zung du 'jug pa la bzhi ste /
translated: The union of the cause is fourfold:

original: nyan thos dang ; rnal 'byor spyod pa dang / dbu ma dang / sngags kyi dbye bas so //
analyzed: nyan thos dang ; rnal 'byor spyod pa dang / dbu ma dang / sngags kyi dbye bas so //
translated: the union of the cause according to the ≈õrƒÅvakas, the union of the cause according to the YogƒÅcƒÅra, the union of the cause according to the Madhyamaka, and the union of the cause according to the Mantra system.

original: 'bras bu la yang bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu la yang bzhi ste /
translated: The result is also fourfold,

original: rigs dang / yon tan dang / bya ba dang / rdzas kyi bye brag gis so //
analyzed: rigs dang / yon tan dang / bya ba dang / rdzas kyi bye brag gis so //
translated: by the distinctions of family, quality, action, and substance.

original: kun tu bsdus pas dbye ba nyi shu rtsa brgyad kyi ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: kun tu bsdus pas dbye ba nyi shu rtsa brgyad kyi ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: There are twenty-eight concentrations, distinguished by the complete withdrawal of the senses.

original: de rnams kyi don ni sngon du bshad zin to //
analyzed: de rnams kyi don ni sngon du bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of these has been explained previously.

original: de bzhin du yang phung po lnga dang 'byung ba chen po dang rnam par shes pa dang / dbang bskur ba dang / lam dang de bzhin gshegs pa dang / ye shes lnga'i ngo bo nyid rim pa lnga'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang phung po lnga dang 'byung ba chen po dang rnam par shes pa dang / dbang bskur ba dang / lam dang de bzhin gshegs pa dang / ye shes lnga'i ngo bo nyid rim pa lnga'o //
translated: Similarly, the five aggregates, the four great elements, consciousness, consecration, the path, the Tathagata, and the five intuitions are the five stages.

original: de la gzugs kyi phung po'i sku rnam par dag pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa ste /
analyzed: de la gzugs kyi phung po'i sku rnam par dag pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa ste /
translated: The stage of vajra repetition is the purification of the aggregate of form.

original: nges khrag dang khu ba las byung ba'i gzugs kyi phung po phra mo'i rnal 'byor gyis spong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges khrag dang khu ba las byung ba'i gzugs kyi phung po phra mo'i rnal 'byor gyis spong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it eliminates the subtle form of the aggregate of form, which arises from blood and semen, by means of the yoga of the subtle.üîΩThe stage of the mind of awakening is the purification of the aggregate of feeling. This is because it eliminates the aggregate of feeling, which arises from the enjoyment of objects, by means of the yoga of the drop.

original: tshor ba'i phung po rnam par dag pas sems rnam par dag pa ste bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa can gyi sems nges spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po rnam par dag pas sems rnam par dag pa ste bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa can gyi sems nges spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mind is purified by the purification of the aggregate of feeling, because the mind that has the aspect of pleasure, etc. is definitely abandoned.

original: 'du shes kyi phung po rnam par dag pas bdag byin gyis rlob pa ste /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi phung po rnam par dag pas bdag byin gyis rlob pa ste /
translated: The consecration of the self is by the purification of the aggregate of perception,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams kyi mtshan ma thams cad sgyu ma tsam du mthong bas so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams kyi mtshan ma thams cad sgyu ma tsam du mthong bas so //
translated: because all the signs of objects such as form are seen as mere illusion.

original: 'du byed kyi phung po rnam par dag pas mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa ste /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po rnam par dag pas mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa ste /
translated: The stage of manifest enlightenment is by the purification of the aggregate of disposition,

original: 'dod chags dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'dod chags bar pa'i 'du byed rnams des spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'dod chags bar pa'i 'du byed rnams des spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the dispositions of passion, passionlessness, and the passion of the interval are abandoned by that.

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po rnam par dag pa ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa ste /üîΩbag chags dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa'i phung po gnas gyur pas /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po rnam par dag pa ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa ste / bag chags dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa'i phung po gnas gyur pas /
translated: The stage of union is by the purification of the aggregate of consciousness,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rdo rje lta bu'i skur 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rdo rje lta bu'i skur 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the aggregate of consciousness with its propensities is transformed into the supramundane vajra-like body.

original: sa'i khams rnam par dag pas rdo rje bzlas pa ste sra ba'i gnas brgyad la brgyab pa las sngags skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa'i khams rnam par dag pas rdo rje bzlas pa ste sra ba'i gnas brgyad la brgyab pa las sngags skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The vajra repetition is the purification of the earth element, because the mantra is born from striking the eight places of hardness.

original: chu'i khams kyi rang bzhin ni sems rnam par dag pa ste des rnam shes dang ye shes kyi dri ma bkrus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chu'i khams kyi rang bzhin ni sems rnam par dag pa ste des rnam shes dang ye shes kyi dri ma bkrus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nature of the water element is the purification of the mind, because it washes the stains of consciousness and gnosis.

original: me'i khams kyi ngo bo nyid ni bdag la byin gyis rlob pa ste /
analyzed: me'i khams kyi ngo bo nyid ni bdag la byin gyis rlob pa ste /
translated: The essence of the fire element is the self-consecration,

original: des dngos po'i mtshan ma'i bud shing sgyu ma lta bu'i @81b ting nge 'dzin gyi mes bsregs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des dngos po'i mtshan ma'i bud shing sgyu ma lta bu'i @81b ting nge 'dzin gyi mes bsregs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it burns the fuel of the signs of entities with the fire of illusion-like meditative concentration.

original: rlung gi khams kyi ngo bo nyid mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa ste /
analyzed: rlung gi khams kyi ngo bo nyid mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa ste /
translated: The essence of the wind element is the stage of manifest enlightenment,

original: 'du byed thams cad 'od gsal ba des sbyangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad 'od gsal ba des sbyangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it purifies all compositional factors with that clear light.

original: nam mkha'i khams kyi ngo bo nyid zung du 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kyi ngo bo nyid zung du 'jug pa ste /
translated: The essence of the space element is union,

original: nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa mtha' yas shing dri ma med pa gnyis su med pa'i ye shes gcig pu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa mtha' yas shing dri ma med pa gnyis su med pa'i ye shes gcig pu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the sole, stainless, nondual gnosis that is infinite and similar to space.

original: de la rnam par shes pa lnga ni gzugs la sogs pa so sor snang ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid rnam par shes pa dang /
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pa lnga ni gzugs la sogs pa so sor snang ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid rnam par shes pa dang /
translated: The five consciousnesses are the consciousness that appears as individual forms, etc., the operative consciousness, the mental consciousness, the afflicted consciousness, and

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: the store consciousness.

original: de la gzugs la sogs pa'i so sor snang ba'i rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa ste de ni bzlas pa la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ngo bor gzugs la sogs pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gzugs la sogs pa'i so sor snang ba'i rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa ste de ni bzlas pa la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ngo bor gzugs la sogs pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The nature of the consciousness that appears as individual forms, etc., is the stage of vajra repetition, because one sees forms, etc., as the nature of all the buddhas through repetition, etc.

original: sgo lnga rnam par dag pa ni sems la dmigs pa thob pa'i rim pa ste /
analyzed: sgo lnga rnam par dag pa ni sems la dmigs pa thob pa'i rim pa ste /
translated: The purification of the five sense organs is the stage of attaining the object of mind,

original: snang ba thob pa la de thim pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba thob pa la de thim pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the attainment of light dissolves into it.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnam par dag pa ni bdag byin gyis rlob pa ste /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnam par dag pa ni bdag byin gyis rlob pa ste /
translated: The purification of the mental consciousness is the stage of self-consecration,üîΩbecause the mental consciousness is the basis of the appearance of all things.

original: sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin mngon du gyur pas yid kyi rnam par rtog pa nub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin mngon du gyur pas yid kyi rnam par rtog pa nub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the illusion-like meditative concentration becomes manifest, because the mental conceptualization has disappeared.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid rnam par dag pa ni mngon par byang chub pa ste bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa des sbyangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid rnam par dag pa ni mngon par byang chub pa ste bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa des sbyangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The purification of the afflicted mind is the manifest enlightenment, because it is purified of the afflictions such as the view of self.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rnam par dag pa ni zung du 'jug pa ste bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa thams cad rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pa nub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rnam par dag pa ni zung du 'jug pa ste bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa thams cad rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pa nub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The purification of the fundamental consciousness is the union, because the basis of all the consciousnesses, together with its habitual tendencies and all the obscurations, has disappeared.

original: dbang bskur ba lnga ni de la rig pa'i dbang gi ngo bo ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa ste rigs lnga'i rnam par shes pa rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba lnga ni de la rig pa'i dbang gi ngo bo ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa ste rigs lnga'i rnam par shes pa rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The five consecrations are: The essence of the knowledge consecration is the stage of vajra repetition, because the five kinds of consciousness are purified.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i dbang gi ngo bo ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa ste sa bcu pa las slar mi ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i dbang gi ngo bo ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa ste sa bcu pa las slar mi ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The essence of the irreversible consecration is the stage of the purification of the mind, because one does not turn back from the tenth stage.

original: gsang ba'i dbang gi ngo bo ni bdag la byin gyis rlob pa'i rim pa ste des ni kha dog dang dbyibs can ye shes kyi sku thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsang ba'i dbang gi ngo bo ni bdag la byin gyis rlob pa'i rim pa ste des ni kha dog dang dbyibs can ye shes kyi sku thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The essence of the secret initiation is the stage of self-consecration, because thereby one obtains the body of pristine awareness, which has color and shape.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: des dus brtsams nas de ni mi ldog pa //
analyzed: des dus brtsams nas de ni mi ldog pa //
translated: From that time on, one is irreversible.

original: de yi kha dog dbyibs dang phyag mtshan can //
analyzed: de yi kha dog dbyibs dang phyag mtshan can //
translated: Having the color, shape, and insignia of that [pristine awareness],

original: bsam gyis mi khyab rnam par smin pa'i sku //üîΩ@82a * // sdom pa de las bya ba byas pas thob //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab rnam par smin pa'i sku // @82a * // sdom pa de las bya ba byas pas thob //
translated: the inconceivable body of full maturation

original: ces byung ngo //
analyzed: ces byung ngo //
translated: is obtained from that vow through the performance of the rite.

original: shes rab ye shes kyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa ste des de thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab ye shes kyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa ste des de thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The essence of the pristine awareness through wisdom initiation is the stage of manifest enlightenment, because thereby one obtains that [pristine awareness].

original: ngag gi dbang bskur ba'i ngo bo ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa ste srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa ro gcig pa ste de kho na nyid thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngag gi dbang bskur ba'i ngo bo ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa ste srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa ro gcig pa ste de kho na nyid thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The essence of the initiation of the word is the stage of union, because thereby one obtains reality, which is the single taste of existence and nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: tshogs kyi lam gyi ngo bo nyid ni rdo rje bzlas pa ste /
analyzed: tshogs kyi lam gyi ngo bo nyid ni rdo rje bzlas pa ste /
translated: The essence of the path of accumulation is vajra repetition.

original: bzlas pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis mngon du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzlas pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis mngon du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it causes the realization of the twelve branches of repetition.

original: sbyor ba'i lam gyi ngo bo ni sems la dmigs pa ste snang ba la sogs pa'i ye shes kyi sa bcu la sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam gyi ngo bo ni sems la dmigs pa ste snang ba la sogs pa'i ye shes kyi sa bcu la sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The essence of the path of application is the contemplation of mind, because it is the application to the ten stages of intuition beginning with the stage of illumination.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi ngo bo ni rang byin gyis rlob pa ste /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi ngo bo ni rang byin gyis rlob pa ste /
translated: The essence of the path of seeing is the contemplation of self-consecration,

original: yan lag bdun dang ldan pa'i yid kyi rang bzhin gyi sku sgyu ma'i de kho na nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yan lag bdun dang ldan pa'i yid kyi rang bzhin gyi sku sgyu ma'i de kho na nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the seeing of the body of mind endowed with the seven limbs in the reality of the magical emanation.

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyi ngo bo ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa ste phyi dang nang gi mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyi ngo bo ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa ste phyi dang nang gi mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The essence of the path of meditation is the stage of manifest enlightenment, because it is endowed with the eight limbs of the path of the stages of manifest enlightenment, outer and inner.

original: mi slob pa'i lam gyi ngo bo ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa ste /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i lam gyi ngo bo ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa ste /
translated: The essence of the path of no learning is the stage of union,

original: de las slob pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las slob pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no cause of learning beyond it.

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyi ngo bo ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi ngo bo ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i ngo bo ste /
translated: The essence of Vairocana is the essence of vajra repetition,üîΩbecause it is the cause of the body of Vairocana.

original: rlung rnam par dag pas me long lta bu'i ha hu med par snang pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rlung rnam par dag pas me long lta bu'i ha hu med par snang pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since the wind is pure, the mirror-like [wisdom] appears without the sound of ha ha.

original: rin chen 'byung ldan gyi ngo bo ni sems rnam par dag pa ste rang bzhin gyis tshogs 'gog pas thams cad mnyam pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rin chen 'byung ldan gyi ngo bo ni sems rnam par dag pa ste rang bzhin gyis tshogs 'gog pas thams cad mnyam pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The nature of Ratnasa·πÉbhava is the pure mind, because of the cessation of the accumulation of intrinsic natures, everything becomes sameness.

original: snang ba mtha' yas kyi ngo bo ni bdag la byin gyis rlob pa ste chos thams cad sgyu ma nyid du so sor rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba mtha' yas kyi ngo bo ni bdag la byin gyis rlob pa ste chos thams cad sgyu ma nyid du so sor rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nature of AmitƒÅbha is the consecration of oneself, because of the discernment of all phenomena as illusion.

original: mi bskyod pa'i ngo bo ni mngon par byang chub pa ste 'od gsal ba ni shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa'i ngo bo ni mngon par byang chub pa ste 'od gsal ba ni shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nature of Ak·π£obhya is manifest enlightenment, because of the clear light, which is the wisdom of the completely pure realm of phenomena.

original: don yod grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa ste bya ba byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don yod grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa ste bya ba byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nature of Amoghasiddhi is the stage of union, because of the performance of activities.

original: ye shes lnga ni 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa dang dbyer med pa'i phyir ma bstan to //
analyzed: ye shes lnga ni 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa dang dbyer med pa'i phyir ma bstan to //
translated: The five wisdoms are not taught here because of being inseparable from the tathƒÅgatas.

original: gti mug rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo ni rdo rje bzlas pa ste /
analyzed: gti mug rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo ni rdo rje bzlas pa ste /
translated: The essence of the purification of delusion is the repetition of the vajra,

original: sngags thams cad la ma rmongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngags thams cad la ma rmongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not confused about all mantras.

original: zhe sdang rnam par dag pa ni sems rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: zhe sdang rnam par dag pa ni sems rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The purification of hatred is the purification of the mind,

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i rang bzhin dang snang ba thams cad la rnam par snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i rang bzhin dang snang ba thams cad la rnam par snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the nature of non-error and illuminates all appearances.

original: nga rgyal rnam par dag pa ni bdag byin @82b gyis rlob pa ste tha mal pa'i nga rgyal log pas so //
analyzed: nga rgyal rnam par dag pa ni bdag byin @82b gyis rlob pa ste tha mal pa'i nga rgyal log pas so //
translated: The purification of pride is the self-consecration, because it overturns ordinary pride.

original: 'dod chags rnam par dag pa ni mngon par byang chub pa ste 'dod chags thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags rnam par dag pa ni mngon par byang chub pa ste 'dod chags thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The purification of desire is the manifest enlightenment, because it abandons all desire.

original: lta ba rnam par dag pa ni zung du 'jug pa ste lta ba thams cad kyi dri ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta ba rnam par dag pa ni zung du 'jug pa ste lta ba thams cad kyi dri ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The purification of views is the union, because it is stainless with respect to all views.

original: ngag rnam par dag pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa ste ngag gi brjod pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngag rnam par dag pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa ste ngag gi brjod pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The purification of speech is the repetition of the vajra, because it abandons all verbal expressions.

original: sems rnam par dag pa ni /
analyzed: sems rnam par dag pa ni /
translated: The purification of the mind is the self-consecration,üîΩbecause it overturns the ordinary mind.

original: thams cad rnam par dag pa'i rim pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad rnam par dag pa'i rim pa ste /
translated: The stage of complete purity is

original: sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad 'gog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad 'gog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all minds and mental factors are stopped.

original: lus rnam par dag pa ni bdag la byin gyis rlob pa ste yid kyi rang bzhin gyi sku thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus rnam par dag pa ni bdag la byin gyis rlob pa ste yid kyi rang bzhin gyi sku thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The purity of the body is the consecration, because the body of the nature of mind is attained.üîΩBy that, the purity of the conventional truth is

original: des ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa rnam par dag pa ste thams cad sgyu ma tsam du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa rnam par dag pa ste thams cad sgyu ma tsam du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because everything is seen as mere illusion.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa rnam par dag pa ni mngon par byang chub pa ste 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid mngon du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa rnam par dag pa ni mngon par byang chub pa ste 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid mngon du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The purity of the ultimate truth is the manifest enlightenment, because the reality of clear light is made manifest.

original: bden pa gnyis ro gcig pa ni zung du 'jug pa ste mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi ngo bo yin pas so //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis ro gcig pa ni zung du 'jug pa ste mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi ngo bo yin pas so //
translated: The union is the single taste of the two truths, because it is the essence of the sphere of non-abiding nirvana.

original: de bzhin du nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyang gti mug la sogs par 'dus par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyang gti mug la sogs par 'dus par shes par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the secondary afflictions should be understood as included in delusion and so forth.üîΩThe correct inclusion of those is

original: de rnams yang dag bsdus pa ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de rnams yang dag bsdus pa ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: The summary of those is as follows.üîΩ

original: dbye ba thams cad gcig tu 'dus pa de yang rnam pa gnyis so//
analyzed: dbye ba thams cad gcig tu 'dus pa de yang rnam pa gnyis so//
translated: All divisions are included in one, and that is twofold.
